Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Sultanahmet sites”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Tdot
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in April over Easter. For this kind of hotel (small 3-star range), it met our expectations and we were generally happy with our stay. Key points are: - great location - 5 min walk to blue mosque and other key sites and less than 10 minutes to the tram line. - we got one of the larger rooms (207) which cost more than the regular size so it was spacious, well-appointed with nice fixtures/furniture and clean. Bed was basic, a little on the hard side but equipped with good comforter and pillows. Bathroom was a tad small, but normal for most hotels around here and shower was good - strong water pressure and hot water. - like most hotels in this area be prepared for climbing 2-3 flights of stairs to get to your room or request ground floor. - service was generally good - all staff members were helpful and friendly. - breakfast was served in a rooftop dining room with seating inside and out and a great view of the sea of Marmara. Decent spread with scrambled eggs, breads ,cheeses, fruits, cold cuts, jams etc. Also they serve tea every afternoon in the small lobby. If you're looking for a well-located, comfortable hotel to serve as a resting spot (given there's lots to see out and about in the city), this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: tripper_a
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and I must say its the best affordable hotel I have stayed in istanbul. Reception guys were very friendly and helped out with every little request and were always available. Rooms were very clean and everything was in perfect working order. Room service excellent. Breakfast was also very good with an excellent sea view. Location is great with only a few minutes walk to the blue mosque area or to the Bosporus. I really enjoyed the stay here and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “tashkonak hotel”
Reviews.Author: yassersoleimani
Reviews.Content: The very best hotel about every thing such place ,staff and every nice thing you accept.I highly recommend this hotel If you want to have a ger8 stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Sultanahmet Tashkonak Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LenaMN
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter went to Istanbul and stayed at Tashkonak. We really recomend this hotel to everyone! It is located in the old part of the city, near the Blue Mosque. The staff were all very nice and helpful. Specially the nightportier, Kenan, who really made us feel like home. Thank you Kenan! Our room was very nice and clean, the service good and the wiew from the terrace breathtaking! Next time we visit Istanbul weÂ´ll sure stay at Tashkonak again!

Reviews.Title: “The Tashkonak Hotel is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Neli d
Reviews.Content: ,good breakfast,excellent staff,safe place,quite area . In November/2011 was the second time I stayed in this hotel.In November/2011 was the second time I stayed in this hotel.Good break,I recommend this Tashkonak Hotel to Istambul visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Review on hotel Tashkonak”
Reviews.Author: hanna k
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in hotel Tashkonak for one week. Our friens recommended this place beforehand. The staff is super nice and helpful, hotel is small and cozy. The location of the hotel is great. We can definitely recommend hotel Tashkonak to Istanbul visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Tashkonak is the best!”
Reviews.Author: rose r
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Tashkonak for almost a week and we felt very welcome and very comfortable. The staff is very accomodating and freindly. They even helped us to book for some of our tours and restaurant reservations. The facilities are clean and our room is very cozy and warm. It's more than what we expected and the price is so reasonable. We are highly recommending this place to anyone who would like to visit Istanbul and if we have plans to go back again to istanbul, we will still choose this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tashkonak Review”
Reviews.Author: Mohan M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife in Dec. It is a good hotel, unless you are looking for luxury. Staff are very good and helpful, safe place, quite area, good breakfast... Overall, we were quite happy that we stayed in this hotel. Another advantage of the hotel is its promixity to tourist attractions, most of which are at walking distance

Reviews.Title: “A little shabby but great value for money”
Reviews.Author: LondonIrishlass
Reviews.Content: My first tip is to book your rooms via the hotel's own website it is much cheaper here than any of the booking sites. I only found this out after booking it through a booking site. We were flying into Sabia Gokcen airport which is quite far outside the city on the Asian side. I found it difficult to ascertain how to get to the hotel using the various methods from the airport so I booked a transfer with the hotel which was â‚¬50 each way which divided between three of us was fine. We had a 7 seater pick us up and drop us so it is good value for larger groups. I cannot say enough about the staff here they are absolutely wonderful. Ahmed in reception was very helpful with tips about the city and gave us excellent advise on using the Metro and the ferries (we didn't get a chance to take the ferry to the otherside). I was trying to get hold of family in Istanbul and he told me about the phone cards for the public phones which was a great help. I didn't catch the name of the lady who deals with the breakfasts in the morning but she was lovely and eager to help even though she had limited English. The breakfast is great, the hot part consists of scrambled eggs mixed with different things like meat or potatoes, a type of sausage and savoury turkish pastry. There are olives, cucumber, tomato, cheese and cold meats on offer as well as a variety of breads and cereals. One tip the peach juice is nicer than the orange juice which my friend told me tasted like cordial. The view from the restaurant is breathtaking - the Blue Mosque to the back and the Marmara sea to the front. I loved staring out at the flotilla of ships that seemed to sit there each morning. The rooms are the only real downfall. The average rooms are small and the double bed feels quite small by husband's feet were sticking out well over the end of the bed. We had to change rooms because we could not sleep in the original room which faced the street and the mosque. If you have not visited a Muslim country before be prepared for the early morning call the prayer. Added to this was the plethora of seagulls and the noise of cars gunning it up the hill outside. They very kindly changed our room to one facing out over the terrace we even got a little balcony - we couldn't use it due to the dreadful weather. The location is wonderful apart from being close to the main tourist attractions in Sultanahmet there are a number of restaurants in the immediate vicinity and a small supermarket where you can purchase some drinks to put in the fridge in your room. My criticisms of the hotel are these: the shower sealant had been affected by mould inside and looked quite dingy and this was the case in both bathrooms, the doors to the bedrooms and bathrooms were scuffed, they were doing up the reception area so it got a little noisy and dusty, the heating was not on during the day and trying to get the aircon unit to provide any heat proved too baffling for me and the hair dryer in my friend's room had bubbled in parts due to overheating. I would absolutely recommend this hotel as it is exceptional value for money and the service is second to none. This is not a four or five star hotel so do not come here expecting that level of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: muku89
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and new. Staff was very helpful and breakfast was nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who travels to Istanbul! There is mosque near the hotel, but it didn't disturb us at all. We stayed for 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: wafa m
Reviews.Content: I found the Tashkonak Hotel vexcellent, the location is comfortable , the service is excellent and the atmosphere is very friendly specially with the stuff! I recommend this holtel to everyone who wanna visit istambul.

Reviews.Title: “great location and excellent service :)”
Reviews.Author: nindi_18
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the tashkonak hotel for two nights with a friend, and overall we had a wonderful time! As a lot of people have said, the location was great, very near to the main tourists attractions such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, and Topkapi Palace, but the hotel is located well enough that its peaceful and not busy with noise. Most of all, what I liked the best about this place is the service provided by the staff. We were greeted warmly by the reception, he was very helpful, and we were given good suggestions on what to do in such a short period of time. The room is clean, spacey and girl-friendly (meaning there's a hairdryer!), and all the basic necessities. Also worth noting, the breakfast is great! There was a big selection of food, including traditional turkish choices, and for the money we paid for, overall it was very good value! Would definitely recommend this hotel to other visitors going to instanbul :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: It was our second visit at Tashkonak hotel. Best of all was the very friendly service and advice to all questions we had. Breakfast is complete and really much better than the standard in a Turkish 3-star hotel. The room was always very clean and during the cold days in January well warmed-up. The location of the hotel is very central. Most places of interest are within a walking distance. Its only a five minute walk to the tramway stop to get connection to distant places. We can advise this hotel to all people who are looking for a clean, well managed, central located, reasonably priced hotel with very kind stuff giving good tips for all activities. Due to the low soundproof of the old building and the muezzin normally crying early in the morning at turkey my wife used earplugs while sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “best things wrapped in such cheap price!!!”
Reviews.Author: supeririy
Reviews.Content: for my 1st trip to Istanbul, I and my friend stayed for 2 nights here in Tashkonak. We couldn't believe we are super lucky to find out this hotel got SUPER GORGEOUS AND CLEAN ROOM! on top of that super helpful and friendly staffs. The breakfast is "echt lekker" as the Dutch said and the dining room got amazing view at rooftop. We were lucky it was sunny and kind of warm when we got there though it was 2 days ago and still freezing here in Europe. The wifi worked super fine in our room at 2nd floor. The minibar got super cheap drinks with the exact same price as the supermarket. I have never found this kind of boutique hotel with such good facilities. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU TO STAY HERE DURING YOUR VISIT TO ISTANBUL!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lailo1
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff. Complimentary breakfast was plentiful, there was a selection of hot food and the servers were attentive. Hotel was close to everwhere you should be in Istanbul, the blue mosque, aya sofia, etc. The free WIFI service was excellent, the courtyard is a good place to converge and have drinks with friends after a long day of sight seeing. You also get a kettle, microwave, mini fridge and a little kitchen area in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahaisha
Reviews.Content: Our stay at tashkonk was wonderful as the staff always had smile on their face and were so friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is close to restaurants, shopping, the blue mosqe etc. Furthermore the hotel arranged some tours for us which were wonderful where the tours were worth every penny. The breakfast at the terrace was so nice with a remarkable view. The breakfast buffet was very nice with a great variety of food. The rooms are very clean and well sized. All in all the of undoubtedly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aisha A
Reviews.Content: Tashkonak hotel met my expectations and more so. The staff had an excellent service and were ready to help around the clock. The rooms were very very clean and were cleaned daily. We expirienced a wonderful treatment from the staff that always were smiling no matter what. We will definitely stay at Tashkonak hotel very soon. Tashkonak hotel made our vist to Istanbul much much better especially with their good guiding. The breakfast was superb. So all in all we liked everything about the hotel and will definitely recommend people that are going to Istanbul to stay at Tashkonak hotel because it was realy a pleasure to stay there !!!

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: traveller122333
Reviews.Content: I recently had the chance to stay at this hotel for visiting Sultanahmet and the historical peninsula. Surprised by the hospitality and friendliness of the staff compared with the large hotels that I used to stay during business trips. There were guests who year after year stayed at this hotel. Rooms are not big but very nicely decorated (with paintings, etc) which blends nicely with the historical neighbourhood. In addition to being friendly the staff was always polite, helpful and informative. Location of the hotel was just a walking distance to historical spots and tram. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to visit major tourist spots in Ä°stanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to explore Sultanahmet and more”
Reviews.Author: Stefan M
Reviews.Content: A fine place - like family run. Warm welcome, excellent airport transfer (bang in time, and free if you stay longer). Breakfast: wide selection of local food, freshly prepared. Very helpful and friendly staff, free Internet access (wireless access and PC for public use). Large, well decorated room with SAT-TV (including CNN and BBC World) as well as refrigerator with free bottled mineral water. Efficient air conditioning and heating. Kingsize-bed with adjustable reading lamps has really been a pleasure to sleep on. Free self-service tea-preparation in the lobby and a choice of well known Istanbul guide-books to read. Roof terrace with unspoiled view of Marmara Sea, Bosporus and Blue Mosque. Quite location, however not far from main tourist attractions as well as public transport (tram, metro, ferry) Excellent value for money. We stayed here for 7 nights and we can recommend this hotel in every aspect - not only for first time visitors to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Tashkonak Suite”
Reviews.Author: anthonycotter
Reviews.Content: For a long term stay in the heart of Istanbul, the suite was a perfect choice. Nice and warm, and very quiet, but close to Tashkonak Hotel for fine breakfasts in the panoramic terrace. Wonderful views of shipping passing through one of the busiest waterways in the world. Staff and owners always had the time to talk, and offer advice. A multi lingual English lady, Annalie, presides over the breakfast, and is able to offer good ideas for visits and tours. It was a pleasant place to while away a month, albeit during the worst snowfall in 35 years. We shall be back, God willing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, homely base for exploring Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Margaret R
Reviews.Content: We were made to feel at home straight away, and I was even encouraged to practise my limited Turkish, though it was hardly necessary as staff spoke good English. The hotel was a perfect base for exploring any area of Istanbul - we walked most places, to major sites and to the ferry port or tram station for trips further afield. All very easy, knowing we had such a comfortable, central "home" for the week. The view from the roof terrace is outstanding and breakfast there is a great way to start thinking about the day ahead and all its possibilities. The hotel itself is attractive and cosy, in an area steeped in history. Will definitely stay there again next time! Thanks especially to Ahmet Bey!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LeanneMarmaris
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days and would recommend for any travellers to the Sultan Ahmet area. Literally around the corner from the Blue mosque and Hagia sophia we were able to hit the majority of sights in just 2 days due to the closeness of the hotel to where we wanted to be. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the breakfast was good, served on the roof terrace with amazing views of the sea. The room was warm and immaculately cleaned every day, Well worth what we paid and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn H
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here! Our rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff was very courteous and helpful in answering all our questions, and there was a wonderful variety to choose from at breakfast. It's a 5 to 10 minute walk from all of the most popular sites to see and from public transportation to venture out further. Istanbul was beautiful in the winter with a layer of snow on everything. We met many other guests who were repeat customers and we will do the same!

Reviews.Title: “It's a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Evelynchi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 days. Stuff are helpful! Good location and wonderful breakfast! If we back to Istanbul, we want to be there again!

Reviews.Title: “An Incredible Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: PastryNinja
Reviews.Content: What an excellent find - I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. My husband and I stayed for five nights in January 2012 and couldn't have been happier with the experience. Our room was gorgeous, and expertly cleaned every day. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the heater kept us nice and toasty. The hotel itself is tucked down a tiny side street, and it's very quiet at night. Breakfast is included, and what a feast! There was something for everyone, mostly homemade, and all the Turkish black tea you could drink. Plus, the view from the breakfast cafe is unparalleled, and was a wonderful start to our mornings. We met many people from all over the world each morning, and there was a definite sense of community among the patrons. You're within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, the Hagia Sophia museum, the Grand Bazaar and the Topkapi palace, and the Spice Bazaar is only about a 15-20 minute walk away. I also highly recommend you take the tiny ferry to Eyup (ask the staff where to find the ferry building as it's a bit hidden away) for only 2TL per person - a lovely little town practically devoid of tourists. But the real treasure of this hotel is the staff. We became fast friends with almost all of the front-desk folks, the woman who cleaned our room and the women who run the breakfast cafe. They were always more than happy to help us find a point of interest, suggest a local place to eat (try Doy Doy - delicious!) and help us with our lamentable Turkish. It was like coming home every evening, and for a couple of travelers who've been on the move for almost six months we were so incredibly grateful for that feeling. Thank you, staff of the Tashkonak Hotel, for everything, and for making us feel like part of your family - even for our brief stay. We look forward to returning with a bigger Turkish vocabulary, and hopefully without our snow shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Charming Hotel Overlooking Marmara Sea”
Reviews.Author: Ishtiaq V
Reviews.Content: My family of four had a wonderful stay for a week at Tashkonak Hotel in a family suite overlooking the Marmara Sea. It felt like home - i.e. like living in a nice apartment. The staff was friendly and very helpful in providing guidance on tourist spots to visit and arranging for our tours. This hotel had the best breakfast selection with a vast array of breads, jams, egg specialties, and typical Turkish relishes. The view from the restaurant of Marmara Sea was spectacular, as we enjoyed breakfast! Overall, this cosy hotel is in a great central location near the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, and Topkapi Palace and close to good restaurants, shops, travel agents and public transportation. We walked to many tourist attractions and hopped on the tram to visit other places further away. The atmosphere, scenery and people made this a wonderful family experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Fa S
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in sultanhamet. Very kind staff, clean rooms, central position, good price, great breakfast and beautiful view from upside. Fabrizio

Reviews.Title: “Lovely week thank you”
Reviews.Author: Roger H
Reviews.Content: A little off the beaten track down a side street, yet within a five minute walk of Istanbul's top sights, we found this to be a perfect retreat. Ahmet and Imir on reception were real gentlemen and the staff on the breakfast buffet were attentive and polite. Plus you get a super view of the Sea of Marmara, with the shipping waiting to go through the Bosphorus. See other reviews for the excellence of the breakfast, my personal recommendation would be the home made marmalade - scrumptious! We visited in chilly January and were always glad to get back from our day's explorations to a cosy warm room. If, like us, you are on a budget there are two or three inexpensive but friendly restaurants close by for evening meals. By all means go to the sights, but take time too to go downhill to see a little of native Istanbul - the Armenian Church in Kumkapi was one of our most unusual discoveries.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and nice place with home atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: OwlTraveller
Reviews.Content: Hello! First of all, this small hotel is a nice place with a pleasant home atmosphere. The staff is friendly, kind and helpful, the smile on thier faces is sincere. The location is very good - close to main sights, but in silent place and that is perfect. Room is clean. Large double room has optimal area for pleasant staying in room, when you have such wish. Matrasses are comfortable (close to hard). Room was warm, that is important when you are staying there in winter. Breakfasts are held on the terrace with a beautiful view to Marmara Sea. Food is optimal. Everybody can find something tasty for himself. There are vegetables, seasonal fruits, cheeses, yoghurt, milk, jams, honey, omelettes, olives and at alia, coffe, only black tea. Everything is very tasty. We are glad to our choice and happy with stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tashkonak, like staying with family...”
Reviews.Author: DrHemlock118
Reviews.Content: You can't wrong with the location or the service in this cozy, family-run hotel in walking distance of all the major sites. Located in Sultanahmet district, this quaint hotel is a very short walk from the Marmara sea as well as Ayasofia mosque, Blue mosque, Grand Bazaar, good restaurants, bars, little shops, and stores to get essentials, etc. We stayed for 3 nights, and from the first moment to the last, we were welcomed with open arms. We traveled with my sister and brother-in-law and their 11month old baby, and we felt right at home. We arrived at 10:30am after a long flight, and they were able to give us our rooms immediately so that we could freshen up and take care of the baby. They always had good advice on where to go, as well as some decent Turkish coffee when we started to run down. The breakfast buffet is great - mix of European and Middle-Eastern foods. And you eat overlooking the Marmara Sea and can even eat out in the courtyard or on the rooftop veranda where you can see the Blue Mosque. If you're looking for sugary doughnuts and waffles of a typical American breakfast, go to an American chain hotel. However, if you typically like to stay in a traditional location and try to use the language and learn about the culture, stay at Tashkonak! After breakfast on the second day, they even offered to wash our baby bottles in their dishwasher because we didn't have a good place to clean them well - this example typifies their service and family atmosphere. The only minor things, which are not complaints, but just to give travelers a heads up are that the beds are a little hard. I recommend that they add some small pillow tops to the beds. And for those of you who have a room that faces the street, there is a local Mosque that has the sunrise call to prayer which is pretty loud because it's right across the street. I personally love the call to prayer sound, and I woke up and took a walk on the deserted cobblestone streets at 6am every morning, but if you like to sleep in a little and you think the call to prayer will wake you, then ask for a room on the backside of the hotel. You'll still hear call to prayer (it's a Muslim-majority country after all), but on the backside, the sound is more muffled. Enjoy and tell Savash (Owner's son) hello!

Reviews.Title: “Real ottoman experience”
Reviews.Author: angkoni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tashkonak from 27 to 30 December. This was my second time in Istanbul. The location is so great, Agia Sofia was practically our neighbourhood. Lovely building, traditional konak (wooden, multi-floor, no lift), very helpful staff, nice breakfast on a terrace overlooking the Marmara sea. Not too close to restaurants and night life, but the best for sight-seeing and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in a clean, cozy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Monica A
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room for two days and ended up staying 7 nights. It was very cozy and extremely clean. Staff was very helpful, professional and friendly. Breakfast was varied and served up to 10:30 in a covered terrace with a view to the Bosforo. Very good value for money, and a very pleasant stay near the main touristic sites.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: tiggertravel72
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful. The included breakfast was also fantastic. Staff were knowledgable with all the places and highlights to see and great at setting up tours for you. I had a pick up at 5am and the staff made sure to pack me a breakfast to take with me. It is difficult to find the hotel so use their free pick up, though I did use local trains just get a taxi at the train stop to hotel. The rooms were nice and simple for the price and location is great. They also kept my luggage while I went to Cappadocia for a few days .

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our Istanbul trip”
Reviews.Author: KetanMohile
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at during our trip to Istanbul. We stayed here for 2N before we headed out to Izmir and Cappadocia. We had lined up the Airport transfer with the hotel and the transfer was right on time and very efficient. It is slightly difficult to get to the hotel on Public transport. To get here, you can take the metro from the airport to the tram changeover station (Zeytinburnu). Catch the tram from this station to the Sultanahmet tram station. From there its a 10 minute walk (downhill) to get to the hotel Once we got here, check in was quick and our room was great. The only downside was that it was on the Ground floor. No other rooms were available since they were sold out for the Christmas weekend. Ahmed at the front desk was very helpful in pointing out how we could walk to nearby attractions and also educating us about the tram/metro system. All major attractions are a 5-10 minute walk away. The rooms are nice, clean and spacious. The beds are great and the decor of the rooms was also nice and quirky. The breakfast is served on the rooftop restaurant. From here you can watch across the Bospherous and look at the Seagulls flying across. The breakfast spread is great with lots of home cooked bread, cheese and fresh fruits. Especially loved the Peach juice being served. We had booked a further 3N with the Tashknoak Suites and wanted to leave our luggage back at this hotel while we took our trip. They gladly kept our luggage with them for a week and also sent it across to our room which was in the next building on the return leg. Do note that they offer a 8% discount for a Cash payment which I thought was a great bonus. The free wi-fi made it very easy to stay in touch with friends. There is also a PC in the lobby which you can use to send out emails or check facebook. All in all, a great hotel offering a nice comfortable stay close to all the major attractions

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--Wish we had chosen a better room”
Reviews.Author: DanielS_E_Asia
Reviews.Content: I'll go from big to small. First the country, Turkey, was chosen for the May 9th "Victory in Europe" holiday weekend primarily because our first choice, Georgia, was frustrated by visa bureaucracy. This development had us scrambling for alternatives for our first escape from Baku. Visa-friendly Turkey and its capital was a no brainer Plan B. As my wife was a first timer (and I had not been to Istanbul in about 15 years) we chose the Sultanamet section of town, with all its nearby sites. True to the hotel's word, things were quite close. Everything in Sultanamet was a brief walk away. The hotel itself was also quite lovely, with a very charming, authentic feel. The upstairs dining room where breakfast was served offered great views on sunny days. The service was quite good as well. Friendly and helpful, though I did get the sense that the managers were interested in steering us to various packaged tours, only one of which we took (a Bosphorous Trip), and which turned out to be a bit of a disappointment. On several days of our stay, a very friendly English woman would show up (she appeared to be some sort of consultant for the hotel) and she gave us great advice and perspectives on things. I should have listened to her more about the choice of boat trips. The only downside was our room. Though clean with a sufficiently comfortable bed, big enough for me, my wife and our then one-year-old son, there was barely enough room to stand up otherwise. Across the hall, friends of ours stayed in a much larger accommodation with more than enough space. If I could do it all over again, I would have looked at this issue more closely before choosing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to all the major attractions”
Reviews.Author: P V
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in December in Tashkonak. Transfer from airport was smooth and fast. Room was clean and nicely decorated and was cleaned every day. Hotel is located on Sultanahmet and it takes approximately 5 minutes of walking to reach Haghia Sophia, Hippodrome and Blue Mosque. Staff was very friendly (greetings to Hayati). Food was delicious and restaurant is on the top of hotel with a nice sea view. I am highly recommending this hotel. Also, do not hesitate to visit Istanbul in December, the weather was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: CyprusAnnie
Reviews.Content: As I say in the title of this review we would definitely stay at the Tashkonak Hotel again. It is right in the heart of Sultanhamet and ideally located for sightseeing in Istanbul. We have been to Istanbul before so knew the area fairly well, a car is not needed if you are staying in the city as the public transport is fantastic and amazingly cheap. Back to the hotel, the staff are wonderful, very helpful and attend to your every need. The hotel room we stayed in was fine, not massive but perfectly acceptable. Bathroom had a very good shower and plenty of hot water. We travelled in late November and the room was nice and warm. We missed tea/coffee making facilities in the room BUT a kettle and tea is provided in the foyer/reception area from 3pm to 8pm in the afternoon. This is FREE! They also provide nice coffees to your room if you wish, again at a very reasonable cost. Breakfast is served upstairs, the room has fantastic sea views. Breakfast itself was very nice, plenty of choice to suit everones tastes. The staff were very nice and friendly. We stayed for 4 nights and the cost included pick up from the airport in a very nice people carrier, we were the only passengers. We paid to travel back to the airport in the same manner, there are cheaper alternatives but they run at specific times and it would have meant a long wait at the airport. All in all another lovely trip to Istanbul, we are planning to go again in the Spring and will definitely be staying at the Tashkonak.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Istanbul- Tashkonak”
Reviews.Author: sateesh k
Reviews.Content: Hi All, Stay is Istanbul ofr 4 days was a very good expereince. Tashkonak hotel staff was very freindly and accomadating. My all requests are fulfilled, I feel here staff works with heart and there was always a freindly smile on all staff members. I would like to recommend to all as location of hotel was great as it is so near to Blue mosque and I have to say Breakfast is one of the great things to start with, lot of choices for all types of people. Manager Haiti( sorry for spelling error) was very good in suggesting according to our available time. It would not have been this great if I was not at Tashkonak. If rooms can be made little more sound proof it will be very very good hotel. With My past experience stays in other hotels I feel this hotel deserves 5/5. All the best guys. Sateesh

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Tashkonak Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jcguido
Reviews.Content: The Tashkonak Hotel is a cosy little hotel more or less around the corner from Sultanamet Square. We stayed for three nights and occupied room 305 which was at the front of the hotel, over reception and underneath the breakfast room. Noise from within the hotel was minimal and although staff must have been busy in the early morning getting breakfast ready there were no loud noises or voices. There was some noise from outside however, either from passing traffic or trains. Our room was clean, tastefully decorated and furnished in a typically Turkish style and suited our needs for our short stay. Breakfast was basic as far as British tastes go but there was enough choice to have something different each day. The homemade jams were delicious! Great location, fantastic views from the breakfast room and friendly staff. We shall certainly recommend this hotel to our friends and would return ourselves in the future.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Cannot do Any Better than Here”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: This is one of the greatest hotels of any size I have ever stayed at. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The Area is great, with excellent restaurants just south of Blue Mosque and all the attractions of the area. The breakfest in the morning is an excellent way to start the day, and I wont spoil the view...but there is a wonderful view. Istanbul is now a regular stop for my us and hotel Tashkonak is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ChampagnePaulie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the positive reviews on Tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. Our flight got in quite late and by the time we made our own way to the hotel it was after midnight but the staff were waiting for us. We had room 106 which wasn't far from reception. Our room faced the street but we weren't bothered with the noise. There was a shared computer just off reception and Wi-Fi. We could get Wi-Fi in our room but I did hear someone else say they had to go to the seating area near reception. The room wasn't huge but it was big enough for us. The shower room was nicely tiled, clean and modern and we had no problem with the hot water. The breakfast room had lovely views towards the Blue Mosque on one side to the sea on the other. Breakfast was from 7.30am to 10.30am. It was a shame we hadn't gone in the summer when we would have been able to sit outside. The breakfast buffet had quite a choice of cooked meats and cheeses, salad items and scrambled eggs. The fresh rolls and breads were gorgeous and the wild plum jam was so moreish. The hotel is really well situated for sightseeing and we would certainly stay there again if we go back to Istanbul. The staff were all really helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Tashkonak”
Reviews.Author: MadridDevera
Reviews.Content: Great location in Sultanamet, near tourist attractions and endless shopping... very clean and organized...friendly, helpful and professional staff...

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Everything a boutique hotel should be.”
Reviews.Author: slipknotmaggot
Reviews.Content: After reading TripAdvisor reviews we booked the Tashkonak. On arriving at the airport we were met by our transfer car and taken direct to the hotel. Professional and a good start. We received an excellent welcome and Hayati and the other staff were very welcoming. Our room was on the small side but perfectly OK. Hayati gave us a rundown of all the local attractions and suggested some tours we may like to take. We have been to Istanbul before but it was great that he took the time to do this. And it's not for show. We saw all guests get the same treatment! A lot of hotels could learn from this!! The reception staff were always on hand if you had any questions and we had a couple of really good 'general chats' about 'stuff'. No tea making facilities in the room but free tea is laid on in the foyer from 3pm every afternoon!! Breakfast. Mostly cold buffet and cereals but enough choice with meats, cheeses, jams, fresh bread, juice, team and fresh coffee. So plenty to eat to send you on your way for the day. Perhaps a bit of variety would be nice but that's being pretty picky. Breakfast room on top floor with superb views!! The hotel is very clean and tidy and the room service was excellent too. There were a couple of minor things that were not 100% but to be honest, if you have to complain about trivia, get on the TV show '4 in a bed'! The hotel is in a great location just a short walk from the big local attractions. We booked a transfer from the hotel back to the airport. You can share with others for â‚¬5 ea but we felt the personal service offered was worth â‚¬10 each and the transfer was impeccable too. This is great as you get the transfer when you want, not at set times as offered at many places locally. It's a choice thing. Would I stay here again? Definitely. For the price this hotel was a hit for us! OTHER STUFF Local restaurants. Tamara!! (3 mins from hotel). YES!! Great prices and superb food. BIG meal for 2 just 60tl. No alcohol served. Hippodrome (3 mins from hotel)?? NO! This is meant to be a licensed place. My full kebab didn't have the lamb chop but some tasteless frozen chicken thing. No apology until I asked why I had not been served what I ordered. Got some weak excuse about the boss not having all the ingredients. BASIL!!!!!!! Do try the Red Bus tour. Very good! The Dolmabache Palace is also worth a visit and at 40tl each it's worth it if you like stately home type visits. Wander around the spice market and grand bazaar (15 min walk from hotel). No visit to Istanbul would be complete without that. Barter for anything you buy but you may also be able to buy cheaper elsewhere!!! There are dozens of places to eat with lunch available from just 3-4tl EACH! Loads of choice, even in the Taksim Sq area. Take a ferry to the Asian side from Dock 4 (35 minute walk from hotel) at Eminonou next to the Galata Bridge. Some great photo opportunities. Public transport. Top marks for the lot! Dolmus... public minibus' that go all over the place, 2.50tl each per trip. Tram. 2tl per ride. Metro. 2tl per ride. Excellent way to get around! We did hear of one guest who got turned over by a local taxi driver for a short trip. The hotel even tried to get that sorted. So I guess the answer would be to get the price before you start! Again.. would highly recommend Istanbul as a place to visit and the Tashkonak as your hotel base!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: retracs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights at the Tashkonak in Nov 2011. Airport pickup worked perfectly. Breakfast, fantastic with yogourt, honey, wild plum jam, all sorts of olives,omlette, coco pops for those who eat rubbish, teas, coffee, crusty fresh bread, the list goes on. Staff friendly and helpful to the tune of giving lessons for playing cura! Room a tad small but we wern't in it much. WiFi worked ok. Location great, handy for Sultan Ahmet Camii. Would stay but too many places on Earth to visit. Teseker ederim. Rod n Karen. Up north

Reviews.Title: “what else??”
Reviews.Author: sakis13
Reviews.Content: when u go on a trip to have fun and get strength for the rest of yr life u need sth nice to remember!! so,this hotel had these "things"... very polite staff...very clean room...great position... an old house of istanbul with no elevator(if it had it would surely ruin the image of the hotel) with a great view from the breakfast room which was rich in supplies... having 6 days res we also had and a free transfer from and to a/p... without 2nd thought when i wl go again wl be my 1st option to stay!! i cannot rate a gym 'cause it didn't had....and i don't think that when u go to such a place u need gym....

Reviews.Title: “loved tashkonak!”
Reviews.Author: sookie_01
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Tashkonak hotel for a week in november. We had booked a taxi transfer with the hotel and this was arranged for us with a professional company. The hotel staff from the manager, to front desk, to room service, were all really friendly, welcoming and accommodating. We originally booked 3 nights as we were not sure if we were going to stay in Istanbul the whole week, or what we wanted to do, but we ended up staying 8 nights all up, and the staff were really understanding, letting us add on an extra night ect and it was no problem at all. The rooms were cleaned each day with fresh towels. Breakfast each morning was simple but good. You really dont want a big breakfast as the kebabs you will have later will make up for it. The hotel is short walk to Blue mosque, Aya Sophia, the palace, and a tram stop (which is only a few stops to the spice market and grand bazzar and the new town so it is a good location). There are a few nice restaurants near the hotel, such as Tamara, very cheap and yummy. Overall would highly recommend this place if you are looking for a nice, affordable hotel to stay in while you are doing some sight seeing in Istanbul. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Client-oriented”
Reviews.Author: Mari1005
Reviews.Content: Really impressed by hotel staff service. Personnel always smiling and friendly. Reception guys are always ready and eager to help - every morning we were coming down and saw 2 or 3 tourists asking questions and receiving explicit information. We have been provided with the free transfer from the airport and a receptionist organized a transfer to the airport for a very good price . We had no problems with computer access and our boarding passes were printed by the hotel. Breakfast - very good , including local specialities and absolutely fantastic apricot jam! Irresistible combination of delicious food and magnificent sea view .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanni1980
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, good service, clean rooms, fair price. Quiet! :)

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the breakfast room.”
Reviews.Author: rwscruggs2
Reviews.Content: Overall an okay hotel. The staff were always eager to help. Our room was really small, and the mattress was more than a little on the hard side. Location was a big plus. But what made this place memorable for us was the view from the breakfast room, which we also took advantage of with a bottle of wine on a couple of evenings. We'd probably try a different hotel if we went back to Istanbul but we enjoyed our time at the Tashkonak.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place in the middle of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: doculik
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in terms of service and cleanliness. The location is also top-notch, in the middle of Sultanahmet, which has its ups and downs: very close to Agia Sofia and the 'Blue Mosque', however you need to get your bearings right, otherwise you can easily get lost in that labyrinth of streets. Anyway, back to the hotel: extremely professional staff. The amenities in the rooms were quite basic, but in perfect working order. And the room was spotless. Conclusion: it's not a business hotel, it specifically targets tourists and offers great service for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: shez84doha
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice in terms of comfort and the staff behaviour. The staffs were very welcoming. The room is fantastic even though it was bit small.There is a small garden were we can chill out. The breakfast was fine with a nice view of the marmara sea. We explored the whole of Istanbul just because of the receptionist Mr Hayati. He guided us in all way like here to go and the specialty in each place. i would highly recommend Tashkonak.

Reviews.Title: “there are better places to stay in Istanbul for this price”
Reviews.Author: 758aroundmyworld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad. But we stayed in 3 different hotels in Istanbul and this was the worst value. For the 65 euros payed and the 80 euros they wanted for a second stay, you can definitely find a better hotel. Breakfast is ok, room is very small but ok, location is good and breakfast terrace offers a great view. Staff is very eager to help you also when you don't need help :-) In summary, there is no major problem with this hotel but simply you can find some cheaper rooms of the same quality or stay in a much better hotel for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home - 2”
Reviews.Author: fdbbas
Reviews.Content: We (Australian & Australian Turk) have just returned from a 6 week holiday in Turkey. Our first week was in Istanbul where we stayed at Tashkonak. Our stay in this hotel ended up being a fantastic experience. So much so that we returned there for another 4 days before we flew out of Turkey. Tashkonak is not only location, location, location. It is the whole package with its amenities and especially its staff. We couldnâ€™t agree more with the remarks made by JBL_10. They took the words out our mouth. We had a very similar experience. Although we didnâ€™t spent much time in the hotel itself, each time we left and came back we felt the warm welcoming attitude of the staff. We felt special, spoilt and part of the family. Thatâ€™s why we also felt that it was a home away from home. We didnâ€™t require the assistance of any of the local Information Offices in Istanbul. The staff is well-informed and they provided us with many helpful recommendations relating to sightseeing and restaurants. They are real ambassadors for Turkey and especially Istanbul. Here are some of the things they did for us; â€¢ Arranged a Bosporus day trip. (Picked up from the hotel and dropped back to the hotel) â€¢ Organised the car hire (rang multiple companies to get us the multiple quotes) â€¢ Arranged the repair of my broken necklace â€¢ Arranged the ferry tickets from Istanbul to Bandirma â€¢ Helped us with the leather jacket purchases â€¢ And so on Their assistance saved us a great deal of time and allowed us the luxury to spend more time at the places we wanted to see. We highly recommend Tashkonak to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant and friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 1968Allan
Reviews.Content: After a hectic week of making last-minute arrangements for our two-week holiday in Turkey, we were delighted to discover that the Hotel Tashkonak was indeed a 'lucky strike': an ideal place to stay during our week in Istanbul, and a place that was always pleasant to come back to after a long walk through one or another area of the city. The hotel's amenities have already been amply described by other reviewers: its clean, comfortable, air-conditioned rooms, each with a modern bathroom and - very important - excellent beds which always guaranteed a good night's sleep; the tasty and copious breakfasts on the roof terrace (with, yes, good coffee too!); a quiet garden patio for enjoying an afternoon cup of tea; and, last but not least, the courtesy and attentiveness of the staff who were always ready to fulfill our every wish. In this regard, I might mention that we were a five-member family group of two generations and mixed cultural backgrounds (German / French / Algerian), so it is particularly noteworthy â€“ and to the credit of the staff â€“ that each of us felt equally welcome and comfortable at the hotel. The very few small inconveniences (e.g., not much space for two suitcases in some of the rooms, no surface in the shower on which to place a bar of soap or bottle of shampoo, some noise from the general neighbourhood) were quite insignificant in comparison to the hotel's many advantages. Although Tashkonak is situated in the Sultanahmet area of the old city which abounds with tourist attractions and tourist facilities, its immediate location â€“ a fairly quiet side street â€“ still retains much of the flavour and atmosphere of 'old' Istanbul. I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the city and would enjoy staying there again should I be fortunate enough to return to Istanbul in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: JLB_10
Reviews.Content: I don't know that we could have a better experience at a hotel than we did at Tashkonak. Being our first time to Istanbul, and to Turkey, we put a lot of faith into Tashkonak as our choice of hotel because it's where we kicked off our vacation and where we came back to finish our vacation. In total, we were there for 6 superb nights, and when we returned for the end of our trip it felt as if we were coming home. We are a family of 4 adults, who desired one large room with a door separating two bedrooms. No problem. I'm convinced Tashkonak has the ideal room for any traveller. The rooms were comfortable, nicely decorated, one was small but with enough room, and the room we returned to at the end of the trip was more spacious. Again, I think there's a room to fit everyone's needs. The AC worked great, the bathrooms were nice, TVs in all rooms and free wireless internet. Stairs are the only option of ascending or descending the hotel, FYI. You'll also hear the calls to prayer loud and clear anywhere throughout the city, FYI. The glory continues in the location, extra amenities and the staff (especially Hayati): Extra Amenities Upon arrival, you're greeted with refreshments on the patio which is a warm welcome. Tea time on the patio is available all afternoons at your leisure. The breakfast is downright killer. The best breakfast we had in our two weeks+ of travels. The view of over the Marmara Sea magnificent, and the wide selection of food will definitely suit anyone's tastes: tea, coffee, selection of breads, sweet treats, fresh fruit, eggs (differently styles each day), meats, cheeses, olives, tomatoes, cucumbers, at least a couple different vegetable or pasta salads, savory pastries...I mean, come on! Lastly, when we had to get up at 3am to go to the airport, the staff kindly prepared us to-go breakfast boxes. They will do that for anyone who asks. Location This spot is ideal. On a comfy side street in Sultanahmet, which is only wide enough for one car, so while there's traffic, it's pretty dang quiet. It's approximately a 5 minute walk to the Arasta Bazaar, the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofya, the Hippodrome, a few more minutes to the Basilica Cistern, and perhaps 15 minutes to Topkapi Palace. Walking to the Grand Bazaar is about 15-20 minutes and to the Bosphorus or the Egyptian Spice Market is probably a half hour. I would ABSOLUTELY recommend staying on this side of the Bosphorus. Staff Hayati went out of his way for us on a daily basis, and by the end of it, we would have been happy to adopt him as an honorary family member. Our experience in Istanbul would not have been the same had he not made the recommendations that he did. The standouts were a Bosphorus/Black Sea cruise that was worth every penny (choosing a cruise is tough as there are many and they all want you to buy with them), so Hayati arranged that for us. He also gave us the best restaurant recommendations, and where possibly necessary, made reservations for us. He chatted with us every day, answered all of our questions patiently and happily, taught us a little bit of Turkish, welcomed us with open arms upon arrival and arranged for us to have to-go breakfast during the wee hours (3am) on our departure date. He is helpful, professional, friendly and caring. Just the right guy for the job. When we returned for the last portion of our trip at Tashkonak, we were as excited to see him as we were to be back in Istanbul. Although we dote on Hayati, the other staff members from the front desk to the breakfast area were very friendly, hospitable and all staff members are blessed with a fantastic sense of humor (which seems to be common in Turkey!). Tashkonak is highly recommended by us!

Reviews.Title: “Another very positive review for Hotel Tashkonak.”
Reviews.Author: 186338Eliza
Reviews.Content: This is to add another positive rating for the hotel, where we spent a couple of days earlier this month whilst exploring the Old City, and where we were treated with courtesy, kindness and consideration. This all added to our enjoyment of Istanbul. Being travellers of rather mature years, we found the hotel to be within walking distance of the main sights of the Sultanahmet but in a quiet local side street. It has a very pleasant roof terrace,(with great views of the Sea of Mamara and the shipping), where breakfast was laid out each morning and as a plus, a delightful small courtyard garden backed by a high old stone wall,perhaps belonging to the Blue Mosque complex?

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: LezahSwayHampshire
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the good reviews, location, and the cost. We would like to thank the staff who helped us with minor things like replacing a light bulb, providing extra pillows and coming to our rescue by letting us have a late check out because my husband was taken ill. Our room had a little balcony overlooking the garden. The bed was comfortable, air conditioning worked well, and the roof terrace has a superb view. Stairs would be difficult for anyone with mobility problems as there is no lift.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, slightly old-fashioned hotel with kind caring staff”
Reviews.Author: Maggienovelist
Reviews.Content: Just a very short (if uphill) walk from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the pillar which was once thought to be the centre of the ancient world, Tashkonak Hotel feels very safe and has a beautiful cool garden at the back where you are welcome to eat your own food in the evening while being served free Turkish tea. The highlight for me has been the breakfast on the roof terrace with fabulous views of the sea on both sides, treetops and birds - and the breakfast and coffee is good, too, particularly the tasty Turkish vegetables and the water melon - good bread of many kinds, salads, eggs etc. The staff all really make an effort to help and have a sense of humour. This isn't a palace, the rooms could be more modern, some things are a bit ramshackle, but there's everything I need. Don't be put off by the the foyer, which at first struck me as dated, but later, once I had found the showers were good and hot, the aircon worked and so did the free wireless, I saw it as charming and Turkish - like the staff. And there's an 8% discount for cash.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: SarahAddisAbaba
Reviews.Content: We were charmed by the Tashkonak Hotel in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. Although only a 2 minute walk from the Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and other landmarks, the Tashkonak offers an oasis of calm, situated in a quiet side street. It boasts both a rooftop terrace with magnificent views of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque, and a shady courtyard garden. The staff are friendly and helpful yet discreet. The Turkish breakfast is delicious and has something for every taste and the rooms clean, compact (take one of the larger rooms if you plan to hang out in the room) and reasonably priced. For a hotel with an aura of old world charm, family atmosphere, all mod cons and a fabulous location, the Tashkonak is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly and helpful staff, simple accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: DPLF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July for four nights during our honeymoon. We loved it and would come back! This was a recommendation from my father-in-law, who stayed here a couple of years ago. There are so many places to stay in Sultanahmet, and they all pretty much seem the same on the internet. We were happy to hear from him that Tashkonak was a great little place tucked away on a side street just a few blocks from the Blue Mosque. He described the fantastic service, the lovely morning breakfast on the rooftop with the view of the city and the sea, the convenience of being located right in the mix. This being our honeymoon, we were looking for somewhere nice enough to get a good night's sleep every night, but we were not seeking luxury accommodations in Istanbul because we knew we were only going to be in the room at night, and we were planning on more luxury type accommodations on a different portion of our trip. So we booked this place assuming it was going to meet our needs just fine, but it really exceeded them in a lot of ways! The staff was very friendly, and they were always ready to help us make some plans, find a place to eat or a hamam, provide info about a ferry or tour. They booked our shuttles to and from the airport, made us coffee when we got in and prepared some especially for us when we took a 5am shuttle out the day we departed. They even sent up a nice plate of fresh fruit for us on our second day. Breakfast on the roof is not to be missed. You will get a version of the standard Turkish breakfast which will include eggs, meat, cheese, breads, olives, yogurt, coffee, fruit, juice. It is a perfect way to start the day and you have views of the city and the Sea of Marmara from up there. We noticed an international crowd of visitors with a handful of other Americans mixed in. It was very nice to be in a place with people from all over. The location is perfect. It's nestled into a little side street just a few blocks from the Blue Mosque. From here you can easily walk to most of the old city sights and you can hop on the light rail/tram to other parts of the city. But although Sultanahmet is a very active and bustling place, Tashkonak is tucked away on a side street and it feels very peaceful and much removed from the action, which is nice when you are trying to sleep. We noticed a lot of other hotels which were right on main drags with cafes, restaurants, shops and a significantly more street activity. Tashkonak is a quick walk from the action, not right on top of it. One final note: Tashkonak does not provide state-of-the-art luxury accommodations. We stayed in a wonderfully decorated room that was quite large enough for our needs. There was no AC, and it was probably 90 degrees while we were there, but honestly it did not feel that hot in there. You're not going to get modern fixtures and furniture, flat screen TVs, huge bathrooms, double sinks, etc. You're going to get simple accommodations that provide a perfect base camp for a few days of adventures in the city. We loved this place and we will recommend to all of our friends, and if we come back to Istanbul, which I hope we do, we will stay at Tashkonak!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monica W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Taskhonak during my first trip to Istanbul and was pleased with the hotel. I had read a number of reviews praising the friendliness of the staff so perhaps I had bigger expectations. The family was friendly enough but was not extraordinarily helpful. The location of the hotel was fantasitc, a very short walk to the Blue Mosque and other tourist attractions, shopping, and restaurants. The breakfast in the morning was a definite highlight. The food was great and the view to the Marmara Sea was breathtaking. The only complaint I would have about the hotel is that the noise in the hallways can be very disturbing. There were some rude guests staying during the same time as myself who would return to their rooms at about three in the morning and then slam their doors. Because this is an older, historic building, the sound would travel and reverberate through my room. I woke up a few times and could not get a full night's sleep because of this. Just hope that when you stay here the other guests will be more considerate.

Reviews.Title: “Superb family hotel”
Reviews.Author: kidzdad
Reviews.Content: I booked our first family vacation to Istanbul, Turkey. We traveled as a family of five, including 3 children. The hotel is a quaint place in the heart of the Sultanahmet historic area. We we were on the third floor in a two room suite. One bedroom had a queen bed while the other had 3 beds. We had one bathroom to share. House keeping was timely, the rooms clean and a steady stock of clean linen, towels etc. was always available. The staff, especially, Hiyati, was incredibly helpful. Their knowledge of the city, ready willingness to provide cost effective solutions and time saving ideas were invaluable. Hiyati, in fact helped me prepare a customized private day tour to Bursa, the origin of the Ottoman empire. The guide he arranged, Tanner, was very personable, very knowledgeable and helpful. The morning breakfast buffet was extremely varied, plentiful and constantly replenished. We never lacked anything. The freshly baked bread and hot coffee got you charged up every morning. The staff was attentive, never leaving any dirty table. All the important areas are within 10-15 minutes of walking. Public transportation is easy to use and most convenient with a network of buses, trains, Metro and ferries.Wifi is available for free, so the kids kept up with Facebook, Soccer scores, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: myriam963
Reviews.Content: We spent one week in this hotel and we really enjoyed it. It was well situated, the staff was very friendly and the breakfast very pleasant with a wonderful view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: Iwan L
Reviews.Content: We returned there for the second time after 7 years and this august,2011 for 7 nights in total .we a family with now 2 teenaged kids. The hotel is located in the old part of Istanbul and just near the "Blue Mosque" .All highlights are almost at walking distance an dMr. Hayatti', front desk officer and his team made us feel home there. Although they are located in a busy area, the hotel itself is located in a quiet street, which is really a big plus. The rooms, we had 2, were good and located next to each other. The breakfast is a magnificent experience at the rooftop terrace, with a aview on the famous bleu Mosque at one side and the sea of Marmara at the other side. No, just a perfect hotel at the perfect spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Istanbul for the first time a couple weeks ago. I picked Hotel Tashkonak because of it's location to the old city sites. It was a great choice in location. But even better than that was the service. It is a family run hotel and everyone is so helpful with great recommendations for restaurants and site seeing, etc. I would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Small Boutique Hotel!Feels like family!”
Reviews.Author: Osmanfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tashkonak hotel for 2 nights while visiting Istanbul!We contacted the hotel for pick up service from the Ataturk intl airport and they arranged transportation for 25 euros each way!The rooms are pretty nice and roomy !with a kitchenette and a mini fridge!The breakfast was really good served on the Terrace with an amazing view of the Bosphorus!The staff treated us like family,especially Mr Hayati!He gave advice about everything ,and arranged a turkish night dinner for us ,which was really good,and presented a small gift for our youngest son before we left ,I really recommend this Hotel if you're visiting Istanbul.And our family will definetly be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel, Great Location - We loved it”
Reviews.Author: NQTravel
Reviews.Content: Thank you Hotel Tashkonak - we had a fabulous time! From the moment we arrived, we were taken care of. Our flight was early and were not sure if the hotel would let us check in early. But they were wonderful - our room was ready and we were escorted to it right away. A great relief when you are traveling with 3 kids. We stayed in the family room which had 3 extra beds along with the queen bed- plenty of room to move around and very clean. The staff was very helpful at all times. Breakfast on the terrace was wonderful. Great food, beautiful views and smiling faces to greet you :) The best part was the LOCATION ! Close to all attractions - we walked everywhere. All in all we had a memorable time - Thank you :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel but average room”
Reviews.Author: SuyoungKim
Reviews.Content: It's got nice character with garden and rooftop terrace and the staff were really friendly with all the help. However the room was small and old that made me question about value for money. It's fairly close to Blue Mosque but it's not so easy to find and I got lost number of times. Average breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: deeman80
Reviews.Content: This is very nice hotel in quite area,hotel very clean, room reasonable size with air condition staff very friendly, also you have safe in the room.the hotel very close to all tourist area including blue mosque , hajya sofea and kum kapy .grand bazar very close to.you could use tram every where or bus but taxi reasonably cheap,i will advice people to book shelter bus throw hotel is easer and less problem for you.

Reviews.Title: “It has goods and bads,overall...good hotel”
Reviews.Author: majeo
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family: wife, 2 years and 5 years for two nights. the hotels is situated waking distance from the main attractions you want to see in Istanbul and some very expensive restaurants. the hotel is small with no elevator, rooms are not roomy but very clean, loby is tiny and good luck with internet service, specially from your room. but the people attitude is great they where very helpfull bringing luggage to the 3 floor, and help us with anything else we needed which made our stay at this humble place very interesting, its ran by a family and we felt at home, so I can't complain I can stay there again when you there make sure you have brk-fast up stairs on the open terrace, but don't stay at the room directly under it because of the noise in the morning from dragging chairs, eat at taksimi square ,plenty restaurant good food and cheap $. next to the hotel there is a shuttle take you to IST airport with good price,waking distance is blue mosk,ayasofia church, shops and the main bazar.

Reviews.Title: “A "must" stay in Tashkonak”
Reviews.Author: drmrkhan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Tashkonak on 15th July. Our stay was until 20th July 2011. We're very impressed by the accommodation. Initially, we booked for a standard double room and when we reached there, the receptionist told us that it will be cheaper if we pay by cash rather than using a credit card. So we paid in cash and the receptionist was kind enough to inform us that he has upgraded our room from standard to suite. Maybe it's one of their surprises for those who pay by cash. Wow!! The suite was beautiful and comfortable to sleep. My wife loves the bathroom because it's spacious and clean. Our room was not on the same building as the receptionist area. It was located about 2 mins away. Look for Room No.32. It's beautiful and nice to sleep. The wifi is free and the best part of Tashkonak Hotel is they provide a free one way airport transfer from Istanbul Ataturk Airport to Tashkonak Hotel if you stay is longer. Be sure to ask them about airport transfer before you leave for Istanbul. Breakfast was amazing in the terrace. Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque,Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace are located within mins of walking. And laundry shop is just right in front of you! Don't forget to take a sightseeing tour by a bus! Before we left for the airport, 2 cups of turkish tea were given to us on the house. We'll definitely come back again but it will be a longer stay next time hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “We felt very comfortable in this hotel and coming once more to Istanbul we will choose it again.”
Reviews.Author: VeliVienna
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the staff the atmosphere in this hotel is very familiar. We felt like "coming home" when returning in the evenings from our daily trips. You get all the help you ask for at the reception. The buffet breakfast offers a great variety, beds are comfortable. The hotel is located very close to the most important sites like Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia (only a few minutes walk).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & attentive - the best service received thus far!”
Reviews.Author: LisaGabriel
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Tashkonak certainly added value to our holiday; the staff were very friendly and provided an excellent service to a high standard. In fact, they went out of their way to provide as much assistance as possible, exceeding your expectations. It's a cosy hotel providing all facilities required to make your stay homely & comfortable; the location is also good as it's within walking distance to a few of the major sights.

Reviews.Title: “We felt welcome”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGizmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tashkonak Hotel for 4 nights. The rooms were more authentic looking than other hotels I stayed before in Sultanahmet, and were very clean. We spent a couple of hours in the afternoons sitting in the back garden sipping our complimentary teas. The hotel management was very helpful, arranging a nice Bosphorous tour for us that was better than the standard tour departing from Eminonu. Good advice every time we needed it. The transfer to and from the airport was professional and it was nice to feel safe in the mad traffic of Istanbul. I was concerned about hearing trains before coming but did not really hear them at all. The hotel is close to a mosque and you can definitely hear the morning prayer call, though in Turkey you are almost guaranteed to be close to a mosque. The wireless internet connection worked with no issues. Overall, we had a great time and felt welcome and at home.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff in an awesome part of town!”
Reviews.Author: crzydvl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 1-4. Our flight arrived early morning and they held our bags for us until our room was ready and took them to the room. The room was comfortable, everything we expected for a little boutique hotel in the middle of everything. If you are expecting the Ritz, look somewhere else since this is not high end. The free breakfast buffet was very delicious. You have views of the Bosphorus from the roof top area, and there is a little garden down below with an abundance of greenery. The staff was very friendly and provided us with a map and details of what we should see. They also called us a cab and had him take us to a Turkish bath (not the one up the road from the hotel but a very old famous one that all the locals go to and is more reasonably priced). Would definitely stay here again if I made it back to Turkey. This was a great home base for our siteseeing adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SBell75
Reviews.Content: We just spent five very comfortable nights in the family room on the second floor at Hotel Tashkonak. This is an extremely friendly family run hotel. Everything is clean and well maintained, the beds are comfortable, excellent water pressure in the showers and a good Turkish breakfast served daily on the roof Terrance. We paid cash and took advantage of the discount they offer, also had a free oneway airport transfer included. The location is second to none, near several good restaurants and a shrt walk to the main attractions in the area (Blue mosque, Hagia Sofia etc), as a bonus we also found it very pleasant walking along the waterfront by Marmara sea to the fish market and several good fish restaurants, very lively on the weekend with locals - only 5 mins from the hotel. Highly recommended, no negatives. Very good with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: nazaaha
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel enough. The rooms were very nice and clean, and the service was amazing. The beds were a bit on the harder side, which I think is better than too soft. Breakfast had a nice selection and I always ate a bit too much because it was delicious. I burned myself on tea while I was there and they got me ice quite often, and then the next morning asked a woman who worked there to look at it. She put egg white on it and made it completely better! It's really close to the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. We walk a lot so we made it over to the newer side by foot, and traveled further afield by boat. There is not a huge selection of food. It's all very touristy there (restaurant-wise), but it makes up for it by having many of the prime sight-seeing locations nearby. One warning - there are seagulls that live on the mosque across the street. Bring earplugs. It does have air conditioning, so one could close the windows and muffle the noise that way, but I much prefer fresh air, so earplugs were wonderful! As my husband says, earplugs add an extra star to any hotel! We stayed in room 305.

Reviews.Title: “Great-would love to come back”
Reviews.Author: PeterCockrum Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful hotel with adequate but spotless facilities and run by friendly, courteous and genuinely caring folk. And then, there's the LOCATION!!-right there in Sultanahmet (the historical part of Istanbul). Where I live in Glenroy it takes me 18 minutes to walk to the nearest railway station - one evening I left the street cafe I was at (right opposite Constantine's Column and the entrance to the Covered Bazaar) and walked back to the Tashkonak-it took LESS THAN 15 MINUTES. In that time I passed the entrance to the Yerebatan Cistern, the Aya Sophia (once the world's largest Mosque and now a museum), the entrance to the Topkapi Palace, a stroll down the Hippodrome, past the Blue Mosque and down a few hundred metres of narrow winding cobblestoned streets to the Tashkonak!!! Talk about location -that's the five world-famous sights of ancient Istanbul, all 'just around the corner'. And what better way to start the day than breakfast (included) on the rooftop terrace where you can watch the busy ship traffic and whilst sitting at the very edge of Europe, raise your eyes and look at the start of Asia just across the water. Bye-the-way I had a Turkish Bath in a Hammam which was operating before the First Fleet left England! Go to Istanbul - you owe it to yourself, and stay at the Tashkonak when you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly place in a good location”
Reviews.Author: akostallos
Reviews.Content: Relaxed small hotel, with quiet garden and beautiful terrace views. Staff is superfriendly, rooms are tidy. Proved to be an excellent location for walks to the major attractions, a bit on the far side from the ferries, if you only do walking as land transport. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: dayurensuf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with wife and 3 small children in the family room. Couldn't have felt more welcome and the kids were treated like family which made the trip all the more enjoyable for them. Breakfast was simple but adequate with a great view. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the Blue Mosque etc. There is a little grocery store just below the hotel for any needs you may have like water or bread etc. The airport pick-up and drop-off was fast and hassle-free. Paid in cash so we got a good discount. Couldn't fault the hotel at all. Thanks for a great stay Hotel Tashkonak

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BasilTervuren
Reviews.Content: Situated in quiet side street. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Air conditioning and fridge. Excellent breakfast on rooftop with beautiful views of Bosphorus and Sea of Marmara. Pretty garden and free tea making facility in reception. All the staff are very helpful and friendly. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Shamrocker72
Reviews.Content: If you are after a small quiet hotel with a nice little garden area in Sultanahmet, and firendly service this is a good choice. The staff were helpful ( we asked to change room and they we very accomodating). With a roof terrace looking to the sea and a very good buffet breakfast it's good value.

Reviews.Title: “A Week in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Globalizzie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tashkonak felt like our home away from home in Istanbul. The staff, especially, the head concierge, were very friendly and helpful in providing information about tours, directions, restaurants, etc.. The ceilings in the rooms were painted to look like Iznik tiles and our courtyard room was very comfortable. The hotel building is in a largely residential area only a short walk from the city's main attractions (Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, etc) and the Suhltanamet tram stop, as well as many good restaurants and a laundry. Afternoon tea is served in the hotel's lovely courtyard garden, surrounded by fruit trees. The rooftop breakfast room has a great view of the Sea of Marmara. Though we enjoyed the breakfast, since we were staying for a week we would have appreciated more variety.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: MarkyChina
Reviews.Content: The Tashkonak Hotel is wonderfully positioned to take advantage of the key tourist spots in Sultanhamet. A short walk takes you to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Topkapi Palace and the Archaeological museums. A short walk in the other direction leads you to cheap eateries and more traditional aspects of Istanbul. The staff at the Tashkonak are, quite simply, wonderful; nothing is too much. The hotel is clean, idiosyncratic and has a rooftop breakfast room and terrace with great views of the Sea of Marmaris. Our only concern was the size of our room and if we were to book again would ask for a larger one. Other than that we had absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & good value”
Reviews.Author: khers
Reviews.Content: Cozy boutique hotel, very family friendly, great location in Istanbul's Old City (5 min walk to the Blue Mosque), nice view from the breakfast terrace. Really good value. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice trip to Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: PandCStrasbourg
