Reviews.Content: The hotel as a perfect location, everything we wanted to see was walking distance. Quiet area, very welcoming and friendly personnel, clean and comfortable. Our trip has been a success and the Tashkonak hotel has been key in this success.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and quaint - ignore what you read in That Guidebook”
Reviews.Author: guyfromdenver
Reviews.Content: Let's get this out first -- what you read in a certain guidebook about cold or unfriendly staff is either out of date or just wrong. The staff fell all over itself to be helpful. Room was ample size, especially for the Sultanahmet, and beds (where we spent a lot of time) just right. Good buffet breakfast got us out touring as fast as we cared to. And a charming building. Close to Arista Bazaar, train stop, but just out of the way enough to have some peace and quiet in this bustlng town.

Reviews.Title: “Out of 10 months in Istanbul, our best experience was by far here.”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler78641
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Istanbul for nearly 10 months for work, and we started here at Tashkonak. That was one of the best decisions we could ever have made. We made an initial reservation online for about 1 week; they picked us up from the airport on time, brought us comfortably to the hotel after a short scenic drive, and settled us in comfortably. The staff are terrific; extremely helpful, courteous and genuine, without being overbearing, and they helped us get situated in Istanbul. The breakfast is the best we had in Turkey (period), with a beautiful view of the Bosphorus and sparkling Marmara sea. And the location was phenomenal - nestled into a quiet, cozy side street corner just minutes away from the Blue mosque. Very good family atmosphere away from any loud obnoxious noise or parites. Peaceful and serene garden too. No exaggeration in our review here- we can't say enough!

Reviews.Title: “stop looking, you found it!”
Reviews.Author: turban1
Reviews.Content: a quiet street in the most interesting area for visitors. good food, travel agents, fascinating sights nearby. comfy, clean rooms. delightful hotel staff are like having turkish cousins. i found Tashkonak by accident three years ago and now I stay there every year.

Reviews.Title: “Come back”
Reviews.Author: putrificato
Reviews.Content: The best place to visit Istanbul. Extremely helpful, kind, polite and generous staff. Very clean and quiet. Beautiful view from the roof-terrace where the delicious breakfast is offered. The only inconvenient point is that there is no negative comment to make. Thanks to the management. Zurich 27.05.2011 M.+E

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: malisa-10
Reviews.Content: We travelled from England and stayed at the tashkonok with the family. There was 8 of us. The rooms were really clean and the staff were very friendly especially Ergin. The roof top breakfast was breathtaking it had a wonderful view of the sea and the blue mosque. There was a great choice for the breakfast, it was a great way to start the day. Most of the places to see were close. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “An altogether great find!”
Reviews.Author: KayVancouver
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff, lovely breakfast on an enclosed rooftop terrace, lovely patio garden, clean, comfortable room -- all at a very reasonable price and in a super location just below the Blue Mosque. Couldn't ask for anything more! The hotel is located in a heritage building, so floors creak a bit and voices can carry; however, we found other guests respectful and quiet. We were upgraded from a small double to a large double room on the ground level, which was a nice surprise. All of the staff we encountered were very pleasant and accommodating. They put out a kettle and tea in the lobby every afternoon at 3:00, and guests can enjoy a bit of a mid afternoon break in their rooms or the lobby -- where there are several guide books and other materials -- or, if it's a nice day, in the garden. For guests like us who have an early morning flight, staff prepare tea and a sandwich and deliver it to the guests' room. These extra touches make the Tashkonak Hotel a great find!

Reviews.Title: “great place for people wanting to experience real istanbul atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: chrisbushen
Reviews.Content: More quite location than I would expect for location such close to tourist's most important sites; rooms are small, but clean, but we did not miss more space, as we stayed out in the city all day. Breakfast is good with all, what we expect for a good breakfast; view is marvelous and, if it's not too cold, windy or hot, take Your breakfast outside, we really enjoyed this experience. Staff is friendly and helpful and all can speak english. Next time we will for sure stay in the same hotel;

Reviews.Title: “A traditional, hospitable Ottoman hotel in the middle of an historic area”
Reviews.Author: nickmcadoo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed four times at the Tashkonak. We love the the warmth of the staff and the very calm and efficient way that they sort things out. The location is ideal for us, being in a quiet area, away from the tourists but also within easy walking disance of the Blue Mosque, Aia Sophia, and the Topkapi palace. In fact breakfast is served on a wonderful roof terrace, directly overlooked by the Blue Mosque in one direction, and overlooking the blue sea of Marmara in the other. Down the road from the hotel is a very traditional area of old wooden Ottoman houses leading down to a Roman wall and the sea. The staff are very efficient at organizing taxis and really make you feel at home

Reviews.Title: “a good place to stay - well located & friendly”
Reviews.Author: PR123074
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Istanbul, unfortunately during quite poor weather. The hotel was pleasant and in an excellent location - less than 5 mins from the 'sights', 15 mins from the waterfront, Grand Bazaar etc. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms pleasant - good showers. The free transfer from the airport worked very smoothly. Free tea in the lobby in the afternoons was a nice touch. Our only slight disappointment was the breakfast buffet which would have benefited from some more fresh fruit , better coffee and a little more variety. The view is lovely, though.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly and classy. We felt at home.”
Reviews.Author: Cleo055
Reviews.Content: Warm reception, Quiet spacious and well decorated room, Excellent room and bathroom service, Well located Internet and WiFi services, Breakfast in a room with a panoramic view overlooking the sea, Food plentiful and well presented, Personel always ready to help finding restaurants and making reservations.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem right in the middle of the main tourist sights of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ClearedIGS
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel which we found via an internet search when we could not extend our stay in the hotel we were in. The hotel has a separate building with suites around the corner from the main hotel which is where we actually stayed. Breakfast was on the top floor of the main building requiring a very short walk from our room. This was not a problem and the breakfast buffet was the best experienced in 3 weeks of travel in Jordan & Turkey. Staff were extremely helpful and efficient in giving advice and directions. The hotel is billed as family hotel and it did indeed feel like we were staying with a family. Transport to or from the hotel is provided at no cost, but only one way. Either to the hotel or from the hotel. We went from the hotel to the airport which was a great help as at the time of day in a taxi, it would have been a nightmare. If we ever go to Istanbul again, this is where we will say.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff, great view from the roof top breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: Cararmme
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with very friendly, helpful staff. Excellent location just minutes from the Blue Mosque, Arasta Bazaar and Hagia Sophia. Our room was a triple on the ground floor behind reception. It was a small but clean and it had everything we needed. The beds were very firm! Sometimes we could hear noise from the reception desk area but it did not keep us awake. The breakfast room on the rooftop has spectacular views out over the Marmara Sea. Breakfast was very good with an extensive selection of sweet and savory items.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel reminiscent of the Ottoman Empire with obliging, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Marcia050
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning from New York and were immediately given a spacious room where we slept peacefully during the day. By the next morning we had our land legs and appreciated the breakfast of healthy choices and a stellar view of the Marmara Sea beyond the rooftops of the fascinating old neighborhood. We were able to book a large family room for a week hence when we planned to return with family. Hayati and the staff obliged us by providing a beautiful room where we could entertain friends overlooking the misty sea. We plan to stay at Kashtonak during future trips to Istanbul, a city with an intriguing past and captivating present.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly hotel in perfect location for the Sultanahmet district.”
Reviews.Author: HarryB65
Reviews.Content: All staff were ready to help and very welcoming. The rooms are small but the location is ideal. The roof terrace has a wide sea view and the other aspect is the Blue Mosque. Turkish breakfast is fine and room service is 24 hr There were no extras for safe box, air conditioning and the room was made up very well. The hotel were very helpful with airport transfer arrangements. The narrow streets are cobbled and there is no continuous pavement.Access for the disabled could be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/value in silent street next to main attractions with splendid view on the Marmara Sea”
Reviews.Author: sdecorte
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much because of: - friendly welcome and service - good breakfast with a great view over the Marmara Sea - old wooden house with comfortable clean rooms - very silent room overlooking the backyard with a small terrace - good location to start exploring Istanbul from (very near the tramline, 15 min walk to the station and the main ferries) - close to good restaurants We had a very pleasant stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Discover Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: fabio35987
Reviews.Content: Well located only few steps behind the most important monuments of Istanbul. Friendly atmosphere, clean and peaceful rooms. A very nice surprise in a beatiful cty.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Geroi900
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for nine days. The breakfasts here are amazing. They serve a complimentary breakfast of traditional Turkish cooking. I couldn't wait for each breakfast. You will eat that breakfast in a covered rooftop terrace that features million-dollar views of the entire Bosphorous. The view is literally better than that of your neighbors at the Four Seasons at Sultanahmet who are paying ten times what you are. The real heart of this hotel is the staff. They go way beyond the call of duty to make sure each guest enjoys their stay. I could tell lots of stories about their kindness and generosity. I do have two criticisms. The rooms are very small. The walls are very thin. You can hear everything in your neighbor's room. But in terms of a budget hotel offering value, the Tashkonak Hotel can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and great location!”
Reviews.Author: eileenml
Reviews.Content: Prices quoted were cheaper than the rest that I've enquired and the email responses were extremely prompt! Room is clean, of decent size and is adequately equipped (ie even comes with a hair dryer & a safe). The facade of the hotel is very cottage style and rustic. The breakfast is decent and served at the roof terrace, overlooking Sea of Marmara and partial Blue Mosque view. However, it will be great if they are able to widen the food variety daily. The hotel is located just behind the Blue Mosque and within mins walk to Aya Sofya & Topkapi Palace. Overall, we were very pleased with the services and would not hesitate to recommend to travellers to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: maurof71
Reviews.Content: Room large and clean. Excellent service and caring. Good location for sightseeing. price / quality very good. Buffet breakfast on a terrace overlooking the old quarter with the Blue Mosque and Marmara Sea. Discount for cash payment Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Magical experience”
Reviews.Author: nsl2901
Reviews.Content: The apartment side of this hotel was way beyond our expectations. It was more than value for money. Everything was new, it was extremely clean and very homey. The staff were exceptionally helpful and professional. Their english was very good and there was no problems in communication. The location is fantastic and virtually sits on the blue mosque. It is by far the best part of Istanbul to stay. The only reservation for some may be that it is by mosque. However this was not a problem for us and it would be hard to avoid this by staying any where else. All in all a great experience, value for money and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Hotel Tashkonak”
Reviews.Author: alexander52
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the hippodrome and blue mosque - very convenient. The street is small and quiet, the hotel comfortable and friendly. The breakfast is very good, plenty of choice and attentive staff making sure that coffee and milk jugs etc. are refilled. The hotel isn't smart but makes up for that in little extras, such as tea in the afternoons. The towels in my room were changed every day whether they needed it or not! The room itself had both heating and airconditoining. The heating was very welcome as it snowed for three days. Everyone was kind and helpful. I enjoyed my stay very much and hope to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: fiona154
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Tashkonak Hotel twice and really enjoyed their friendly staff, clean rooms and beautiful breakfast. The other good point about this hotel is it's central location it is very close to tourist attractions and city center. I definitely suggest this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly staff. Great location. Good breakfast and views.”
Reviews.Author: TyrelleTravellers
Reviews.Content: I can't praise all the staff enough for their helpful and friendly attitude. It made the stay an absolute pleasure. Our room was a bit small but we had got an amazing deal so were not surprised by that. The bed was big and comfortable though and the room cleaned daily. The room had a fridge, a safe and a TV and was warm and cosy. The Wi-Fi worked well and there was a computer for general use in the lobby (also free tea). Liked the complimentary slippers which calmed down the general hotel noise which could be a bit clattery at times with people walking up and down the marble staircases.The breakfast buffet was excellent and served in a rooftop dining area with views all around. Unfortunately the weather while we were in Istanbul was cold and wet so no breakfasting on the rooftop terrace for us (or relaxing in the beautiful garden!). Overall the hotel was great and I would definitely recommend it to others and stay there again if I return (which I hope to in better weather!).

Reviews.Title: “its wonderful hotel!! the staff was very very kind!!”
Reviews.Author: ã�¯ã‚Šã�­ã�šã�¿
Reviews.Content: I visited isutanbul at first time. But I got wonderful memory!! I got all information from staff of this hotel!! I felt very counfortable same as my home!! If I will visit istanbul again, I stay this hotel 100%!! room,break first, infomation, location, BY ALL MEANS Tashkonak Hotel is the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great people”
Reviews.Author: farid1961
Reviews.Content: My nieces and I would highly advice tashkonak hotel to people: The service and the employees are highly professional, nice and very polite: The hotel is very clean too. I am planning to go back on April.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davood_11
Reviews.Content: A really good place with the sweetest staff.. They will show you in a map were to go, and which places are the best to visit when you are a visitor in the lovely Istanbul. :-) The hotel is in a local place, but still its very close to Aya Sophia and all the other places to visit. We would like to stay at this hotel next time we are going to Istanbul again. You don't have to think about breakfast, when you are checking in the person will tell you when it is. They have a lot of food, and the best thing is you can take much if you want to :-) We love this hotel!!! <3 <3 <3

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlineMattar
Reviews.Content: I have been to tashkonak hotel recently , it's a very nice hotel, for just a little walk you can reach to the touristic places in Istanbul.The stuff were very helpful. They are very friendly. They helped me to arrange a little surprise for my husband on his birthday . You feel that you are at home. It 's a cosy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay in Istanbul even better”
Reviews.Author: SHGTravel
Reviews.Content: Great location in the middle of Sultanahmet, traditional Ottoman building, comfortable en suite rooms with heating in the winter and ac for the summer included; the staff were extremely helpfull and courteous, reception will book any city tours requested but you pay direct to the tour representative after pick up from the hotel. Breakfast in the roof top terrace overlooking the Bosphrrous is a wonderful start to any day. Airport pickup/dropoff service is available at a very reasonable price and we would recommend using this service. The drivers give a good commentary on the city during the journey and make you very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: SiddharthBhandari
Reviews.Content: Browsing through tripadvisor.com , we found this pretty and homely boutique hotel . It suited our budget , living standards and looked beautiful . We exchanged a few emails with the hotel and then confirmed our booking . Our flight to istanbul was canceled and so our trip was delayed by a day , but the hotel was cordial , and did not charge us for changing the booking . the hotel is located in a peaceful neighborhood and just a 10 mins walk from the Sultanahmet tram station . However when we were out for late nights the walk back seems a little long , but that's not the case and it was a pleasant and safe walk back at any time at night . The breakfast spread was superb and we really enjoyed our post breakfast coffee on the terrace with a view . The staff was above excellence . The manager at the desk was extremely humble , cooperative and all his tips and advise around istanbul were very helpful . We stayed at the hotel on 2 occasions in 2 different rooms , because we went out for 3 nights to cappadocia . Rooms and bathrooms were very clean and cosy. The heating system was also turned on and the room was nice and comfortable . I mention this because we also spent a night in a hotel in a cappadocia hotel and had to complain 4 times through the night as the room heating was kept to minimum . Also prior booking this hotel , we checked with a lot of other hotels in sultanahmet and there was always something that was not good enough for us . Sometimes it was located in a chaotic neighborhood , or the charges were too high , or the rooms were too tiny and unimpressive , but the choice we made with HOTEL TASHKONAK , was a great decision . And the hotel has a fantastic reputation with all the locals and travel agents who learnt that we were staying in Tashkonak . Also the hotel provides free airport transfer 1 way , if you book a room for 3 days .

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel close to the sites”
Reviews.Author: MikeD56
Reviews.Content: The Tashkonak is a friendly little place that strives to provide the service of a much more expensive hotel. It is located just an easy couple of minutes (3-4 if you don't stop to shop the little stores along the way) walk to the Blue Mosque and another 2-3 to the tram stop in Old Istanbul. The staff was always eager to help and assist in all matters. The room was comfortable, always clean and tidy and the size was fine for us as we were in Istanbul to be out in the city and not in the Hotel. However, it did include a couch sitting area in the room if we had wanted to stay in. The roof top breakfast area had a nice view of the Bosporus and the breakfast, included, was a simple continental buffet type with more than enough choices for us. We had an early flight back and they offered to make us a breakfast and deliver it before the kitchen opened. If you pay in cash you get an 8% discount on the room.

Reviews.Title: “It feels like visiting family....”
Reviews.Author: Eastwind78
Reviews.Content: I've been in this hotel for 3 nights, more or less a last minute decision - but the best I've ever made. Its a nice hidden, rustic hotel. Everything is small and seems like a family business - what I like the most. Staff was friendly and helpful 24/7. I liked my room with its bathroom. Most I cared was hot shower and a heater, because I traveled in January. The breakfast was awesome. A little bit of everything - on the hotel roof top terrace with a beautiful view on Bosporus and Sea of Marmara and the other side with a view to the Blue Mosque (depends on where you sit). I had to check out at 5am in the morning and they even asked if I want some tea and a sandwich made because breakfast starts not before 7.30am. Its in walking distance of everything (well at least to Sultanahmet) and has a lot of good Turkish restaurants in the neighborhood. Next time I definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and friendly staffs and neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Taza_Marlia
Reviews.Content: nice hotel surrounding with a quiet and nice surrounding.. a walking distance to historical sites.. our 8 days staying shouldn't have end so fast...

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the best hotel I have ever stayed at for the money”
Reviews.Author: istanbulnotconstan
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great staff. Nice rooms and building that combine the right mix of traditional elements with modern amenities. Daily free breakfast that is worth at least $10/person on a rooftop that overlooks the old city leading down to the Bosphorus. Amazing views of the sunrise. If we are ever in Istanbul again, we will stay here. No reason to look any other place. And the price, around $50/night, is just outstanding. Can't say enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Afer74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week in December. I used the airport transfer service, which was excellent with free water and snacks after the plane journey. The hotel staff were all efficient and helpful. The room (107) was an impressive size for a city hotel, the bathroom was also a good size (albeit that the shower cubicle is a corner one so ever so slightly on the small side - although that does depend on how big the person is!). The decor was cosy rather than chic, it could probably do with a lick of paint at some point, but the room was spotlessly clean on arrival and cleaned every day without fail. There is free internet available, which is handy. The location is very good, close to all of the main sights, but equally on a quiet street so there were no issues with noise (even when the room is at street level) and I slept very well there. The breakfast was perfectly nice. Overall, the hotel is incredible value for money, it is not the most chic (if that is what you are looking for), but it is very comfortable, cosy and with good staff. If you do want something slightly more upmarket then I would recommend the Tashkonak Suites. As the hot water was not working properly one day we were given a key to use the bathroom in one of the suites. They are spacious, with flat screen TVs, a little kitchenette and, best of all, lovely big bathrooms with a bath and effectively a double size shower. In my view a suite would be well worth the extra few Euros if you can stretch your budget that far.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: vitfrancis
Reviews.Content: First of all, we stayed for more than six days, so we were able to take advance of the free airport pick up and return, which was a lovely perq. The location couldn't be better, close in proximity to many of the main sights but also nicely tucked away. Great view of the Marmora Sea from the rooftop restaurant, where we enjoyed taking breakfast every morning. The outdoor courtyard on the ground floor is also a nice spot to enjoy a tea or a beer (assuming you've purchased some for the room fridge). The staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “You will enjoy the friendly atmosphere and good location of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: saradennison
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Tashkonak on a recent trip to Istanbul. We were very pleased with all aspects of the hotel-- good location, friendly service, breakfast on the rooftop and good suggestions about the city. You will enjoy your stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hospitality !!”
Reviews.Author: GotSumS
Reviews.Content: On our way to India from the US, we took a day break in Instanbul and stayed a night at Tashkonak Hotel. We were very impressed by the hospitality. Everyone at Tashkonak was very very nice and helpful. We were helped with our luggage. Even after check out the Hotel Manager made sure that our luggage was kept safe in the Holding room. The service is nice, people are humble. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: dandelion2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed our time in Istanbul. The hotel staff was very friendly, spoke great english and answered all our questions. The rooms were comfortable and we were able to use the internet in our rooms. Our room overlooked the patio and we could see the Blue Mosque minarets and domes. We were there on New Year's Eve and could even see the fireworks from our room! They have a lovely roof top breakfast room that overlooked the Sea of Marmara.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: auntgoosy
Reviews.Content: we booked the hotel in internet, and we found what we expected: a reasonably couzy and nice hotel in the heart of sultanahmet, close to main attractions and still very quiet at night. Staff was execellent and extremely helpful and nice (their pick up service waited long since our luggage was lost at the airport, and then they helped us out with directions, maps, and luggage retrival). The room was clean and fine, even if with view on a wall (lowest floor, ask for the highest if you go, but remember there is non elevator). The breakfast on the roof is nice for the view, despite the room gets a little too hot (no air conditioning in summer) and the forniture is very old. I would recomment this hotel because staff attitude deserves a reward and because the relation quality/price is good.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ParplePatuto
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annex, and loved it. We were a large group: Grandma and Grandpa, a family with a baby, 2 more couples, plus some other friends. Our reservation was a little complex but the hotel staff was wonderful at managing the various arrival & departure times, The lodging was clean and roomy enough for us to gather together. The breakfast was great, and the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Ask them for advice on day trips! The location is excellent - a short walk to many of the locations we wanted to see, and to public transportation. We definitely would stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying in this hotel - like a family home in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: elspethparker
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Tashkonak. The rooms are simple but clean and comfortable. The view of the Blue Mosque from the breakfast balcony was magic. The breakfast was great too. The manager was helpful, friendly and suggested some out-of-the way excursions for us. Many of the attractions are in walking distance and the tram and train services work well. We loved Istanbul and staying at the Tashkonak contributed to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: KMOHD
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul in Dec/2010 with my wife and daughter ( 3.5 years old). We really enjoyed staying at Tashkonak. The place is very convenient to all the places in Sultanahmet area. Blue mosque,Ayasofya, Topkapi (5-15 mins by walk). There are many places to eat and shop nearby. We were very impressed by the staff. As the hotel is family run; the atmosphere is very casual and very friendly. The staff were very helpfull at all times. My daughter liked the place as there was allways someone to talk to and play with her. She enjoyed watching the colourful street cats :-) The restaurant is good; with a beautiful view of the Marmara sea. The breakfast is continental and a good selection of bread, cheese, scrambled egg, boiled egg, cakes, salads etc. We stayed in family room; i thought the bathrooms were a bit small size; but no complaints when we look at overall quality of stay. Hotel arranged for a taxi pickup (Had to pay 25 euro because I booked accomodation from a third party website) . The taxi offered us nice snacks and drinks. I thought that was real good service. Overall; our trip was fun, love turkey; its people; its vibrancy and would definitely visit sometime in future again and may stay at the same place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, central.”
Reviews.Author: Clodstyle
Reviews.Content: We had a four nights stay. Nice ambient, central position, willingness, clean ambient and an amazing breakfast on the roof with sea view and tasty food. We stay in a five person room. It was wide and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “If you looked up the word 'Hospitality' in the dictionary you would find "Hotel Tashkonak"...”
Reviews.Author: nav7485
Reviews.Content: When myself and a few friends decided to visit Istanbul we were spoilt for choice with hotels in the area surrounding the main tourist attractions. Our most important criteria was value, given that we planned to spend as little time as possible indoors and more time away from our bedrooms experiencing Turkey, a high class elaborate service was something we were willing to waive for this particular excursion. Eventually we opted for a seemingly neutral venue - Hotel Tashkonak - a decision arrived at thanks mainly to the plaudits in a lot of the reviews for the place. It is not an exaggeration to say that Hotel Tashkonak blew us away. We got exactly what we expected from the quality of rooms which, in retrospect, were a snip for the amount paid. Incidentally our room overlooked a small traditional Ottoman mosque which made our stay even more pleasurable and authentic with the muezzin sounding a captivating call to prayer every morning. However, for me, the most gratifying thing I took from the trip to Istanbul wasn't the awe-inspiring beauty of the Blue Mosque (a 2 minute walk from the hotel) or the euphoria of the Grand Bazaar but it was the genuineness and chivalry of our friends that ran Hotel Tashkonak - from the bottom up the staff went out of their way to make our short stay a memorable one. The cleaner, kitchen staff, porters and management operated more as a family than a business and made it a point to get to know us at a personal level. Whatever your background or reasons for visiting Istanbul I would recommend that you stay at this gem. Hotel Tashkonak will ensure you leave (reluctantly on our part) with a lasting memory of Turkish hospitality. Naveed

Reviews.Title: “Immense service”
Reviews.Author: PAUL123412
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Fantastic position within walking distance from major attractions and public transport. The main strength is the staff who displayed fantastic customer service. I have travelled a lot and there service was the best I have ever received. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a cheap hotel in Sultanahmet (central Istanbul)”
Reviews.Author: eljbee
Reviews.Content: Booked this place on the strength of TripAdvisor reviews and we weren't let down. Excellent rates, great location (5 mins walks to Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya, 10 mins wakl to Grand Bazaar, 5-10 mins walk to one of three nearby tram or train stops; lovely views of the Blue Mosque and Marmara Sea, nice room, in a quiet street, and as others have said, extremely helpful staff. Good, free, wifi was very useful too, or there's a PC you can use for free near reception if need be. We didnt use the walled tea garden (too busy exploring the city!) but it looked lovely. Decent breakfasts too - solid rather than spectacularly good, but plenty of variety of bread, cereal, cheeses, eggs, olives and tomatoes, fruit and even home-made cakes, plus tea, coffee, juices etc. Thoroughly recommend Tashkonak

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KariA75
Reviews.Content: The Tashkonak was a great part of our holiday. The atmosphere in this boutique hotel was wonderful. We were fortunate enough to have fantastic weather during our stay, and got to enjoy the rooftop terrace every morning for breakfast. The views were wonderful from the terrace and breakfast room. Even better was the location. We were just a few minutes walk from some of the best atractions in the city- the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Basilica Cistern, Topkopi Palace. Of course, there was a shopping bazaar to go through to get to these sights, but it was also part of the great atmosphere of the trip. As for the hotel, the staff are wonderful. They are extremely friendly and helpful. The family room that we had was very clean, but a little tight for the four of us. We were lucky enough to have a small balcony that looked towards the Bosphorus. The breakfast that is included was quite nice. It isn't anything fancy, but it was a great way to start the mornings. I highly recommend the sour cherry tea. The only negative I have for this hotel is that it is in a slightly noisy location. Although, after a few nights, we all had gotten used to the new sounds and slept very peacefully. If you have trouble sleeping away from home, I'd suggest to bring earplugs to help you get your rest.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: umalbanat
Reviews.Content: very good , location , very good price , nice area , near to all nice sites liem sultan ahmed mosque topkapi aya sofia and restaurants and bazaars plus near stations and can arrange tours from there rellay the pickup bus from airport was too helpful and quick and also the return to airport was on time the staff and food breakfast was yummy and good and plentifuland i recommend it for all who want afamily stay

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Eman_LB
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 8 nights, the staff was very helpful and friendly. They'd guide you to places if you need. There's a grocery nextdoor where you can find basic fruits and veggies and stuff. Rooms were cleaned daily. nice building and quite place but our room was near the road so it was relatively noisy. The hotel has everything you might need, clean bed and towels, a small fridge, a hairdryer, and ready breakfast everyday (yummy!), plus a tea-break every afternoon. my baby had a good playpen to sleep in. Free internet is available but it is better in the lobby than in the room. "Cons" are: The room has no much space - but at the end you don't really need a big room when you are travelling- and the shampoo is not good, but the soap is really good!! If we go to Turkey another time, we'll definitely go to Tashkonak! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “friendly, helpful, clean - excellent view and location”
Reviews.Author: Malak_00
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for 8 days and stayed in Tashkonak hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful - especailly Hayati - most of them have good knowledge of english (which is not common in turkey) the rooms were always clean, and have the essentials, with private bath and small fridge for each room. above all, the view form the terrace is wonderful. th breakfast is excellent and very well served. You will have a superb mornign with a peaceful view of the bosphouros. It is 5 minute walk from sultanahmet. you can visit all the old town walking (topkapi palace, ayasofya, blue mosque, arcgheologic museum, turkish and islamic art museum) and it is also close to the tram station, which takes you to anywhere you like (taksim/istiklal st; eminonu for ferry boat rides to princes islands and bosphour tours, and also to bus station (and then miniaturk - bus47) and spice bazaar from eminonu; topkapi statin for panorama 1453; zeytinburnu station then metro for turkuazoo -largest aquarium in europe; kabatas station for dolmabahce; beyazit station for grand bazaar)

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: jlsf415
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the place 7 days and was very good the breakfast was a great saver and really good i'm recommending them to other friends and family that's going to stay in Istanbul, Turkey and i'll be staying with them again when I come back to Visit

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: karenhans
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three wonderful days in Istanbul where we stayed in the Tashkonak hotel. The hotel is well located, in walking distance of all the famous must see attractions. Our room was spacious enough for a city visit. Most important it was clean, as was the entire hotel. The staff was friendly and understood what good hostmanship means. The view from the terras is breathtaking and makes you stay at the breakfast ltable longer than you intended. We can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukcamel
Reviews.Content: We had a great week at the Tashkonak Hotel in Istanbul - the location is wonderful, just minutes walk away from the main historical sights. The best thing was the quality of the staff. They were helpful, attentive (but not pushy), sensitive and we felt well looked after. They knew a lot about the city, where to go, and how to get around. They will help you book whatever you want - Do go and see the Whirling Dervishes at the cultural centre!!!. There is free afternoon tea every day, free wireless (plus free access to a computer and printer) and tasteful features and fittings. A great breakfast too. One of our party left her mobile phone, and the hotel sent a text to her son and posted the phone back really quickly. We would all go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: kizack
Reviews.Content: My wife, friends and I stayed at Tashkonak in September 2010 during the FIBA World basketball championships. The hotel was very well located (less than 10 min from Blue Mosque), clean, with small but functional rooms. The service was excellent and very friendly - the front desk staff in particular was always ready to help with advice, directions, etc. We had a wonderful stay with Tashkonak and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: OptimusEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the final three nights of our trip to Turkey and had a great time. The rooms were small but efficient. My room had a king size bed and looked out over the inside terrace so it was very quiet at night. It was clean and had a spacious bathroom. The staff are wonderful - every restaurant they suggested was enjoyed by all. The breakfast was delicious and the view amazing. I really enjoyed coming back from a busy day to enjoy a cup of tea on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location,price and efficient and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: intrepid078
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located close to major attractions of the city on a quiet side street. The hotel has an inside-court garden which adds to it charm. Good hearty breakfast included in the price. View of the Marmara Sea from the breakfast terrace is refreshing(if you ignore some roofs of the nearby houses).Room though not spacious according to the North American standards but was not cramped. The staff is knowledgable, efficient and friendly. This made my stay specially enjoyable-like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nineiron
Reviews.Content: Our party of four recently had a four night and one night stay. The hotel offers excellent customer service, and is obviously well managed. Reservations: Email communications with Coskun were returned promptly, and all questions were answered. Our room requests were satisfied, and our rooms were ready on both arrivals. This is welcome after a long international flight. Transportation: We had four airport trips. The drivers were professional, and always on time. The vans were clean and comfortable. Location: Wonderful location in the old town of Sultanahmet. It is a 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque. The Arasta Bazaar and Topkapi Palace are close. Hotel: The rooms are small but adequate. The rooms are clean, and the A/C works well. There is a nice garden behind the hotel. This is a nice place for an early evening gathering. Breakfast: The glassed rooftop breakfast room has a magnificent view of the sea. The breakfast is excellent with Turkish items as well as enough â€œWesternâ€� items. Staff: It is difficult to describe how nice and helpful and gracious they were. I am sorry I donâ€™t know everyoneâ€™s name, but Inan and Emrah made our stay in an amazing city even better. We had the most interaction with Hayati who was always smiling and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “A Cute hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Oliven
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a great city with many interesting sites. This hotel is very well located close to many of the most known tourist attractions. The staff really made the hotel into a place you will remember, everyone was so helpful and friendly. On top of this one of them was really handsome :-)

Reviews.Title: “We will not go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: h_legault
Reviews.Content: You can find our comments in the Tashknonak Suites and Apartment section. After our 7 days stay (extended to 8 days) we decided to go visit Cappadokya for 5 days and come back at Tashknonak to finish our trip. And so we made a reservation for our last days in Istanbul from October 4 to the 8. We could not have the same room so the Hotel offered us a choice between two rooms for when we would come back. Upon arrival at the Hotel (by the way they came back to get us at the airport) they informed that they had another room to offer us if we wanted it. It was the best. We had this suite on the third floor with balcony overseeing the Marmara sea. What a way to finish a trip. I will never forget the Turkish Hospitality wherever we went but the Tashknonak Hotel team realy wins the palm. I think they defined hospitality. Thank you Hayati and all the others Huguette & Jean The Canadians

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly character-full place to stay”
Reviews.Author: John_Glasson
Reviews.Content: Very friendly & helpful staff. Room quite small but clean and with a lovely balcony overlooking garden. Splendid breakfast room with views across the Bosphorus. Lovely food and filter coffee. Good place to watch the sunset as well! Conveniences such as tea in garden and internet access (using their computer or wi-fi)

Reviews.Title: “I can only echo what others have said - a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tommyzulu
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the review we read - and the reasonable price. We also like the idea that this hotel had a garden (more a terrace, really). The hotel's location is very good - on the edge of the tourist area close to the main sites but also in an area which allow one to experience some of Istanbul that the locals use. The breakfast on the roof terrace was just right and so was our room - simple, clean and with everything we needed. The staff are brilliant. From 'Hayap' at reception to the cleaning staff - all were really friendly and helpful. They loaned us a local bus permit (liker the UK Oyster Card) so that we did not have to buy tickets all the time and came up with helpful suggestions. Highly recommended. If you are loooking for Five* luxury you'll be disappointed, but as a value for money experience it was a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever”
Reviews.Author: gizmo9168
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently spent four nights in this hotel and being two women we were a little hestitant at first. We must say that the hotel was great. Within walking distance to all major attractions. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. They were always willing to help and assist. Rooms extremely clean. Breakfast on the roof was great. Plenty for everyone. Would have loved to stay longer. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Riamaahi
Reviews.Content: Tashkonak is a quaint and lovely boutique hotel located in Sultanahmet and is a walking distance from the major tourist hot spots of istanbul.We were most impressed by the warm and affectionate staff given the fact that we were staying with a 10 months old baby.They assisted us with almost everything from supplying electric kettles to planning out our itenerary everyday.This apart the breakfast spread was quite elaborate and having breakfast with the breathtaking views of the blue mosque and the bosphorous sea and the sea gulls is an experience we will always cherish. We are coming back guys :)

Reviews.Title: “the best service and most hospitable concierge's, great breakfast and location”
Reviews.Author: truthasiknowit10
Reviews.Content: after an awful experience at ararat, we were thrilled to be treated with such grace and decorum. This place was great, great prices for values and extraordinarily helpful front desk staff. These guys are hard workers and really went out of their way for us. They gave us a great deal and there was a large room with double price at an amazingly decent price compared to the tiny smaller than Parisian hotel rooms, smaller than NYC studio shoeboxes that boutique hotels in Sultanhamet offer. The large room was quoted as 120 euros for 4nights. We opted for the smaller room. If you are light sleeper they will place you in a room facing the garden, but doors are heavy and you hear people leaving and entering their rooms but that seems to be the norm in many Turkish hotels. There is a different concept of "quiet." All in all, we highly recommend Tashkonak!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lelechka
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews on this website and I was not disappointed. The free transportation between the airport and the hotel was a breeze. The guys ( sorry to say I do not remember their names ) were very friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was not great but nice on the roof top with a nice little view. They had free wireless internet which came to be very useful to us. The room was small but very very clean and the bathroom had enough space for the two people. The only small problem I had is that the hotel is on the bottom of the street; therefore to get to sites like Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque, you had to walk 5-6 minutes up the streets; but it was a nice exercise:) Oh, and do not worry about the 5AM call to pray - it did not wake even me up, therefore I am not even sure if they do have this call. Thanks Tashkonak! I recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique!”
Reviews.Author: mzklutz
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in Tashkonak for 4 nights in July 2010. We enjoyed our stayed there very much. The guys at the reception desk were so helpful with all our needs. Love the place, its quiet, clean and cozy. The location is also great! Only 5 minutes walk to the Blue mosque and Hagia Sophia! Will highly recommend this place to anyone who is going to istanbul, and should I ever go back to istanbul, I will definitely choose to stay in Tashkonak:)

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: SCOMPI
Reviews.Content: The position was perfect, just few stes from Blue mosque and the sultanahmet center. staff very nice and helpful, and somebody knows also italian.... Beatiful terrace for the breakfast with sea view. Nice and clean room. good price and airpot trasfert very useful... REALLY THE BEST CHOICE FOR OUT ISTANBUL VISIT

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in a vibrant city”
Reviews.Author: advisor018
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Tashkonak Hotel. The hotel arranged transport for us to and from the airport, the staff were very friendly and the room clean, nicely furnished and comfortable. We stayed in a family room with our three teenage children which worked very well for us. Istanbul was very hot - even for August so the air-conditioning was very welcome! The location was perfect for visiting some of the major sites. The roof terrace had excellent views of the Bosphoros, and we particularly appreciated tea-time at 3pm in the quiet courtyard. We would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone wanting to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: nickngin
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the tashkonak 8 years ago and came back to visit this year. We love everything about this hotel, the location is great, the breakfast on the roof is wonderful and the staff are extremly helpful and friendly. We would recommend this hotel to everyone whether you are a family, couple or on your own.

Reviews.Title: “KY Prof Loved Location & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: KYProfessor
Reviews.Content: I spent June and part of July teaching in an US university study-abroad program, after which I stayed for two weeks with my wife and teenage son to relax and tour Istanbul. There are a daunting number of hotels in the old quarters of Istanbul to consider. I had the advantage of being able actually to visit the hotels in which I was interested; and I looked over about a dozen hotels, guided by online services, the Blue Guide, Lonely Planet, and DK. The best combination of price and quality I found was Taskonak. It's in Sultanahmet near the Blue Mosque and lovely Little Aya Sofia, but it's on a quiet side street, just out of the hustle and bustle. The location puts one near many of the most important historical sites as well as the less touristed esplanade along the Sea of Marmara where Istanbulis stroll, swim and picnic. Distinctive to Tashkonak is the lovely, garden courtyard of the hotel, which offers a refuge of peace and solace unlike the offerings at most other hotels. The rooftop terrace has a splendid view of the sea in 3 directions (I loved breakfast there), though one can't really see the grand mosques. That was okay for me as "Doy-Doy" and many other nearby restaurants have great views of the Blue Mosque from their terraces. Best of all, however, at Tashkonak was the staff, which I found to be extraordinarily helpful. The clerks negotiated a good price for me. They dealt with my very fussy wife's needs, even moving us to a larger room when she found our first room to be too small (as a boutique, non-corporate hotel, the rooms are many different sizes). The desk clerks also gave us great advice on sites, baths, and restaurants. They were pleasant just to chat with. The free shuttle to the airport was welcome, as was the WI-Fi. There is a small mosque just across the street. So, if you're a light sleeper, don't get a room on the street side, since there is a 5am call to prayer. It's on low volume, though, at that hour. So, for the rest of us (and for me) it didn't present a problem. (Our second room was street side, but it wasn't a problem.) The Menu meal was terrific. Great fish.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with friendly helpful staff, a cut above hotels of similar price”
Reviews.Author: ethomasHerts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July and cannot fault the hotel. Rooms are clean and serviced everyday, breakfast on the roof terrace is lovely with plenty of choice. All the staff were friendly and very helpful, with advice on where to visit and how to get places. They also have a small garden where you can have tea at anytime. We used their airport pick up service from Sabiha Gochen airport (50 euros) which although more expensive than our return trip to the airport (26 euros), which we booked through one of the many travel agents in Sultanamet, was well worth the extra. Friendly driver who gave us commentary of the city as we drove in and free drinks and snacks. We stayed a few days at a similarly priced hotel on our return to Istanbul the following week and standards were not as high. As as i am pregnant it was important to have a comfortable air- conditioned base and the Tashkonak did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: UsAnna
Reviews.Content: Very clean elegant rooms, lovely garden, wonderful rooftop terrace where breakfast is served. Breakfast was great, good coffee, eggs, fruits, breads, cheeses. Quiet sidestreet location but five minute walk from Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Probably fifteen minutes to bazaar. Lots of restaurants nearby. People at front desk, cleaning ladies, waiters at breakfast were all polite, friendly, helpful and fun. We asked for a quiet room and got one facing the garden. Loved this hotel and the great people running it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AlisonD_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tashkonak for 2 days prior to starting our tour in Turkey. We had a great time. The hotel is clean, the rooms are a good size and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The price was very reasonable, the location was great and of all the places that we stayed in Turkey, this was one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL Like home....STAFF LIKE FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: kamaleddin
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a quiet street close to all the major tourist attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We really felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very fine small hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenerconcerns
Reviews.Content: I traveled with one friend. We are both older women and had absolutely no trouble anywhere in Turkey. We stayed 2 nights at Tashkonak. Breakfast on the roof overlooking the Bosporus and the Marmara will not be forgotten. The hotel garden also is lovely. The hotel is very clean, the staff are very helpful. Hayati at the front desk was especially helpful. I would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to others. The price was extremely reasonable. Sara Florida

Reviews.Title: “A great place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: msberg99
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff (that speak English), amazing breakfast with an amazing view. Room was small, but very clean, and good sized bathroom, that was very clean as well. We had a small terrace off our room. There is a computer and internet available, that was really appreciated when doing further travel research and contacting family. There is also a printer that can be used, that was a nice surprise. We had asked to stay an additional night, and the staff was very helpful in extending our stay, and ensuring we could stay in the same room, so we didn't have to move rooms. Would stay here again, if coming back to Istanbul in the future. Close to good restaurants, and the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome. Nice, quiet neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyBoy071
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic three night stay at the Hotel Tashkonak. The hotel was clean, well located in the Sultanahment and really good value. We were really impressed by the friendly team - especially the guy on reception for whom nothing was too much trouble and who gave us lots of good advice on what to do and see and where to eat and drink. We will remember breakfast on the roof terrace - with amazing views! We would definitely recommend the hotel and hope to stay there again when we go back to Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experiance”
Reviews.Author: elmiller3
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with great location. Little difficult to explain to cab driver to find, but mapquest print out helped a lot. Breakfast was very good and offered more than most hotels in Europe. Staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome from our late arrival (0100) to the dinner show they set up for us. We could not have had a better time on this trip and the hotel and staff played a large part.

Reviews.Title: “Simple yet satisfying”
Reviews.Author: TingYixin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing because the staff makes it so. If you're looking for a simple yet sufficient place to stay, look no further. Great food and helpful staff willing to go way out to render help and advice. Low cost and just 15 minutes away from local attractions. They even provide airport transfer. Highly recommend this place to everyone and should i visit Istanbul again, there is no doubt where i will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: rockytommy
Reviews.Content: We were picked up by the Hotel shuttle and transported directly to the Hotel where we were met by very friendly and helpful staff. The whole feeling in the hotel was very welcoming. I felt that we had stepped back in time a little especially with the decor but was pleasantly surprised that everything worked very well and we slept very comfortably. Up on the roof terrace where we took breakfast, we were entertained, looking over the rather delapidated rooftops of the neighbourhood, where seagulls were raising their young amongst the fallen down bricks and timbers lying about. The hotel is very conveniently located for sightseeing and restaurants. We walked through a small bazaar each day full of georgous goods and after being "harrassed" for the first couple of days, we quickly became "one of the family" with the venders who greeted us warmly as we passed. Our local Mosque was the "Blue Mosque" and if we wandered down behind the "Blue wooden Hotel" past the "Four Seasons Hotel" there are some fantastic restaurants. We walked everywhere we wanted to go for 7 days and only used the tram on the last day. The location and friendliness of Tashkonak were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to start and end each day”
Reviews.Author: citytraveller60
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to stay, we couldn't have asked for more. Our stay in Istanbul was short and we wanted somewhere small, welcoming, near restaurants, easy to walk to and from, with views of the sea and main sites. The Tashkonak had it all. all the staff were kind, endlessly patient, helpful in booking tours for us or suggesting ways ht we could fit everything into our tight schedule. The bedroom was clean, the bathroom too, we appreciated the comfortable beds and fresh linen every day. Breakfast was a feast with plenty of choice and hot tea and good coffee made the start of the day a delight as the ships made their way in and out of the Bosphorous and the Blue Mosque minarets towered behind us. A real find!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff, lovely atmosphere, good value”
Reviews.Author: CateJolley
Reviews.Content: I stayed in TashKonak with my mother for 4 nights during our first visit to Istanbul. The staff: very friendly, excellent English, extremely helpful in offering visits and advice on what to do in a non-intrusive way, ready with a smile. The rooms: As you'd expect for a 3-star, comfortable firm beds, good pillows, very clean with daily maid and fresh towels, A/C, TV, good shower. The location: Extremely convenient for the main attractions. Quiet at night though restaurants are a short walk. The nightlife is in a different part of town. The facilities: The lobby has sofas and magazines, the garden is nicely lit with free tea and tables/chairs. The breakfast room is on the top floor with nice views over the sea. The terrace benefits from the same views and has seating where you can read a book on a hot day. The rest: Good, externsive breakfast with great coffee and local honey/yoghurt. If I was being picky I'd say it could be more modern in its decor and rooms to be larger. If you want to be in the action go somewhere else as it's very quiet in this area. It has a Turkish rather than a Western feel, ie you know you're in Turkey rather than you could be anywhere in the world. For what it costs it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. Good for first time travellers to Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: behbexvi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the good reviews I read here in tripadvisor and simply because they are prompt in replying to all my query. I'm happy I did. :) It is a small hotel but they have everything you need. Walking distance to the tourist spots like Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque and there's a lot of restaurants around too. Tip: Walk a little further past the school (i forgot the name), you'll see a chinese restaurant which serves yummy food! :) Breakfast was great. They clean the room everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jeeson
Reviews.Content: I prefer small, family-run hotels like the Tashkonak. The hotel is a short walk from the Blue Mosque and other major sites with convenient bus connections to other parts of Istanbul. The staff was very helpful in answering questions, recommending neighborhood restaurants (the nearby Cesme restaurant is excellent), and working with us on car rental problems. The roof top restaurant is great for breakfast, but I wouldn't recommend it for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in great location. Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: CockyBarK
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here on a recent trip to Istanbul. We were very happy with our choice of hotel. The staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. The rooms were a great size, ours had a couch and small table. The bathroom was clean and very modern. Breakfast is included and served on the roof top which has great views out over Istanbul. The hotel picked us up from the airport for free which was a nice touch, the return trip was 20 euros. There was free wi fi through the hotel which was great plus they had a free computer. The only gripe that we had was that the room was somewhat noisy, we were on the ground floor tucked in underneath the stairwell and could hear a lot of comings and goings on the stairs. But it didn't bother us too much. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I would stay at in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Tey70
Reviews.Content: Tashkonak is the perfect place to stay in a bustling city like Istanbul. After a noisy and over-stimulating day, nothing could be better than to return to this hotel for rest and relaxation. The staff could not be more accommodating and friendly; the garden is a delight; the room is comfortable with plenty of hot water and the breakfast enough to sustain one all morning.

Reviews.Title: “charming small hotel in an excellent position”
Reviews.Author: honkypalle
Reviews.Content: we spent some days in this small hotel really charming with a cozy and fresh garden that you 'll apreciate mostly after a long visit of the beautiful town of istanbul. everything is really positive about this hotel: position helpfulness of the personal, welcoming, cleaness of the rooms. we had a family room for 5 people, really not easy to find nowadays. just one tip: for breakfast I would really have apreciated a piece of cake os a bisquit: there is a large variety of cheese and ham and eggs but very little sweet...

Reviews.Title: “Adequate with some good features”
Reviews.Author: rgmit123
Reviews.Content: I would echo the sentiments of 'Reasonable Place to Bunk' (April 10th) following our stay at this hotel. Our reception and arrival did not go smoothly even though we were asked to confirm our booking a few days prior to arrival and we provided an arrival time. On arrival (11.40am) we were told there was no record of our booking, then, when it was found, that our room was not ready and we were asked to wait. Shown to our room around 12.30pm the door was opened to a wall of smoke fumes so we declined the room, having asked for nonsmoking. Reception did not think another room would be available so we were asked to wait. There were no facilities for refreshments so after a tiring 6 hour journey (by road and air up from Southern Turkey) we left our bags and went to a nearby cafe.Maybe we caught the hotel on a difficult morning given the very positive feedback posted on this site. We dropped by our preferred hotel HOTELLINO in the hope of a cancellation. They gave us a warm welcome, remembering our short stay a few months earlier. We had tried to rebook this time but they were already full. (See my November review) When we returned to Tashkonak at 2.00pm a room had been found and we were able to complete our 3 night stay. The room, on the third floor was spacious and clean but rather dated with a large fridge and old style portable TV on top in front of a radiator in the middle. The bed was comfortable. Plus points of this hotel are: great views from breakfast terrace, good turkish breakfast, reasonable location in quiet part of Sultanahmet. Probably OK if you are a first time visitor to Istanbul as good english is spoken. Negative points: Large number of stairs to negotiate from upper floor rooms. Breakfast room on 4th floor but no lift and a separate staircase to many guest rooms (we were on 3rd floor on a separate staircase). Brisk 10 minute walk from tramstop is ok with a backpack but not if you have luggage. Our experience didnt live up to the tripadvisor hype this hotel has received

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel, beutifull rooms and wonderfull staff”
Reviews.Author: malisa-10
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks small from the outside but has so much to offer. We were 8 of us and all the rooms we had were clean and very comfortable. The staff were nice and we made freinds with them straightaway. The roof terrace is the best! We had brekfast there and there was plenty of choice. The terrace had views of the sea and it was a brilliant start to the day. We would recommend this hotel to all coming to Istanbul. Blue Mosque, topkapi and all main attractions were only minutes away. We really had a fab time in Istanbul. Malisa and family Coventry UK

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Istanbul's historic centre”
Reviews.Author: kadrikou
Reviews.Content: I first stayed with a friend in a twin room (in the apartments' section of the hotel), then later stayed on alone in a single room in the hotel proper. Both rooms were impeccably clean, and the one in the apartments' section had an especially cosy bathroom with a bathtub. The staff is very pleasant and speaks good English, free wifi is available in all rooms and the main sights are within 5-10 min walk . The main asset of the hotel, however, is breakfast on a quiet, idyllic terrace with views to the Blue Mosque and the glittering, bright blue sea. And I've never tasted so delicious black olives! Highly recommended, and the price value is excellent. (The only drawback what I can point out was the single room's location next to the staircase, so it was a bit too loud in the mornings when other guests started to walk up and down and slam their doors but that really is a minor drawback compared to all the plusses and the nights were divinely quiet)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, feeling like you never left home”
Reviews.Author: Nonaa-65
Reviews.Content: A Very friendly, helpful staff; thety make our stay esay. The breakfast was very good with different varieties, the view from the tars where the breakfast serviced is very nice. The room was clean, very small though. It has an excellent location in the old city; a lot of resturant around, close to all the attractive sites the visitors want to see & near to the Tramm & the sea site which make it an excellent choise for me. In general it is a very good hotel for having a memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: carnivore110
Reviews.Content: We had initially made a reservation at the nearby Asmali Konak Hotel. However, due to a number of guest having to extend their stay due to fligh cancellations, we found out upon our arrival that our room was no longer avaialbe. After a stressful morning we eventually ended up at the Tashkonak Hotel. Our family (2 yound children aged 3 and 8 months) were quite tired by the time of our arrival at the Tashkonak but the staff made us feel very welcome and offered us a spacious family room which was tastefully decorated . The location is very central, only a short walk from the blue mosque. As we were traveling with 2 small children we ofter had to make requests for washing bottles, heating milk ect and the staff were always more than happy to assist us. We were able to leave the baby stroller downstairs which also a great help given our room was on the 1st floor. Breaksfast was served on a terrace with amazing views overlooking the sea. Our only minor quiblle was that the quality and variety of the breakfast (buffet) could have been improved and items good have been replenished more frequently. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and would definitely reccomend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very family friendly and good central location.”
Reviews.Author: M0nika71
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 3 kids in Hotel Tashkonak for almost a week. The hotel is a very good starting point to visit a lot of interesting places in the historical center of Istanbul. You can reach the most of them within a walk of 10-20 minutes. Very friendly staff. Especially friendly for children. Also very helpful (pick up from the airport, organization of trips etc).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: thomasbj
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the volcanic eruption on Iceland. As a consequence, the hotel had more than a few guests, including ourselves, that were constantly demanding attention from the hotel staff and reception for information about extending our stay and alternatives on how to get another flight, train or bus out of Istanbul. The staff handled the situation professionally with care and attention while also attending to their regular tasks of running a hotel. The roof top restaurant and breakfast area offered a nice view of the Marmara Sea and Bosphorus Strait, with morning haze, a warming sun, bird song and prayers from the nearby mosque reminding you that you are definitely not at home in the cold north of Europe. All in all a great place from where exploring Istanbul is easy.

Reviews.Title: “The Best In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tashkonakfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was , truly, the best in which I have stayed. GREAT location ! Just a short distance to so many places; Aya Sofya, Hippodrome, Sultanahmet (Blue) Mosque, Old City walls, Marmara Sea, Underground Cistern, etc... Also, walking distance to Grand Bazaar, and a (very) short (easy ) tram ride to Valens Aquaduct and Spice Bazaar. The staff was professional and SO NICE !! Inan at the front desk had wonderful English as well as people skills and gave wonderful info about the city and Turkish language. The included breakfast was HUGE and the wonderful lady in charge of it was so nice and professional. Spectacular views of Marmara Sea! Wonderful, clean suite and modern bath. LOVED our stay at this hotel and will recommend it highly!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, peaceful place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: winnieapooh
Reviews.Content: Friendly, clean and large room. We were even given a baby cot for our baby. All of the hotel staff recommendations were good. The hotel is very close to a moazin, so prepare yourself for a dusk and dawn call to prayer. I don't think you can get away from this unless you go to a fancy hotel far from Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Place to Bunk”
Reviews.Author: msa_t3
Reviews.Content: Tashkonak is a small hotel that cater to those who want a place to sleep, somewhere close to the tourist attraction in Sultanahmed, in a safe neighbourhood and proprietor who does not leave you feeling you have been had. For those looking for a 5 star hotel with large rooms, abundance of creature comfort and 5 star treatment, this is not the place, if one were to read odd negative feedback. Anyway, my colleague and I got what we wanted.. a clean and basic accommodation, at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, gracious hosts, nice people.”
Reviews.Author: livinitup2much
Reviews.Content: Staff was very nice, always helpful, any time of the day, even packed breakfast for us the day we left due to an early flight out!!!!!. Walking distance to major attractions. Breakfast on the roof-top terrace ruled!! Rooms are beautiful, clean, spacious. If i ever went back to Istanbul, I would stay here again. Taksim - new town is a cab ride away tho.

Reviews.Title: “awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: jalilik
Reviews.Content: This small quiet hotel is charming. It has a familial atmosphere and the service is excellent. Breakfast is provided in the terrace with a view on the old houses and seagulls. Receptionists are very very helpful! Do not hesitate to ask them about good plans; they will be very efficient with any needed reservation. The location of the hotel is very convenient for those interested in visiting the old city as most of the must see places are at a walking distance. For the rest, a tramway station is a few minutes from the hotel. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier”
Reviews.Author: CriticInMyOwnMind
Reviews.Content: Great food and cozy, clean room. Plenty of hot water. Super-great location and service. I defy anyone to find a better view than from the Tashkonak terrace/restaurant. The Blue mosque looms large on the top of the hill on one side of the terrace (mosque is 5 minute walk) and the deep blue sea on the other. Lots of restaurants close by plus a nice bazaar. Also close to the tram. Note that the call to prayer minaret is across the street. Very exotic and soothing sounds for us Americans, especially in the afternoon when taking a break from touring.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic hotel in amazing location”
Reviews.Author: travellingcherry
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, situated in a quiet street. The staff were incredibly helpful, welcoming and made me feel safe. An authentic, Eastern mansion with twisted staircases and painted ceilings; if you are looking for a standard identikit hotel - go elsewhere! This is a hotel you can get happily lost in, exploring the various corridors and stairwells, emerging at the top onto the most amazing terrace. Breakfast is good, and served up here in the sunshine while the traffic builds on the Bosphorus. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable, overlooking the secret garden which was softly lit at night. The haunting cry of the minarets can be heard from over the wall, it's not until you climb the stairs to the terrace that you see the impressive structure behind. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and intend to return (with treats in my pocket for the friendly little cat omnipresent outside the hotel!). Good value. NOTE: if you use other transport (than the hotel's airport service) be prepared with good directions, my taxi driver spent 15 minutes looking for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a short break in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LouiseW123
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel which I'd recommend to anyone. Great location for sightseeing and restaurants. Very helpful and welcoming staff. Good breakfast with excellent views from the roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel With Warm Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: tblo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and really loved it. The hotel staff is amazing, so sincere and nice and willing to help out with whatever we needed. Rooms are cozy and comfortable. Great breakfast on balcony with fantastic view. After a long day of walking around in Istanbul, this hotel was so nice to come "home" to, especially when the staff greets you with a cup of hot apple tea.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel that Makes You Feel At Home”
Reviews.Author: RenfromToronto
Reviews.Content: Warm and Helpful Staff, Great Location, and Great Value We stayed for 4 nights at first and loved the place that we booked for two more after a short trip to Capadocia. The staff made the hotel extra special. They treated us like friends, and they went above and beyond with their service. The location was superb -- just a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque in Sultanahmet, and a few more to most everything else. We had two different rooms, which, although not large, were beautiful and nicely comfortable for two people, and of great value. In fact, our stay included a buffet breakfast with a large variety of food to choose from. Definitely recommended for value travellers out there, or those who prefer a warm and friendly family atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Positive impression”
Reviews.Author: Anbrogio
Reviews.Content: Couple from GÃ¶teborg This hotel lives up to the description on its website. The pickup service from the airport was excellent and the staff were waitng to greet us when we arrived at the hotel. Our room was very clean and comfortable and overlooked the pleasant terraced garden. The breakfast room is at the top of the hotel and has a breathtaking view. It is a buffet with plenty to choose from. All the historical sites are just a short walk from the hotel. The manager was always on hand to answer our questions on where to go and where to eat. It really did feel more like staying in a home than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd visit and it just gets better.”
Reviews.Author: JimScarborough
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple 3 years ago and were impressed. We visited this time with our family and the staff and hotel lived up to our expectations. The location is great at the rear of the Blue Mosque; all the main sites are easily accessible with a local tram stop that takes you easily to the Grand Bazaar, to the ferry point at Eminuno (ferries to the Asian side), or across the Golden Horn. The hotel organises an airport pickup from both Istanbul airports. Communication with the hotel by email was easy and efficient, this was important as our plans changed but our revised needs were willingly met. The hotel is based in old buildings and some internal staircases will have to be climbed, but the view from the rooftop conservatory where breakfast is served and light evening meals can be taken is superb. We suspect that rooms 107, 207 and 307 are the most spacious, but these rooms are to the rear and the call to prayer from the Blue Mosque is loud, if that might be a problem perhaps a room at the front may be quieter. The hotel Staff are very helpful, provide sound advice if required and are all keen to ensure visitors enjoy their stay.
