On balance a great little hotel, very Turkish, moderately priced, very comfortable, great location, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: JoanneHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: The Tashkonak is a decent budget hotel - clean, serviceable and warm with a plentiful breakfast buffet. However I felt the experience of staying there did not quite match the level of many reveiws. The room we stayed in was incredibly small, a single sized room masquerading as a double, with barely any room to walk around the bed. The clothes cupboard was tiny, so hardly any room to hang clothes if staying for more than 2 or 3 nights, and there was no extra storage which meant we were constantly falling over one of our suitcases on the floor. Whilst the desk staff were polite and helpful, this felt mainly superficial, with the objective being to relieve people of as much money as possible rather than directing them to what was actually being requested. The hotel reception also seemed to serve more as a front living room for the social lives of the desk staff rather than as a place where visitors could relax. I could not access my email on the computer, provided for that purpose, as the settings wouldn't permit it. So overall I would say that Tashkonak is a good budget option, but not on the same level as a similarly priced B&B at home. Istanbul prices are still cheap in some areas, but beware Sultanahmet prices which are vastly inflated with a coffe out, for example, costing more than at home.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul's best kept secret.”
Reviews.Author: jeddawiya
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with the most warm hospitality. I felt like I was a guest in someone's home, yet with the privacy and amenities of hotel. The staff was professional, helpful, and kind. The hotel was in the perfect location- within walking distance to the sights, yet tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. The breakfast buffet every morning had enough choices for every palette. You cannot get a better value in Istanbul. The rooms were clean and cozy. I will recommend this hotel to anyone that I know traveling to Istanbul, and I hope to have the chance to come back and visit...soon!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a pasa”
Reviews.Author: KostasInTheHague
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best small hotels I have seen in all of my life. All of the staff, one by one is there to help you, the place was very clean and had a homely feel. The value for money is simply unbeatable and the location is excelent. Many times during my stay I was behaved with a way that made me feel that I am not simply a customer, that will stay 10 days, then leave and then another one will come. Not at all, I felt I was special and that their hospitality every time was more important than my money. And trust me this hotels has by nature some values which are on a top priority. Had a good laugh with all of the guys at the reception will definetely return here. It is a top of the line hotel and I would like through here to thank them for everything they did for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: jeannetteBreda
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Hotel Tashkonak. Altough our plane was far to late on arrival, we found our transfer very friendly waiting. The staff is most helpfull and considerate. We stayed for 4 nights in the suite in the new part of the hotel, just around the corner. Probably because we arrived at 1.30 PM ....for not disturbing the aother guests. Nice room, very clean and without charging any more! We loved the room, the breakfast. The only thing was ....our neigbours made lots of noise , coming home late and talking loud. The walls are a bit thin we presume...

Reviews.Title: “Take skis in winter”
Reviews.Author: istewart103
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week, staff friendly and smiling. The view from the terrace is fantastic when the sun is out, the Blue Mosque and especially the Sea of Mamara, the breakfast is good too and they do an evening meal at a reasonable rate but byo if you want a drink with it. I only have two things to be aware of, if you sleep light the call to prayer is loud early in the morning but I expect that and it reminds me of where I am in the world. The other thing is in winter snow which ever way you leave the hotel there is a steep slope on cobbles to be tackled and they don't grit down there, converse was not my wisest choice in footwear. The surrounding area is fantastic and well worth getting lost in, the hotel will give you a card so if you do need a taxi you've got the address and most people are happy to see a tourist off the beaten track. Winter is a great time to see Istanbul if only I'd had a pair of skis.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nemylk
Reviews.Content: Great location, on a quiet street, the staff is friendly and helpful, always ready to help. We stayed for 6 nights in 5 people and had a double room very spacious and comfortable overlooking the garden and a triple room tighter. The delicious breakfast, with a beautiful view of the Bosphorus was a special moment: a variety of breads, cheese, jams, coffee, tea, juice, olives ... We had a free transfer from airport to hotel and hotel to the airport and also a discount for paying in cash. Come back again, without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, comfortable, and great breakfast on terrace.”
Reviews.Author: siyahzeytin
Reviews.Content: After staying at a friend's apartment for most of our time in Istanbul we needed a place for the last two nights of my stay in Istanbul. We cruised around Sultanahmet checking prices and availability for a 2 night stay in early January. We found Tashkonak to be the best value in that area, and furthermore the people there were friendly and trustworthy. They ended up upgrading us for free to what was really a suite, it had a sitting area with a couch and a table. It was very nice and a great deal for the price we paid. There is a discount for paying with cash. The only downside was that the room wasn't super quiet. But this place is a restored Ottoman house, so it doesn't have the heavy construction that a newer place would have. I would rather have the atmosphere than having it be dead quiet but others may not. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family. Oh yeah, they also have a great terrace with a buffet breakfast that is above average.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: texxIreland
Reviews.Content: So glad i picked this hotel.Perfect location,warm,comfortable bed.Spotlessly clean and a lovely buffet breakfast run with pride from the lady who looked after it.Happy enthusiastic staff who were most helpful and as we stayed 3 nights they picked us up at the airport,which is a terrific bonus!I Free internet access and afternoon tea.I dont often write reviews however i must highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Fun”
Reviews.Author: electrickettle
Reviews.Content: I had a 10 day stay at the Tashkonak and my stay here was more welcoming than I ever expected. The staff were very friendly,helpful and genuinely lovely. All of the staff went out of their was to provide excellent service and interesting conversations. My room was clean and the bed very comfy. Not much of a breakfast eater, however, the view was great as was the coffee. The location couldn't be better as it is very central to many attractions. Thank you for my wonderful stay and Ali for making me smile :)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant boutique hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet.”
Reviews.Author: zmarak
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul, Turkey for the first time with my wife and three children. Hotel Tashkonak provided a free shuttle for us to and from the airport. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast buffet was excellent. It is located in the heart of Sultanahmet district and all the attractions are nearby. We were leaving early in the morning, to go to the airport, and they prepared free sandwiches for us. The rooms were very clean, had free wifi and all the amenities are near by. We enjoyed our stay there and would recommend it to everyone. We hope to go back there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous place”
Reviews.Author: Maxjesi
Reviews.Content: Warm and cosy hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet! Friendly, nice and kind staff!...It is like to be at home...an Ottoman home, full of glamour!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly friendly, Great Location, Hotel OK”
Reviews.Author: BrazilBilly
Reviews.Content: If this hotel did not have such an amazing staff and good location, I would not have much to say about it. The hotel itself is acceptable for budget accommodations, though it is a VERY loud (thin walls and tile floors) and the "queen" bed was in fact just a double bed by US standards. The breakfast spread grossed us out by the third morning. But the staff is excellent! Really amazingly nice, friendly, helpful, funny, and comforting. We stayed her for 10 nights and we truly felt like this was our home (or at least like we were staying with noisy Turkish relatives). To get here from the airport is pretty easy by public transportation and it takes about the same amount of time in a taxi, so you might as well use the public transport. From the airport, take the metro to the Zeytinburnu stop and then change trains and get off at Sultenhamet. From here you are about 3 blocks away. When you get off at Sultenhamet, walk towards the long and narrow grassy park (Hippodrome). You'll probably see some big dogs wandering around - I don't know why but they are always there. Find the tall Egyptian looking obilisk and head towards it. Walk to the last obilisk (the crumbling one) and then head left towards the Turkistan Asevi restaurant. Walk down the hill and turn left towards a restaurant called Doy Doy. Keep walking straight until you see the Dersaamet Hotel and then turn left. Make your first right and the hotel is on the left side. If you want a formal, romantic, new, quiet or modern hotel, this is not it. If you want to relax and feel like you are at your Turkish grandmother's house, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in brilliant location - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gingerron
Reviews.Content: This hotel and its staff did a great job of making us feel welcome and doing everything they could to make sure we had a good trip to Istanbul. We arrived very late, tired and grumpy but they instantly put us at ease, recommended places that would still be open for food and gave thorough directions which was a great start! The rooms weren't plush and we were given a room at the front which I can imagine in the summer may have got a bit noisy but while we were there it was fine - the hotel is on a very quiet street. The room was very clean and included a safe which we always prefer. The breakfast room on the top floor was lovely with a good view out over the sea, and a roaring fire. The food was also better than expected with a good range - be sure to grab a few of the fresh rolls - really good! All in all, the Tash konak isn't the best hotel in the world, but for the cost it was a real bargain and one I would definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandSojourners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tashkonak for 6 nights in total. Finding a cheap, clean hotel for a family of five is not that easy in Istanbul. We got the fmaily room with 3 single beds, 2 double and a bathroom. The room was more than adequate and e loved the light sunny aspect. The room was kept spotless by the staff. The guys on reception outstanding. Made our teenagers feel so welcome, and the kids especially liked the free internet access on the lobby computer. Breakfast great and views amazing. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view from the rooftop breakfast area, terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: CurlyGurl_9
Reviews.Content: I loved the charming room with ensuite bathroom, the breakfast area with its stunning view of the Bosphorus and Sea of Marmara, the delicious buffet, the helpful and attentive staff. The neighborhood was safe and very quiet, the courtyard where afternoon tea could be had was lush with plantings, and the bookshelves were full of interesting books in many languages. It was the perfect retreat after full days of sightseeing and shopping. It's a short walk to the Blue Mosque as well as the train.

Reviews.Title: “great location, breakfast, and staff! Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Ottawajuggler
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel with roof top terrace for super buffet breakfast with a great view of the Sea of Marmora. Helpful staff, Very clean premises, free inte-rnet terminal to check e-mails. Located in historic area, near reasonable restaurants and 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque. Small but adequate room. with safe for valuables. Helpful, friendly, responsive staff. Quiet - except for the early morning neighbourhood call to prayers. We really enjoyed our one week stay!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Vegas7Expert
Reviews.Content: A great boutique hotel for exploring Old Istanbul. The rooms are confortable and cozy. The staff was friendly, and the included breakfast was great from the roof top restaurant. It is very close to the Blue Mosque (you can hear the call to prayer) and other sites. A great value.

Reviews.Title: “Added positively to our Istanbul experience”
Reviews.Author: LouiseStockholm
Reviews.Content: We were very well taken care of, friendly service, good tips and a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with first class service and really friendly staff oozing helpfulness”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireDonkey
Reviews.Content: Sums it up really, basically a really good value for money comfortable place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Tashkonak? We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: wendyc2020
Reviews.Content: First and foremost the manager (Savas), and his staff deserve a special mention, they practically become your family in Istanbul. They are great fun, very friendly and genuinely care about the hotel guests. They are also very professional and totally efficient. Everything is clean and fresh and the whole hotel is tastefully decorated. The rooms are lovely, breakfast is fabulous and tea in the garden an especially nice touch. Fast internet access is available in the lobby. We just loved it and would not dream of staying anywhere else if we go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location”
Reviews.Author: Dogwalker2
Reviews.Content: My wife , daughter and I spent three nights in mid October for our second stay at this hotel. The hotel is ideally located near most of the major tourist sites in Istanbul. The room was small but clean and comfortable with a good shower and plenty of hot water. Breakfast is very well supplied and served buffet style with fine views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Miramar. The staff is friendly and helpful including the manager, a British expatriate who has all the information you need about Istanbul. We especially enjoyed the bosky courtyard where you can relax with a cup of tea and plan your evening sightseeing or perhaps contemplate how those crafty taxi drivers managed to fleece you of your Turkish lira. The hotel may lack some five star frills but is an excellent value and is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions can be misleading...”
Reviews.Author: Provarma
Reviews.Content: We booked an 8 night stay well in advance, requesting a double room overlooking the garden, as did our friends who arrived at the same time . On arrival at 9pm we were allocated a double on the third floor which was extremely small with no clothes storage space so it would have been impossible to unpack and walk around in the room. Our friends we given a twin room on the ground floor but overlooking the street, not the garden. They got to reception first to complain! They were re-allocated a twin room on the third floor overlooking the garden, with which they were content for their 6 night stay. The only rooom still available to us was the one they had vacated, so we opted for it. It was not quiet. Although not a lot of traffic passes down this street, the refuse truck at 5 a.m with its orange flashing light and lots of noise was not welcome. The sound of the call to prayer from the adjacent mosque did wake us, but this was not a problem - it is a fact of life in a Muslim city. Next morning we were told we would be given a different room (a twin) overlooking the garden which we accepted. We were asked to pack our things and the hotel staff moved our bags to the new room while we were out for the day. We were also told that we should not have been given the first room for an 8 night stay - it was far too small. All this could have been avoided with a little pre-planning, but it seems that rooms are allocated on arrival, not in advance. From then on, things changed, and we could not have been happier. A bottle of Cava and a dish of fruit were left in our room by way of apology for the room fiasco -a nice touch. Breakfast was a cut above other hotels we have stayed at in the Sultanahmet area and the staff were extremely helpful! Inan and Ali on reception were absolutely superb - always willing to offer a word of advice when asked. It was they who made this a nice stay in the long run. The manager was a bit anonymous but did come out to the car they had arranged (included in the room rate) to take us to the airport. This, again, was a nice touch. After a poor start we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would recommend it. It is well-located in terms of access to the mosques and museums, and has several good restaurants close by. There is also a good laundry just around the corner, which we used as the hotel does not offer laundry facilities. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: familyx3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights early October and are pleased that we did! The staff are what makes this hotel what it is with all the little extras like cutting fresh grapes off the vine in the courtyard and serving them to us whilst we had tea and then encouraging us to take them to our room to enjoy later! The rooms are small and we had a cot in ours so even more so (book the tripple if you have children its much bigger) but beautifully decorated and spotless. The roof top terrace has great views and breakfast had a great selection of traditional Turkish and European food. During our stay the staff went out of their way to find play grounds for us and even gave us directions to a shopping mall on a raining day. There is also free internet in the lobby for guests. One down side, the hotel is accross the road from a Mosque and our room faced it - so we all got up at 6am. When booking ask for a courtyard room!

Reviews.Title: “satisfied”
Reviews.Author: JeffH69
Reviews.Content: I was in istanbul from Sept 25 to Oct 4. I had a hard time deciding which hotel to stay at. I wanted to be in Sultanahmet. A Turkish friend recommended this hotel and after reading the reviews on here I decided to book. The staff are great, friendly and helpful. I basically got exactly what I was expecting. I have no complaints but chances are I will stay somewhere else next time. I saw a few other hotels that did have nicer views and probably a little nicer rooms. I know I will pay for it, but I would like to experience something different next time. But this is a very nice hotel and I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Familiar Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ustagholi
Reviews.Content: Coming directly from Tehran, we stayed at this Hotel from 30.09 until 05.10, together with our daughter joining us from Switzerland in a comfortable triple room. Just from the biginning we felt quite comfortable there and the very friendly and helpful staff made our stay every day more enjoyable. This Hotel is located in SULTAN AHMET area, which is only short walking distance to the most historical places such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the Topkapi Palast. A computer could be used the whole day with free internet connection. The breakfast buffet, with plentiful, choice of food, was served on the roof Terrace, with a wonderful view of the MARMARA Sea from one side and the Blue Mosque from the other. For our next stay in Istanbul we will certainly choose TASHKONAK Hotel. Fam. Hashemi

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Birger77
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to most sights, quiet street in Sultanahmet . Good breakfast served on rooftop terrasse, with a great view over the Bosporus. Very hospitable and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SueandAndyGrover
Reviews.Content: We arranged for collection from the airport with Tashkonak, and although slight delay on our part they were waiting for us. We were delighted with the location of the hotel, down a cobbled side street just a short walk to the main sights we wanted to see. We walked everywhere from here and felt very safe in this neighbourhood. The room size was good and we had bathroom with shower - all very clean. Our room overlooked the garden, where we had afternoon tea (compliments of the hotel). The front of house team were extremely helpful, recommended restaurants offered directions when we needed assistance. Breakfast was upstairs either in the roof top restaurant or on the roof terrace, which offers views of the Blue Mosque domes and the Marmaris sea. On the first morning we were woken (5ish) by the call to prayer, but slept through it the following mornings! Anyway we loved the sights, sounds and smells of Istanbul !

Reviews.Title: “The Tashkonak is a gem.”
Reviews.Author: gribbleLondon
Reviews.Content: This delightful hotel tucked away in a quiet side street, 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia is a wonderful base for seeing Istanbul - charming rooms, lashings of hot water in the shower, a roof terrace with excellent views of the Sea of Marmara and a shady, relaxing courtyard garden with free tea (including a range of herbal teas) every day from mid afternoon to early evening. The staff were friendly and helpful, often anticipating our requirements. If you like the plastic uniformity and impersonal service of the big chains you probably won't like this hotel, but if you if you want your hotel to be a real part of the Istanbul experience and to leave feeling you have made new friends, you will love it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: freesoul09
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Tashkonak Hotel in Istanbul - our first visit to that fascinating city. Well, I can recommend it unreservedly. It is small, friendly and clean. The staff are most friendly and welcoming, and will go out of their way to help. It's in a great location - in the "old" city - right where you want to be to visit the Mosques and historical sites. It's down amongst a quaint maze of cobbled streets - containing a wide range of small shops and restaurants. Your day starts wonderfully, with breakfast being served on the rooftop - with marvellous views of the Bosphorous. I can't think of a better way to eat breakfast! I would certainly stay there again when visiting Istanbul again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't think of a better place”
Reviews.Author: oishiisan12
Reviews.Content: Located within an easy walk to the main historic sites of Istanbul, the hotel is comfortable, nicely appointed, and has excellent service. The staff is ready to help at a moments notice but not overbearing. The desk clerk even helped us modify our sightseeing plans to be more efficient. The daily breakfast on the rooftop is delicious, and the setting is very peaceful with views of the Sea of Marmara beyond the surrounding rooftops. Can't recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location for visiting the old part of Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: shaz1242
Reviews.Content: We selected the hotel due to previous feedback on this site and it didn't disappoint. The staff were friendly and very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is ideally situated for all the main sites in the old city - 5mins walk to the Blue Mosque and all easily accessible on foot, as well as a tram stop if you wish to venture further afield. We also found plenty of good restaurants nearby. Wouldn't recommend the hotel if you have trouble with stairs - breakfast is on the roof terrace and some people may struggle. If you have time during your stay would recommend a boat trip on the Bosphorous & also Dolmabache & Beylerbei Palace as well as Chora Church are well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: halaljello
Reviews.Content: Great place. Great people. Very hospitable. Very nice and convenient location. A mosque within 5 feet of the building was very nice. There is a very personal touch in this place. One of the very nice ladies even sat down with me for an hour to plan our day. the breakfast terrace is breathtaking, the staff is trustworthy, I cannot say enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: stagapit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tash Konak for five nights in August 2009 and loved it. The location is fantastic (a real neighborhood), the rooms clean, cutely decorated and well maintained, and the staff super friendly ... going out of their way to help.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, great location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: American_Andaluz
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. It's definitely closest to the Blue Mosque and further to other sites, but still walking distance to everything in Sultanahmet. The staff was very helpful, and even arranged for a free van to pick us up and take us to a nice rooftop restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. The courtyard was peaceful, the room was clean and even came with slippers and some candy treats. The free internet is just one computer in the lobby, but I never had to wait to use it. My window was right next to a mosque, so the call to prayer was a bit loud...but that's basically going to be unavoidable anywhere in Turkey!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KateSanFran
Reviews.Content: The location of this place can't be beat -- within quick walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, and the heart of Sultanahment. The staff is friendly, helpful, and always ready to give recommendations. Rooms were clean, spacious, comfortable and blessedly air conditioned! There's a lovely garden in the back where you can sit and have tea or read. Breakfasts were buffet style and tasty, served on a rooftop terrace with a lovely view of the Sea of Marmara. And the value of our room was really excellent (a surprise to find in a city where everything is expensive!). One last note: Sultanahmet isn't known for its food -- stay here to be close to the great sights of Istanbul, but for dinner, go to Beyoglu, a quick tram ride across the Golden Horn.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect haven - comfortable, convenient and civilised”
Reviews.Author: Familytravellers008
Reviews.Content: We booked on-line and were given exactly what we requested - a double for ourselves and twin for our teenagers. The reasonable rates caused some concern about what we'd find - but we could not have been more delighted at the stylish, thoughtful and very comfortable rooms (with excellent air-conditioning), the ground floor terrace (for tea) and the roof top terraces and its views across the Sea of Marmara (where the excellent breakfast was served). All within easy walking distance of so much but in a location which felt far from touristy. We're only sorry that we were only in Istanbul for a single night - this will definitely be the hotel to which we return.

Reviews.Title: “A special spot that should not be overlooked!!!”
Reviews.Author: barryman8
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the TashKonak Hotel for a week . From the moment we arrived the staff was arm, friendly and helpful Each staff member treats the guests like "family" and offer their advic eand help when needed. I also made a last minute request for a Garden-view Room and it was AMAZING!!! ,Beautiful,Quiet and more than I could have hoped for. The rooftop dinig for breakfast made our start to the day extra specila.The Hotel is in such a GREAT location, close enough to all Tourist sights but away from the crowds and city like atmosphere. The staff arranged for a special trip to Cappodocia and organized the entire event,no worries for us!! If you are traveling to Istanbul I HIGHLY recommend the TASHKONAK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Little Place”
Reviews.Author: Zmust
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner a few weeks ago and loved it. It's located on a cute little street not far from the Blue Mosque and St. Sohpia but is in an acutal neighborhood as oppose to a tourist strip. There is great food and shopping and a nice Hamaam nearby. The room was small but clean and air conditioned. The television didn't work but this is not the hotel for you, if you plan to watch television while in Istanbul. The owner is a British ex-pat who is clearly in love with Istanbul and knows a lot about the city. She and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Altogether- a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “So nice!”
Reviews.Author: Dgyodia
Reviews.Content: We stayed nine days in Tashkonak Hotel in August 2009. This is a very well located, quiet hotel in the old part of the city, near all the famous sites to visit : Blue Mosque, Ayasofia, Topkapi...we can go there by foot. Public transport is near by as well. The staff is so nice and really concerned about the guests! The breakfast on the terrace with a fantastic view on Bosphorus was a pleasure each day. The ARASTA Bazar near the hotel groups several nice "boutiques" where the sellers are not so intrusive than in "le Grand Bazar" and the quality is better. M-M & Jorg

Reviews.Title: “a week in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Dgyodia
Reviews.Content: We stayed nine days in Tashkonak Hotel in August 2009. This is a very well located, quiet hotel in the old part of the city, near all the famous sites to visit : Blue Mosque, Ayasofia, Topkapi...we can go there by foot. Public transport is near by as well. The staff is so nice and really concerned about the guests! The breakfast on the terrace with a fantastic view on Bosphorus was a pleasure each day. The ARASTA Bazar near the hotel groups several nice "boutiques" where the sellers are not so intrusive than in "le Grand Bazar" and the quality is better. Marie-Madeleine & Jorge

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: nomad633
Reviews.Content: Tash Konak is a very conveniently located hotel, just a ten minute walk from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and other major sites. The staff of the hotel are exceptionally friendly, warm, and went out of their way to be helpful to us. We needed their assistance to resolve a travel related issue and their staff, and Ali in particular, were instrumental in helping us fix the problem. They had great advice for us on what to see and where to go. The rooms are small but comfortable, there is a very nice terrace where a good breakfast is served each morning and there is a very good patio for relaxing after a long day of sight-seeing. Given the reasonable price of the hotel, the great location, and the quality of the staff, I can wholeheartedly recommend to the Tash Konak Hotel in Istanbul. We spent three nights there and were very happy. Just be sure to grab a card from the front desk with an address and map on it because taxis have trouble finding it. On a side note, you can walk to the tram line ten minutes away and take it to the airport. This is much better than the shuttle or the taxi, I found. Good internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel with everything we could wish for!”
Reviews.Author: Ozayr
Reviews.Content: I normally keep my reviews brief on tripadvisor however i have a lot to say about this superb hotel so please be patient and read what i have to say. First and foremost, let me talk about the staff at Tashkonak. I have stayed at many hotels throughout the world, both large franchises and smaller boutique style and i must say that Tashkonak's staff are by far the most welcoming, helpful and knowledgable people i have come across. Inan, Ali and Hayati were the general managers that either worked the day shift or night shift and were always at hand to assist us no matter how small or large our request was. What struck us the most was theri abilities to speak multiple languages whcih was welcomed not only by us but other international guests. Between them they could speak Turkish, English, German, Dutch and Spanish (possibly more!). Then there was Adalet, who was organising the breakfast each morning. Always greeted us with a smile and always made sure the breakfast was varied and stocked up no matter what time in the morning we came up. A point to add here is that the views from the terrace are simply wonderful. On one side you have the Blue Mosque and the other you have the Bospherous Sea! Ramazan, Ahmet and Ekrem were excellent in assisting our daily needs and always served us with a smile. The great thing about this team of people is that they are always there when you need something but never seem to be invading your space. The perfect Balance! Afternoon tea is served between 3pm and 8p in the garden cafe/terrace. Plenty of tables and chairs to relax hidden by beautiful plants and flowers. Did i mention that this was all free! Bargain! My wife loved the selection of cinamon, apple, lemon, green and turkish teas available at no extra cost. A real bonus at this hotel! The hotel itself is a traditional boutique hotel, with beautiful turkish paintings on the wall highlighting the Byzantine and Ottoman heritage. the Rugs in teh reception area and throughout the hotel give it that cosy rustic feel, it was everything we hoped and wished for and that little bit more. The bedrooms are well maintained and very clean! The air conditioning in the room worked well and was a treat after our days out in the warm sun exploring istanbul. The TV had more channels than we could count and there was enough cupboard space to hang our clothes and accessories during our stay. The painting/designs on the bedroom ceilings are a beautiful touch. Now about the location. When this hotel advertised that it is only a few hundred meteres away from the main attractions, i was a bit sceptical however our concerns were put at rest as it literally was only a few hundred meteres away from the Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque, with the Topkapi Palace only a further 100 meteres away or so. To put it simply, to walk to these attractions would only take 10minutes :) great as we did not use a taxi once! This is the perfect location for a hotel as it is close to the main sights yet is tucked away on a quiet little street which is very peaceful. Finally, its important to talk about the restaurants at your doorstep. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants near this Hotel to suit all budgets from backpacker budgets to those special occasions. To sum this up, i would say that it is the best hotel we stayed in due to the service provided by its most helpful staff, cleanliness of the rooms, presentation and design of the hotel, value for money and obvioulsy the location. As mentioned above it is near a variety of good cafes and restraraunts visited by the Turkish residents themseleves as well as the tourists. We loved it so much and were made to feel at home. My wife and i will soon be planning our next trip back and have already recomended this hotel to our friends and family! Thank you all at Hotel Tashkonak for giving us such a good time and making our holiday truly memorable!

Reviews.Title: “it is just fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sweetdance
Reviews.Content: I loved the staff , there are very helpfull and very kind. The hotel is close to everywhere and a beautifull garden for the evening , they have free tea in the garden from 3 pm to 8 pm :-) . Everyday the room has been cleaned very well. Nothing worse to say.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: NJSueNewJerseyUSA
Reviews.Content: The positive reviews of this hotel were spot on. Ideal location within easy walking distance of the major sites in the old city. The owners are fantastic - couldn't do enough to help and genuinely nice people. Lovely outdoor terrace and the roof-top breakfast terrace has great views and a wonderful way to start the day. The breakfast buffet was everything you could ask for. Some previous reviewers thought the rooms were small - perhaps we struck it lucky but our room was ample and included a couch and coffee table. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best value, best staff”
Reviews.Author: gnarheb
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to Istanbul, and the fifth hotel I've stayed at there. The Tashkonak was definitely the the best value and best experience... Quiet street near the sights, VERY helpful, kind staff, cute garden patio, great rooftop terrace view, very nice clean rooms, free internet... I can't think of anything bad to say about the place! They even pick you up from the airport, which is really helpful for first time visitors. There are many great little hotels in Sultnahamet, but the Tashkonak is just as nice, if not nicer then more expensive ones in the area. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel tucked away”
Reviews.Author: Owadally
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! It is in a prime location with all the main touristic places just within walking distance. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, if your not sure what to do or where to go the Tash Konak team will give you helpful tips. The team are fantastic, very accomodating, always there to help you out..and go beyond their way for your comfort. Rooms are of a good size, cleaned daily. The area itself even though touristic is pleasantly quiet and calm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Hotel in Old City”
Reviews.Author: jnj_travelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 days on our first trip to Istanbul and had a great experience at the Tashkonak. The hotel is close to all the major Old City sites and the location gave us a nice flavor of the city. The proximity to the Blue Mosque (we could see 2 of the minarets from our window) and a local neighborhood mosque and their regular call to prayers by the amplified muezzin just added to the atmosphere. Our room was two flights up a spiral staircase, but nice sized (we booked the large double) with charming painted ceiling designs, a refrigerator, and a very effective digital remote controlled A/C unit that had a great whisper quite sleep mode. The staff were very friendly and almost falling onver themselves to help and offer advice, and the hotel's complimentary transport to the airport (we had arrived by train from Sophia) made departure very simple.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: weekenderinthesun
Reviews.Content: A group of 8 of us visited Istanbul for a family celebration- we found this hotel on Laterooms but it was much cheaper to book direct with the hotel Communications were excellent and fast, and the hotel 's Airport pickup service was easy to arrange. We had a very relaxing stay and enjoyed the plentiful breakfast on the roof terrace Location is ideal- tucked away on a quiet street but only 5 mins walk to Blue Mosque. The staff were so friendly and really went out of their way to help, nothing was too much trouble, and lots of excellent tips on where to visit. Our rooms were small but spotless and the bathrooms have power showers- ideal after a hot day sightseeing, and the garden terrace was a peaceful haven on a hot afternoon Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best family hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: azomama
Reviews.Content: My husband, three kids and I stayed at the Tashkonak last week. We picked it because of the reviews on this site and because they were the only hotel we could find with a family room-three twin beds and a king. The location was awesome-within walking distance of almost everything we wanted to see. Shopping and dining in the area was great and friendly. The staff was warm and welcoming. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and hearty. The only thing we could complain about would be that the beds were pretty hard. Otherwise, we had an awesome stay and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay -geat people”
Reviews.Author: hattesen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Istanbul in the beginning of July. We would like to thank all the staff on the hotel for beeing so helpful and polite. Everything was just great. Fine rooms,very clean, fantastic breakfast. Nice garden. Really a warm friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: prairie_gal_9
Reviews.Content: The location was great. As was the breakfast on the rooftop terrace. But what really makes this hotel stand out is the staff. They were friendly, efficient and extremely helpful. We stayed with them at the beginning and end of our trip and particulalry appreciated the garden. It was a little oasis during the heat of the day. The second time we stayed, we requested a family room. It consists of one room (with a door that closes) for a couple, a room with two beds for kids and a shared bathroom. With a tv and air conditioning in each sleeping area, it worked out great. We'd stay there again if we came back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic week at the Hotel Tashkonak”
Reviews.Author: dareios82
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent a fanstastic week at the hotel Tashkonak. The staff is super-friendly, always available, and efficient. The location is very convenient for sightseeing. Rooms are clean. Another big plus is the breathtaking view over the Marmara Sea from the terrace where breakfast is served. The shuttle to and from the airport was confortable and on time. I honestly cannot find anything they could improve upon.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: karinaWales
Reviews.Content: istanbul was hot , busy, and wonderful.Tashkonak hotel a quiet retreat after a busy day. Mosque very close but only heard it the first morning.Picked up at airport as promised. Staff very friendly, comfortable beds, a good shower,and clean room, a bit small,but fine for our need`s.Breakfast very good, wonderful views.Hotel is close to all the main sights,an easy walk .Only problem could be that there is no lift to breakfast terrace. We would happily book into the Tashkonak on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish Delight of a stay”
Reviews.Author: Oh_Rhodes
Reviews.Content: Three uni mates and I decided on Istanbul for our annual excursion, so spent a fair amount of time going through Trip Advisor and contracting various hotels. We chose Tashkonak because: - their communication was excellent- both in terms of English and speed of reply - good location in the old city for the sites - easily arranged airport pickup - good prices - had twin (as opposed to double) rooms - roof terrace for breakie - good reviews on Trip Advisor Very friendly and helpful staff, from the chap who collected us from Ataturk airport to the reception and breakfast staff. This place ran a fantastic concierge service that would put many larger hotels to shame. The staff treated you as real guests rather than simply numbers on their booking system. Very personable and good sense of humour. Rooms, although not the most up to date, were very clean, good size, air conditioned and with character. Breakfast was a wide selection of contentinal foods- esp good were the various breads, honey & jams- certainly you could feed your belly to last you for a good number of hours. Overall, an excellent experience staying here, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A great family hotel so close to the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: MadridBeita
Reviews.Content: Great service and warm atmosfere! We really felt like home at Tashkonak Hotel. Very well situated in a cozy and nice neighbourhood so close to the main attractions. Confortable rooms with great views and a wonderful terrace and cool patio. The staff were very helpful and all their recomendations were great, dont forget to go to the Haman!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, friendly, big pleasure”
Reviews.Author: travellita
Reviews.Content: - authentic historic building, antique style, beautifully equipped - stayed in a triple room (one king size and two small beds in two connected rooms) - the room was nice and charming but rather small - bathroom (incl. hair dryer and fresh towels) was spotlessly clean - amazing ocean view from the roof terrace where breakfast is served - tasty turkish breakfast - extremely friendly and commited staff (!) - computer with free internet access in the lobby - free pick up service from the airport - centrally located but in a quiet street, small supermarket next to the hotel We can absolutely recommend this hotel! We booked it based on the tripadvisor reviews and truly enjoyed our stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: hnic17
Reviews.Content: I have only good things to say about the Tashkonak Hotel. My husband, our five-month-old baby and I spent two weeks traveling around Turkey. This was one of the nicest places we stayed. The room was not large but it was beautifully decorated and had everything we needed. The breakfast was delicious. We would gladly have spent all day on the terrace eating! The location was perfect. It is in Sultanahmet and walking distance from the main attractions, without being surrounded by the touts and vendors you'll encounter a few streets away. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If we return to Istanbul, we will return to the Tashkonak.

Reviews.Title: “a little more room please”
Reviews.Author: whatnick
Reviews.Content: we booked in advance, asked for a "large" double room, but when wee arrived it was so small that we could no even open the luggage! we gained a larger room (2sqm more!) when I complained with the consierge. I heard other tourists with the same problem there. besides this problem the position is really strategic at 100m from the blue mosque, and the breafast terrasse is really gorgeous. the ratio price/performance is maybe not so convenient...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice option”
Reviews.Author: aneves
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, in a walking distance from the main attractions. The staff is realy helpful, kind and willing to give sugestions. Even though the room is a little tiny and the TV doesnÂ´t work properly, they make up for it by having the room very clean and a bathroom equipment almost brand new. Besides, the view from the terrace is quite charming. Is a good value-price option.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Sultanahmet area of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MLivingston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 6 nights in this lovely 4-story Ottoman house converted into a 34-room hotel, hidden away in the "Byzantine" maze of streets below the Blue Mosque. Rather hard to find at first, once we got our sense of direction, we found it was a short 5-10 minute walk from the hotel to the major sights of the Sultanahmet area (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, etc.). Our room and bath were immaculately clean, and the hotel staff were super helpful and competent in English. Real pluses were the rooftop terrace and breakfast area from which we had a great view of the sea and the secluded garden where we relaxed and enjoyed Turkish tea. Our room was quite small but adequate with a small balcony and a view of the garden. The only drawback perhaps for some travelers was the lack of an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service When The Chips are Down”
Reviews.Author: droppingtozero
Reviews.Content: We chose the Tashkonak after reviewing a lot of Hotels in Istanbul. It was comfortable and pleasant enough and we did our own thing. So all the points people were raving about on trip advisor felt a little overly enthusiastic. However, on our last day the service of this hotel really shone. The morning we were flying out there was a bike race in Istanbul. The streets were partitioned off. Cars couldn't get to the hotel. The police were guarding the barricade and not letting people pass to the other side. Many people with luggage gathered and wondered if they'd ever get across. The co-managers/owners of this hotel saw to it that we made it to our cab. One walked us to one side of the barricade, and the other met us on the other, and drove us to the airport. I wondered why the owner was driving the shuttle. He said, with the event, he didn't want taxi drivers to take advantage of his customers claiming undue traffic and charging more for the service etc. or to have people missing planes. I was so impressed with the conscientiousness of their service. They left nothing to chance and took personal responsibility that we'd make it to the airport. Stay at the Tashkonak. If you ever get yourself into real difficulty, I"m sure they'll do their very best to help you. Also, they'll be doing some renovating this year.. bigger rooms and a sauna etc. ... a fine hotel is about to get finer. Happy trails.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a short break”
Reviews.Author: lizzieWorcs
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to fault with this hotel; the staff were very friendly and helpful, everywhere was spotlessly clean, and the Turkish breakfast was good. Our room was very small which might have become an issue had we been there longer than four days, but with the garden and the terrace upstairs to relax in it was fine. There were a couple of things in our room which needed fixing and they were fixed by the time we returned, and the receptionist checked that things were ok as we went out later. The location is excellent, within a few minutes walk of the Hippodrome.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: runsfearlesss
Reviews.Content: Simply the best hotel in Istanbul in which we could have stayed. The staff was very friendly [in fact after a ten day visit, I consider Ali a friend], the rooms were very clean, the service perfect, and gave us very good advice. We felt like welcome guests in their home. The breakfasts overlooking the Bosphorous and Sea of Marmara from the enclosed or outdoor cafe were a perfect way to start the day. The breakfasts were delicious. Just sitting at breakfast and watching the world go by would have been a vacation alone. We would stay at the Tashkonak again in a heartbeat. Hello to Inan, Ali, Annilee, and all the staff! Hello to all of our friends

Reviews.Title: “Best Service EVER”
Reviews.Author: aemagee_123
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great quiet location near Blue Mosque and Haga Sophia. Excellent breakfast buffet. Friendly and the best service ever. Trip would not have been as good if not for the staff!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel goes the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: Number28
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we felt at ease and the staff at the hotel helped make us feel very welcome. Istanbul is an exciting place and we had a very enjoyable weeend. The staff were freiendly and gave us a lot of information about the sites and culture that helped us get around the city easily. The rooms are decorated in a traditional turkish style, are kept spotlessly clean and are good value for money. The breakfast buffet offers a good range of food to suit everyone, accompanied by great views! I would certainly recommend the Tashkonak to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mab54
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tashkonak in March 2009 for four days. My single room had two beds, to my eye a mix of folk decor (charming painted ceiling, carved wood bed headboards) and 19th century-ish city decor (light fixtures, drapes), and was spotlessly cleaned every day. Charming sitting area. WIFI was free and worked great. Good breakfast (many choices) on roof deck with fabulous view of the Marmara Sea and rooftops. Excellent location behind the Blue Mosque. And a really friendly and competent staff who helped me with everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: TasLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in February. The location of this hotel is perfect, a stroll away from the main sites of Istanbul and very close to public transport links. This hotel offers a shuttle bus service to and from the airport with excellent rates. We enquired of other means of transfer but this was a lot cheaper and more convenient. The main factor that makes your stay at this hotel so worth while is the excellent service the staff provides. They are very helpful and friendly and recommend places to visit, restaurants to eat in and places to shop. The rooms have character and are very clean. The breakfast is plentiful and there are great views of the Bosphorous from the room/terrace it is served in. This hotel is excellent value for money and would highly recommend it. Thanks to all the staff that made our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, friendly staff, did the job”
Reviews.Author: UKholidayaddict
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel well situated for the main tourist attractions. The hotel staff were very friendly and sit down with all guests when the first go to leave the hotel to show the location on a map (which they'll sell to you) and recommend local attractions, restaurants etc. Not an issue for us and all things we expected and which to some extent add to the experience, but for info don't expect an English or American breakfast (tthe Turkish breakfast is v nice), a big room with lots of facilities (its a coverted house in an old part of an old city though we did have an en-suite shower, TV with a couple of English channels and a fridge) or quiet (its opposite a mosque so take ear-plugs unless you want a very early wake up call but that would apply to any hotel in this great city). Breakfast is served on a roof terrace (inside in winter) which means you can enjoy breakfast with a view of the bosphorous but (unless there's a lift that I didn't notice) this hotel may not be a good choice for those with walking difficulties. Particularly handy when you first arrive is that the hotel is located a minute's walk from a number of restaurants which are cheaper than those the other side of the Blue Mosque. My husband I tend not to revisit places but if we did I'd happily go back to this hotel and we're certainly keen to see more of Turkey

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel, amazing views and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: marc006
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at Tashkonak. We had a fab time the hotel and staff were great. The room was clean and given the once over everyday. The views from the roof top breakfast terrace were amazing and the breakfast itself had a good range. The location of Tashkonak just behind the Blue Mosque was perfect right in the middle of some amazing sights and close to transport links. A big thank you to the hotel team who looked after us and were all incredibly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: Macboyer
Reviews.Content: Service and friendliness from the staff was what made our stay so good. This bitique hotel is in the middle of the old part of the city, near the blue mosque, the grand plaza, the cystern etc etc, so we could walk to thes spots and once again I must compliment the staff on the way that they were so willing to help in finding places. The food was hearty and plentiful for our breakfast, the rooms were clean and well appointed and we had access to free internet use. I experienced a cold whilst I was there and I was brought up hot lemon juice and honey several times and was pleasantly surprised that they did not add anything to our bill. I would reccomend this Hotel and will go there when we do a return trip to Turkey. david.macqueen@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “A real surprise....”
Reviews.Author: ssw57
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful few days over the Valentines weekend at the hotel. The staff at the hotel were so friendly and helpful. Th rooms were fine-warm and clean and everything in the mini bar was free as were all the tea and coffee that we ordered to the room. Pick up and return to the airport were well organised as were the trips and pick up from local restaurants. So nice to get great service from a hotel without paying loads of money! Very centally located for sight seeing as well. Would stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Something special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Istabul with my husband and two grown-up children in their early twenties. We were due to stay a few days and we ended up extending our stay to two weeks, and loving it. Tashkonak Hotel was fantastic! Fantastic location, helpful and caring staff, perfectly clean rooms, warm (in the middle of winter) and comfortable. It is a very beautiful 'boutique' hotel that suited our every need. Close to all the tourist attractions in the old part of the city and plenty of good eating places very close by. Great shopping in the nearby Arasta Bazaar! We highly recommend this beautiful and comfortable hotel to singles and families! Laura

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, relaxed and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: chalkmuppet
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights and was delighted with hotel, with service and the friendliness of the staff. Great breakfasts, good views, nice room, our own outside patio and a feeling of individuality. Very enjoyable, excellent value for money. will return!

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: shorechris
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in Istanbul during November 2008 and have to say that my stay at Tashkonak was enjoyable and memorable. The staff was fantastatic, the area is beautiful and the hotel both charming and quaint. Below is a list of the pros and cons of Tashkonak; PROS 1) Friendly, accommodating and well informed staff 2) Hotel is boutique like - very quiet and relaxing - very nice common sitting area with free internet access 3)Rooms are very clean and well appointed 4)Delicious breakfast buffet in terrace overlooking the sea and Sultanahmet 5) Great location as hotel located in Sultanahmet near the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar 6)Easy access by streetcar to other areas of Istanbul including ferry service across the Bosphorus CONS: I am hard pressed to find fault with this establishment as my experience was very positive. If I had to make a criticism , I would say the rooms are a little small, especially with luggage. However the solution is simple, they can store your excess luggage in a secure lock up. This to me wasn't a big deal considering the hotel is a product of several older restored homes. This is what makes the hotel charming. All in all Tashkonak is an excellent option from a quality and price standpoint

Reviews.Title: “All our expectations were fulfilled!”
Reviews.Author: tashkonak09
Reviews.Content: Dear Tashkonak's personnel, thank you a lot for your hospitality! You do your best! Frankly speaking, we were afraid everything won't be as good as it's written in responses in the Internet, but... everything was good really! First of all, we were met by the Tashkonak representative in the airport, despite our flight was delayed for 1,5 hours. During the transfer, the driver... gave us some juice - how did he find out that we were thirsty? :)) - and small and nice cakes :)) It was unexpected and so sweet! Thank you! We negotiated a price through the e-mail and paid exactly that price. Our room wasn't large, but cosy and with quality wooden furniture. There was a balcony with a big wooden bench and calm court yard outside. The personnel of Tashkonak is not persuasive, it looks like they had a training somewhere in the Great Britain and they received good marks:) They're helpful, tactful and just nice! Btw, Tashkonak is situated at the quiet street in 3-4 minutes walk from Blue Mosque and in 5-7 minutes from Sultanahmet tramway station. Thanks to good location, we were travelling a lot and didn't waste time. Yes, when it's called to the pray in the morning (Blue Mosque, we repeat, is veeery close!:)), you may wake up, but if the previous day was full of expressions and emotions, you'll wake up, say "wow" and fall to the pillow again :)) To have a taste breakfast admiring the view from the big window of Tashkonak buffet - tiled roofs, seagulls, sky, clouds, and Marmara sea, and ships and small boats - we wish we could see all this again...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect time”
Reviews.Author: mymra
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, great staff, lovely view from the terrace, comfortable room. you won't need an alarm clock because every morning imam is screaming :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Comfy, Great Location and Wonderful People”
Reviews.Author: hilarybking
Reviews.Content: The Tashkonak was fantastic! The rooms are spotless, beautiful, and spacious. The staff is exceedingly nice and helpful. And breakfast is about the best buffet you could ask for! There is so much yummy food you almost don't have to eat for the rest of the day! Also, they sent us to Hazir Mustafa or something like that, near the Spice Market, and it was the best turkish delight and baklava I ever tasted... Can't recommend the Tashkonak highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “friendly, cheap and well sited”
Reviews.Author: mymster
Reviews.Content: Review based on a 4 night stay in January 2009. The Tashkonak is one of the many small hotels situated on the seaward side of the hill crowned by the Sultanahmet (Blue) Mosque - and thus on the former site of the imperial Great Palace and its gardens. Nowadays it is a densely built area of small hotels, mosques and working class turkish housing. It is a pleasant 5-10 minute walk to the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque, 10-15 minutes to Haghia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace. Don't miss the former Church of SS Sergius and Bacchus (now the Little Aya Sofya Mosque) 5 minutes down the hill in the other direction. The front of the hotel faces onto a small side street, across from a small Sinan-designed mosque (it's hard to find a mosque in Istanbul that is not connected to Sinan in some way) which, alas, looks like a concrete village hall from the outside. Muezzins start the prayer call at 6.30, but it wasn't so loud that it woke me. The hotel itself is a bit shabby in places but entirely tolerable for the excellent prices. We stayed in Room 104 which is a 4 person suite on the ground floor (double bed in one room, two singles in another, and a bathroom in between). The beds were firm and comfortable, windows were plentiful (and openable). A special mention for the showers, which are spacious, hot and powerful. The staff are uniformly friendly (very good-looking porters!) and were always willing to go out of their way to help out with queries or requests. The included breakfast is good and simple and is served on the top floor (there is a room with large windows and a terrace - the views over the Sea of Marmara to Asia in one direction and up to the Blue Mosque in the other are very photogenic). At check out time there is a discount for payment in cash. I've no hesitation in recommending the Tashkonak for anyone wanting cheap friendly accommodation in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: john_1974uk
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with friendly staff. The breakfast is fantastic. Having spent some time at a 5 star hotel in Taksim, the year before, I found this little boutique hotel in the quite area of Sultanahmet to be much better than expensive hotels in Taksim. Everything is better (staff are friendly, food is better, the neighbourhood is friendly too!)... just loved it. Will definetly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, excellent people quality, I'll definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Armashu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Task Konak for 5 nights during december (29.12.08-3.01.09) with 5 friends . Everything was perfect, from the room cleanliness to the personnel courtesy and the exceptional breakfast you can take on the 3rd floor terrace with sea view. The only possible thing I would improve in this hotel is the room soundproofing - because when we were having a quite friendly chat in one of the 3 rooms - we really annoyed some other very sensitive guests to the point that they came knocking at our door. Otherwise, I repeat, we thank the owners and the hotel personnel for the lovely time we spent at their location!

Reviews.Title: “The best choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: maitovich
Reviews.Content: I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on our holiday and I am extremely happy fpr starting and ending the trip there! Perhaps not the most luxury if you're looking for best comodities, but if you want to mix a little luxury with a friendly and familiar atmosphere, very nice view and stay close to Agia Sophia, then this is an absolute must!!! Thanks Inan!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hartest
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights (22nd to 26th December 2008). A great hotel tucked away in the back streets of the Sultanhamet area of Istanbul. Really friendly staff. Great views of The Bosphorus and Blue Mosque from the rooftop terrace. The only problem was the room allocated to us, room 106 (on the ground floor). This room overlooks the busy street to the front of the hotel. Lots of road noise due to the traffic running over the cobbled street and builders in the nextdoor property doing renovations (hammering and banging and a cement mixer running until quite late at night). No sleep on this first night, which after a full day travelling wasn't what we wanted. We told the staff about this on the Tuesday morning and they moved us to room 302, which is on the third floor at the back of the hotel overlooking the garden area. A much better room, though quite small. Very little storage / cupboard space for clothes, so ended up living out of our suitcases. Apart from the problem with the room on the first night, we really enjoyed our stay and would certainly go back there again. Another plus point is that if you settle your bill / account with cash then a good discount can be had.

Reviews.Title: “This ones for ALI from Victor Au-Yeung from week of 12/14-12/19”
Reviews.Author: limitchank
Reviews.Content: Tash Konak staff was very friendly and the rooms were a good rate..........great panoramic view on the terrace overlooking Bosphorus river..........the staff was very nice especially Ali and another European lady..........Thanks! Victor

Reviews.Title: “Tashkonak Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mufeed
Reviews.Content: I have booked in the Tashkonak Hotel based on the good reviews Iâ€™ve read on the booking.com .I really enjoyed my staying there . the staff is very friendly , services is very good, the rooms were immaculately clean and very comfortable, beautiful view of the sea from the breakfast buffet restaurant. Hotel located on a quiet street in the old town and not far from tourist sites. minutes from the Blue Mosque in Sultanahmet . It is also a 10 minute walk to the Haghia Sophia and about 15 minutes to the Topkapi palace. Thus, my strong recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff !”
Reviews.Author: Ahmoda
Reviews.Content: I have booked in the Tashkonak Hotel based on the good reviews Iâ€™ve read on the Trip Advisor. And I have to say I was about to make a big mistake, because a hotel with such disrespectful staff doesnâ€™t deserve a penny of my money!! My original booking was for one double room for 4 nights from 19 till 21 Nov, but I had to change it 3 weeks before the arrival time because the airline cancelled our fight. I changed the booking to make it 5 nights from 21 till 26 Nov. Then a few days before the arrival time, I contacted their Reservation Manager, through Messenger (which was one of the means to communicate with the hotel mentioned in their website) to see how much will be the total cost of the room and the transfer if I reduce my stay to 2 nights, because I was considering going to Borsa for the rest of my trip. I was just asking, but to my great surprise, his reply was: â€œ this is not a toy.. your booking is cancelledâ€�!!! and he ended the conversation!! I was so shocked that I didnâ€™t really believe it !.. so I sent them an email (with the conversation attached) and asked for an explanation or at least an official cancellation. I waited for a whole working day but they didnâ€™t even care to reply. At the end I had to call to make them send me an official cancellation. and finally they did send it.. without an apology or an explanation!! I have never ever in my whole life seen such an offensive response from someone supposedly working in the service sector!! Someone who wrote down in his emailsâ€� If you have any questions or special requests, please do not hesitate to contact usâ€�â€¦ what a lie !!! We stayed in another hotel in Sultanahmet that is by far much better than Tashkonak and we paid the same amount of money. Donâ€™t book at Tashkonak Hotel, there are so many other hotels in Sultanahmet area that at least wonâ€™t insult you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot in the Centre”
Reviews.Author: marc77Pardubice
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the very centre of the city just a few minutes walk from the most important monuments, however, the location is very calm. Extraordinarily friendly and helpful staff, I have never encountered before. Beautiful view of the sea from the breakfast buffet restaurant. Wi-Fi on the ground floor at the reception. Thus, my strong recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ABatra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tashkonak for 8 days. Tashkonak is a 30-odd-room hotel located on a quiet street minutes from the Blue Mosque in Sultanahmet ('old' Istanbul). It is also a 10 minute walk to the Haghia Sophia and about 15 minutes to the Topkapi palace. Yerevada Cistern is also about 10 minutes away by foot, as is one of Istanbul's best sea food restaurants (Baltiki Sabhattin). In other words a number of Istabul's main attractions are all reachable on foot. However what we most liked about the hotel was the excellent and helpful staff (our friend Hayati in particular deserves special mention) who went out of their way to help us and guide us, make restaurant bookings, etc. and always had time for any other enquiries we had. Rooms are basic, but clean. Some face the street (which is fairly quiet except for the odd car/bike) and others a quaint garden/porch at the back of the hotel. Another highlight is the lovely terrace for breakfast, with wonderful views of the Sea of Marmara and the Golden Horn. I would recommend those who are not on a tight budget to opt for a large double room as some of the standard rooms looked a little bit cramped (although some others looked a decent size). All in all an excellent hotel from a logistical point of view with an excellent staff making the experience quite memorable. Ambika & Ashwin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiz54
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul for my wife's 50th as a total party of six family and friends. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful, from arranging a complimentary cake and a basket of fruit as a complete surprise. Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were immaculately clean and very comfortable. Since we had to share our transfer from the airport with two other people in a minibus, the hotel offered a 30% discount on the transfer without being asked. All of us will definitely return to this amazing city and a centrally located wonderful boutique hotel who truly understand hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Tashkonak has the knack”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul4u
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just behind the Blue Mosque, in the quieter part of the Istanbul tourist precinct. I have been to Istanbul twice in the last couple of years, staying in various hotels, most being fine, but this is the one I will return to. This trip I travelled solo, and I highly recommend the Tashkonak for a solo female traveller of any age. Not only does it have what you need - clean pleasant rooms, stunning terrace views of the Bosphorus, a quiet garden (it's a converted Ottoman house), internet (a bit unreliable but available), scrumptious Turkish breakfast, Istanbul on your doorstep; but it has two big advantages. First, the staff are professional, but in the most engaging and warm way. So that, for example, I could have a joke with them, talk about my day, ask for their help (in fact, they got me out of trouble a couple of times). This is a real bonus for a sociable solo traveller. Second, and related to this, is the excellent service and support offered by Annelie, an English woman who works at the hotel, having moved to Istanbul two years ago after staying at the Tashkonak for a number of years on holiday. Annelie makes sure that guests get that bit extra, advising, discussing, sorting out any issues that might arise, without language barriers intruding. The staff speak various languages but I found that talking to Annelie really made a difference to my stay in Istanbul. Top hotel, good value, really worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Tashkonak - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Moyses
Reviews.Content: I have been with my wife to this hotel at the end of September. You must be close to the historical area to visit easily most of the mosques and museums.My opinion is similar to most of Tripadvisor reviewers. Good location, friendly staff, excellent breakfast with a beautifull view. My only complain is that the place to take shower is very small. I have discovered the best restaurant in Istambul in my last night: ALBURA. It is close to the hotel, excellent food, turkish and international, with reasonable prices. Do not miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Citybreaker08
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 4 night trip to Istanbul with a group of 10 friends staying at the Tashkonak and had an excellent stay. It is in an ideal central location within walking distance of several historical sites (Topkapi Palace, St Sophia, Blue Mosque etc), many good restaurants (Sultanahmet Fish House on our first night was excellent, very reasonably priced and with a free shuttle service if needed, which it was as it was pouring with rain!) and bazaars. The staff were very helpful and friendly and gave us all the local information we needed, always with a smile. Breakfast on the terrace, overlooking the Blue Mosque in one direction and the sea in the other, was a great way to start the day, especially the tasty omelette, selection of breads and pastries and delicious local yoghurt drizzled with honey. Would definitely recommend this hotel which was great value for money. They also arranged airport transport for us at very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Btowntraveller
Reviews.Content: Great little find in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul. Comfortable rooms, great atmosphere. Staff was great. Convenient to Blue Mosque and Haghia Sofia. Real charm, like coming home to your own house each night.

Reviews.Title: “Warm,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: debbie54
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful trip to Turkey,and stayed at the Tashkonak for the first 2 days,and then again at the end of my trip. It was such a nice feeling to come back to a hotel(and City) that felt familiar and comfortable. The Staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful,the breakfast was lovely with the most delicious yogurt and honey and fresh baked bread/cake made with apricots,as well as a nice spread with eggs, olives,salad,etc. It was great to have a computer to use provided in the lobby at no charge. The location was perfect and safe. My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and would return to the Tashkonak on our next trip to Istanbul. We felt welcomed and cared for. The staff was great...the rooms clean..the beds firm..it was cozy and reasonably priced. You'll enjoy the hospitality and warmth of the Taskonak. We did..

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jaz79
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from our 10 day stay at the Tashkonak Hotel I can certainly say what a superb hotel in a superb location. You can eat breakfast overlooking the Blue Mosque with breathtaking views of the Marmara Sea. The rooms are very well decorated & the staff are attentative and friendly. Receptionists are also very welcoming (Inan). Breakfast buffet is plentiful offering traditional Turkish food. I will certainly be using this hotel again next year. Overall : a great Traditional style Turkish hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoushV
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel in Istanbul that was inexpensive, somewhere clean and comfortable and somewhere that had a little charm. This hotel fulfilled all our criteria. The location is excellent. Lovely old neighbourhood barely a few minutes walk from the blue mosque and the rest of Sultanahmet. The view from the terrace is wonderful with the Sea of Marmara on one side and the blue mosque on the other side - which made breakfast a very pleasant affair. Plenty to choose from at breakfast - eggs/fruit/juice/bread etc. We had two rooms between two couples. They were both very comfortable. However our friends had a smaller room but a balcony overlooking the garden, whereas we had no balcony but a larger room. So if you have a preference you can probably request what you would like. Our larger room was perfectly comfortable - considering we were there 5 nights we were very comfortable. Our room overlooked the street and was right next to a mosque but despite that we had no disturbances. We didnt really hear the early morning call to prayer (even though it was Ramazan!) and the street was very quiet so no noise. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and comfortable. The shower is very powerful so lovely to step into at the end of the day. The garden is also lovely. Great place to sit in the afternoon and have coffee. They have nice Lavazza coffee available - which they supposedly charge 2 euros for but we had it every day so they just did a set 5 euro charge for 'extras'. Which is typical of the good nature of the place. They do not try to charge extra for every little thing. The price of bottled water is reasonable, they have free maps and postcards at reception, free internet and wireless. They even let us print something for free. Which is great as you dont feel like you're being ripped off all the time. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. They would go out of their way to try and help if you had a problem. I think some customers expected too much to some degree - after all this is a small boutique hotel and if you treat it as such and take the time to chat to the staff you soon realise how friendly and helpful they are and give you advice on getting around. It's also a big plus to have the airport pickup if you are staying more than three nights. They were there on time. Very efficient. All in all we had a very comfortable, very pleasant stay made all the better by helpful, friendly staff and a great location. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Istanbul (which I hope we do!). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “It was all sympathy”
Reviews.Author: mcnunes
