Reviews.Content: I and my wife were in Istanbul between 21 and August 24. We chose our hotel (Hotel Tashkonak), after seeing the reviews at Trip Advisor. We made the reservation directly on the site of the hotel. The hotel management was completely honest with us. We get what we pay. Our plane is delayed but the staff of the hotel was waiting for us at the airport. The room was reasonable and clean. The breakfast was simple but agreable. I say the breakfast was normal. Everything was ok, except one thing that was not necessary happen. When we arrived in our room had a dish with fruit. It was a gesture pleasant. But the dish was broken, which is not acceptable. In any case I advise the Hotel tashkonak to all who want a cheap hotel and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Charming !”
Reviews.Author: hflr2006
Reviews.Content: We landed in Tashkonak last august 2008 when the nearby mosque was calling for the evening prayer. The atmosphere was exciting and the staff so friendly that immediately we fall in love with the hotel. Rooms are clean, breakfast is acceptable and the area is reasonably quiet. Staying in Tashkonak means living in tthe middle of the historic Istanbul. A real good value for money! But the main asset is their staff. We are looking forward to meet them again!

Reviews.Title: “great istanbul home”
Reviews.Author: labmeister
Reviews.Content: we researched a lot of tripadvisor hotels when we were planning our vacation for 50ish parents and 18 and 21 year old young adults and it seemed like tashkonak was ideal for us- a reasonable rate for a safe and intimate place, and not a generic american 'tourist hotel' where you are insulated from where you are. a delightful place with character and characters in the the middle of an amazing part of town. most of the guests are european; we may have been the only americans there during our stay. we had reserved a 'family room', but were offered two rooms for no additional charge when we arrived, which worked out fine. the rooms are not as large as typical american generic chains, but have operable windows and shutters [beautiful patterns on the curtains at sunrise], modern baths [although the shower base does get a lot of water pooling], air conditioning [a must in istanbul summers], and the hotel as many note has a superb rooftop brunch and deck spaces overlooking the sea of marmara, which we also used to sip some efos [the local beer] at nite. the brunch all five days was appreciated, well supplied with olives, feta, a scrambled egg with peppers dish, orange and pear juices and tea among other treats. plenty to last well into the afternoon on walks. the locale is awesome, just minutes walking from all the major sites in sultanahmet, but away from the street cafe/tourist bus noise. the neighborhood has a mosque across the street, but we did not notice the prayers after the first nite, and even then thought them part of the atmosphere. many of the buildings in the area are being renovated, which adds to the ambiance along with a few remnants of ancient walls and cobble streets. staff was wonderful the five days, offering great advise for dining and treks. we interacted with about 5 or 6 staff and all were pleasant, communicated well in english, and made us feel at home. we did the reservation through expedia, but next time I would do it through the hotel- they offer a free airport pick-up if you do and stay three days. we will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A lifetime Experience”
Reviews.Author: topaz23
Reviews.Content: 9th August 2008 Singapore Ref:- TasKonak Hotel (Sultanamet - Istanbul - Turkey) My overseas trip to Istanbul (10/7/2008 - 20/07/2008) with my best friend was a last minute suggestion (only 2 days to prepare for my holiday). from a list of hotels someone gave me i chose Taskonak and on the eve of my departure date i called them. they got me a room. i was fortunate to have nice people around everywhere. Tuck away from the city bustle, Taskonak Hotel is conveniently located at most of the tourists attractions viz:- the Blue Mosque, AyaSofya, Hippodrome, Grand Bazaar, the Sultanamet train station, etc...it is a one-stop venue for all your travelling needs - from gorgeous food and creative travel agents that offer travelling packages with attractive prices and a shopping haven We had daily buffet breakfast that filled our apettite till lunch, at the top floor - where we enjoyed a panoramic balcony view of the Marmara Sea and interesting landscape around The staff are energised and always doing a great job. all they wana do is help handle our needs and they did well. we had the oppurtunity of having the owner of the hotel to send us to the airport for our return journey.THANK U Mr Matin for an experience of a lifetime we had while in Istanbul and Capadocia. it's great. i leave my dear readers, feeling an optimism that such a rich cultural life and caring community still survive in these times . Chin-up..cheer-up there are heaps of program in store for you at Taskonak. just ask the staff. they are ever ready to help you explore Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Such nice people”
Reviews.Author: Lil73
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 3 nights at the Tashkonak, we loved it. It's not luxury or super-stylish, but it doesn't claim to be. It's just a really charming, pretty hotel with the friendliest staff you can hope to meet. Good location, close to all the sites, and was so relaxing lounging on the roof terrace with the sea views on one side and the blue mosque on the other. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Longing for Tashkonak”
Reviews.Author: Mde2trvl
Reviews.Content: Down home comfort in the Sultanhamet district with one of the most friendly staff you'll find while traveling. Hotel boosts nice and clean rooms some with great views. Our room, #306, on the top floor, is a great family room with two separate rooms. Rooms are air-conditioned and hotel offers free internet with a house computer and wi-fi connection. The biggest plus is that the Hotel Tashkonak staff is wonderful and available 24/7. They even feature an English Concierge who is available mornings to help travelers plan their day. I should add that all desk staff speak English as well as other languages. The breakfast room on the top floor is run by a true Turkish mama (Though she doesn't speak English, she is warm and effusive). Mama serves great Turkish Breakfast foods like eggs, watermelon, borkes, eggs, olives, feta, halavah, etc... We found that we also enjoyed the other guests and sometimes exchanged tips and trips for the day. And, finally, the Hotel Tashkonak is in walking distance to all major sites in the old district.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, an excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: Heffron
Reviews.Content: I do a fair amount of traveling for both work and pleasure, and my trip to Istanbul earlier this month was both. I didn't want to pay a great deal of money and wanted also to be close to the sites in Sultanahmet and the Golden Horn. The Tashkonak greatly exceeded my expectations. The rooms included cable tv, air conditioning and ample space for storing clothes. The decor, while somewhat older, was very pleasant and immaculately clean. I personally found the exterior of the building--done in the darkened wood that characterizes old Istanbul--quite attractive. Yes, the wireless internet was spotty on the second floor, but one could either bring a laptop down to the lobby or use the terminal provided there free of charge. The breakfasts were taken on the roof, with a large variety of food choices, and with excellent views of the Marmara Sea, the Bosporus and the Asian side of Istanbul. The important monuments--Byzantine and Ottoman--were no more than 5 to 10 minutes walk and some lesser known sites (I suggest the KÃ¼Ã§Ã¼k Ayasofia Camii) are also close. Many shops and restaurants were also conveniently close and a little less frenetic than Sultanahmet Square. I did not need to ask for directions or tours, but the staff was on hand to help with those services if needed. Finally, I have to personally thank the staff for going above and beyond when I found that my flight reservations back to Sydney had been inexplicably cancelled by Singapore Airlines. They helped me to get ahold of the airlines and sort things out, faxed a document to the airlines (at no charge) and made sure that I got a taxi quick to the airport. In sum, I was extremely pleased with both the people and the facilities. I am planning to return in the next year, and it will be to the Tashkonak.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Tashkonak”
Reviews.Author: LondonMusman
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay of 6 nights, the room was comfortable with a/c and a great shower. Breakfasts were good and held on the roof garden with stuning views over the marmara. It is in a quiet street and very close to the center of sultanahmet. The staff were great, extremely warm and friendly and helped us with everything!

Reviews.Title: “an absolute "Turkish Delight"”
Reviews.Author: sandra0112
Reviews.Content: Location was great!!!! Accommodations were great!!!!! Buffet breakfast on the roof top was sensational!!!! I might add, Savash and Coskun were extremely helpful in preparing our itinerary for "side t rips" to Cappadocia, Pamukkele, and Ephesus. Many thanks, Sandra

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Yokoka
Reviews.Content: We are Japanese travelers. We traveled long way from Japan to Turkey and found a place like our home in Istanbul. Although my husband and I arrived at Ataturk Airport in the midnight, we had no trouble to get to Tash konak hotel thanks to Airport pick-up service. Friendly hotel staffs welcomed us when we arrived there around 3 o'clock A.M. The room was simple, clean and quiet. So, We could sleep well for a few hours before breakfast. After we got up, we had breakfast at the restaurant on the top floor. It was so nice to have breakfast looking at shining Marmara sea. At first, we planned to stay at Tash Konak Hotel for only one night. But we liked the hotel so much that we stayed there for 3 nights in total. We also liked the friendly hotel staffs. Thanks to Mr. Savas's help, we could reach the stadium! We would like to express our gratitude for their assistance.

Reviews.Title: “exellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: keitaro721
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days in this hotel it is so nice. The clean room, the very kind staff and good breakfast, it was exellent. The pick-up service was also good. Everythig good!!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: hajijohn
Reviews.Content: How lucky can one get with the first of our hotels booked in Turkey where Tashkonak became our benchmark for everything else in comparison. We stayed for 2 nights in late May and returned for another 2 nights in early June at the end of our holiday. It is in a superb location behind the Blue Mosque. The staff, Inan, Erdam, Hayati and the "volunteer" Annaliese.. you were just so fantastic and helpful. We had the best breakfast in Turkey, truly. What wonderful views from the rooftop terrace. Our only reservation was that our triple room fronted the street and it was a bit noisy. So I would recommend others go for the garden facing rooms. But overall, the facilities were really comfortable and good. We will be recommending ALL our friends to stay here, and so would we, hopefully again. Hajijohn

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Pipilipupi
Reviews.Content: We spent a very enjoyable weekend at the Tashkonak hotel in May. We were given a spacious (and spotless) four-bed room for the two of us. We couldn't say it was really quiet (minaret close by) but it seemed quiet for the neighbourhood. The staff were friendly and helpful, the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia within easy walking distance, and the sunny breakfast terrace was a great bonus. The only downside we can think of is that there is no lift, which was OK for us but could be a problem for the less mobile. We would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: paullouzado
Reviews.Content: Being close to blue mosgue, the tram station, shopping area , all within walking distances we saved a lot on transport. The hotel was very comfortable though the rooms are a little cramped. The staff very very helpful they not only gave us valuable suggestions but helped us chart our daily visits in Istanbul.We loved the breakfast on the roof with a fantastic view.,But what we enjoyed most was our evening in the courtyard where we could sit and enjoy our booze & snacks without paying corkage.The hotel provided us the glasses and ice at no cost..We were 4of us so the stay was memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rfbc
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated in the old town of Istanbul, this charming little hotel has nothing to envy to much bigger (and more expensive) ones. The rooms are well furnished, spacious, clean, with all facilites. The service is excellent and the staff are very friendly and helpful without impeding in any way. The prices are most reasonable and I would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to spend some time in Istanbul. The view on the sea of Marmara from the terrace is spectacular and, although I did not take part in any trips myself, I understand that those organised throught he hotel are of the best quality. What I preferred was that the hotel was within walking distance of the historical old town. I look forward to returning to the Tashkonak on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: emani13
Reviews.Content: A great boutique hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet. The rooms were small but quaint and very clean, and some of them had balconies with a beautiful view of a small private garden. Breakfast was served on a rooftop terrace with a gorgeous view of the sea of Marmara. There is no elevator in the hotel so for people who could not climb the 3 flights of stairs to the terrace, breakfast could be served in the garden patio. The staff was very helpful and friendly and gave us very detailed directions to various places that we wanted to go to that were not on the scheduled tours. Also told us how to get there by tram which was very inexpensive. Thank you Hayiti! You were exceptionally hospitable. The hotel is a 15 minute walk to all the major attractions in Sultanahmet like the Blue Mosque, Aiya Sophia, Basilica cistern and Topakapi palace. A 10 minute walk will get you to the tram station from which the Dolmabahce palace, Galata tower, spice bazaar and the Grand bazaar are very easily accessible. Lots of nice restaurants within walking distance as well. We were very pleased and would highly recommend the Tashkonak

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Libertyscott
Reviews.Content: Grossly overpriced for what it is, I read reviews here and was looking forward to it, sadly others must have had different rooms or just have different standards when they travel. The best I can say is that it is well located, the staff are friendly (but then Istanbul generally is) and the breakfast room at the top has great views, unfortunately once you've gazed at the Marmara and look at the food, you really ought to find somewhere else to eat, but more on that below. The room was small, but to be fair comfortable and adequate, although the one power socket was not beside the beds. Nylon curtains hadn't been cleaned for ages. 1# Air conditioning. There was no remote for the airconditioning unit in the room, so I went to reception to ask for it. After 5 or so minutes one was delivered to the room. All well and good till the next day when, having returned from touring around - the remote control disappeared again, so once again "can I please have it". Note that the aircon was turned off and the windows closed (naturally) the whole time we were out, so the room was rather hot on days where the temperature outside was in the 25-30C range. Aircon did have a odd smell, but at least it worked when I could control it. Clearly less air con remotes than units! 2# Power cuts. At first thought this was Istanbul, but poking head out of the window saw lights on in adjacent buildings. One day it happened three times, and we were told that "one of the power lines to the hotel didn't work well" (presumably part of the hotel was fine). We were given a candle, but these power cuts go for anything like 20 minutes to 3 hours. Given it appears to be a hotel problem, it's rather poor. Resorted to using cellphone screen as a light for ventures to the bathroom! 3# Shower. The drain was clearly rather clogged as after 5 minutes you realise it isn't draining at all, and it's about to overflow. So you time the showers. We didn't raise this if only because the power cuts and the air conditioning were raised enough that we figured we had bought an overpriced lemon. There was no written material about the hotel, including nothing about fire escape procedures. The TV had a lot of channels, most of which had appalling interference, so while 3 channels are in English, one was watchable. Breakfast was abysmal. 2 non-descript cereals with one variety of milk sitting out in a jug, 2 varieties of cordial (these are at best "juice drinks", they wouldn't pass for pure juices) that were barely cold as the machines storing them were kept off much of the time (but the LCD TV with music videos is kept on). Remaining food comprised bread (ok), olives, a couple of jams and honey, cold meat and cheese, all lying outside exposed (the breakfast floor is very open to the air), for the flies to land on (as I witnessed). Nothing hot (besides tea and coffee), no fruit. Oh there was a single hard boiled egg, cracked already. Had to ask for more. Given the price for continental breakfast was around Â£22 per night for two people this was an extortionate rip off. For that price I expect cereals, fresh fruit, range of juices, service (as in someone bringing me coffee and tea, not self service), some varieties of hot food, and cold food covered for hygiene. The hotel was not uncomfortable, not dirty, but it wasn't great and for Â£145 per night for two people it is priced as a reasonable hotel but with standards of a good backpackers. 3 simple tips for the owners, offer breakfast commensurate for the price, get air conditioning controls for every room and fix the power. Meanwhile, people should either pay the price for a good backpacker hostel or avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth74
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a quiet street close to all the major tourist atractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only minus was that all the good restaurants and all nightlife was in an other part of town. Rooftop terrece had beautiful views.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service; splendid view!”
Reviews.Author: TilburgTeacher62
Reviews.Content: First of all, we greatly appreciated the (complimentary) pick-up service from the airport. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful in advising about where to go and how to get there. The room was not overly spacious, but offered all the conveniences that may be expected from a hotel in this price range, like minibar and airconditioning. The hotel's main attraction is the breakfast room on the rooftop terrace, offering a breathtaking view of the Bosphorus and Sea of Marmara and even the Blue Mosque by night. The breakfast buffet is excellent, with a wide choice of foods to please every palate. Another great perk is the location; only a few minutes' walk from the city's main attractions like the Hippodrome, the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofiya and the Topkapi Palace. The type of guests that the Tash Konak Hotel attracts, ensures a pleasant and quiet atmosphere. This charming little hotel is an oasis of proverbial Turkish hospitality in the heart of one of the world's most vibrant cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: seagullStraengnaes
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 days. Location right in the old city of Istanbul,walkingdistance to all sites one has to visit. (like important historic sites,Bazaar etc )Served excellent breakfast. Hotel has pick up service from airport,also redeliver. Very friendly,family operated. Good English language capabilities,perfect German spoken Was recommended to me by local friends .

Reviews.Title: “Like home in Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: crone_denmark
Reviews.Content: We really felt like home in this old style guesthouse on the edge of Europe. Had a drink at the terrace with the splendid view to the Bosborus and Asia. Dolphins playing between dozens of vessels. Very nice staff - cozy rooms. Lars C

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheekyp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tashkonak in April. The hotel was excellent and really helped make our break, we were in Istanbul for 4 days and the hotel was perfectly located (by the blue mosque) to explore Istanbul by foot. The hotel was friendly and traditional, we were well looked after and had the advantage of having an really excellent roof top terrace where you could see over the river Bosphorus and the blue mosque. Breakfast was served on the top floor of the hotel (with panoramic views) and on the roof top terrace. The breakfast had a good selection of Turkish and European food and was served in a relaxed atmosphere. If you are looking for a good central base to explore Istanbul with a friendly relaxed atmosphere this hotel is for you - and it is great value too.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the old city”
Reviews.Author: MaggieBIreland
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of TripAdvisor reviews and it more than lived up to our expectations, Really helpful staff and rooms on the small side but comfy and quiet. The upside of not having a bar was the peace and quiet at night... our room looked out over the Blue Mosque and the secluded garden, This area can be an awful tourist trap with variable hotels but this is a real oasis.

Reviews.Title: “What a great little place!”
Reviews.Author: Redbaron1917
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveller used to the Hiltons and Hyatts of this world and frankly ... they become boring after a while in spite of their quality rooms and international service standards. Therefore, I keep looking out for local special places whenever I get a chance to break away for a few days. I prefer small, locally operated hotels in mixed areas that include residential and local retail and when I'm travelling with my loved one - they have to be romantic too! Hotel Tashkonak does not only meet all of those criteria perfectly: It is also located in the heart of ancient Istanbul, within the city walls of the former Constantinople, almost in the backyard of the famous Blue Mosque and in walking distance of Topkapi Palace. The sea is in spitting distance and an abundant selection of bars, restaurants and pubs offer great local food as well as international drinks and cooking. The rooms of Hotel Tashkonak are small but very tidy and the friendliness of its staff is simply unbeatable. Breakfast on the rooftop terasse is a perfect start for a day of sightseeing or shopping. The (European) standard size fridge in the middle of the room takes some getting used to but once you've been shopping in one of the bazaars and come back with bags full of fruit and other perishable delights it becomes very valuable. At half the price of any mainstream Hotel in downtown Istanbul, you obviously don't get the typical luxurious amenities now standard with all the "global chains" but you do get a memorable stay in a perfect location and a feeling of true belonging. It's worth it anytime if you're looking for a down-to-earth experience of one of the most fascinating cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Turkelicious!”
Reviews.Author: Coocoopigeon
Reviews.Content: A very nice, cosy hotel. Very near to all the local attractions - excellent location. The Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia were only a 5 minute walk away. We found the staff helpful and receptive. The breakfast was varied and plentiful. The plates were not always as well cleaned as they should have been, but this aside, the morning terrace view was breathtaking. Our room was always very clean and well tidied on a daily basis. The bathroom, though small and sparce, was adequately stocked. Towels were changed every day and sheets were immaculately clean. Free hotel internet access was very welcome and convenient. It might be worth noting that though the hotel provides complimentary toiletries, they are quite minimal and may not be sufficient for a longer stay. We were also happy to find an iron was provided, though admittedly, we seemed to be the only ones using it (and were teased frequently as a result)!! There is a mosque literally a footstep away from the hotel, which might be a problem for those not wishing to be awoken early in the morning by the call to prayer. However, on the whole, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and our trip to Istanbul, and would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to the city. Great value for money. Certainly ideal for girly getaways and small group holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tashkonak”
Reviews.Author: LimeyVirginia
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly and extremely helpful, and make you feel that they enjoy having you there, as much as you enjoy being there. They will arrange things for you on the spur of the moment, if you decide you suddenly want to go somewhere. After their breakfast, you don't need lunch until late afternoon! And the view from the rooftop garden ranks among one of the highlights of Istanbul! The rooms are very clean and quiet, great location just minutes from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi. We met one of their guests who stays there every 6 months. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast view in the world”
Reviews.Author: Praguetraveler05-08
Reviews.Content: Hate to spoil your surprise when you get to the breakfast room since it was one of our favorite surprises in a wonderful stay at Tashkonak but I have to tell you the view is so spectacular that you will want to carry your camera with you to breakfast. The ocean on one side, the Blue Mosque on the other, the lovely scenes out the windows, the good food, the friendly guests. Wow! We chose the hotel because it said it was close to the ocean and the mosque and there was no doubt that both were within a few steps. (You'll know exactly HOW close when the prayer call is given morning and night.) The hotel staff helped us arrange side trips to other places in Turkey and good day trips some alone and some with guides within the city. They picked us up from the airport and returned us in time for the two flights we made from Istanbul during our stay. The hotel is clean and neat, good internet connection, excellent food and just all a person would need to have a really good time in an historic (not a sterile modern hotel) spot with lots of local charm. There is a good small grocery store next door (down the hill). Places to eat are all close and on the way to the Blue Mosque you will pass quite a few as well as shops where you will be tempted to spend your money. Expect to really enoy this hotel and the city and the Turkish people.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi-chick79
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Tashkonak Hotel. From when we arrived until the time that we left the staff looked after our every need. After being shown to our lovely clean room over looking the garden (as requested, due to the small mosque across the road from the hotel making a call for pray at 5am every morning) we went downstairs to be sat down and told about all the activities in the area and how to get to / from Tashkonak Hotel to those activities. This was much appreciated as it was our first time in Istanbul. There was also a free broadband computer for use of all guests which came in very useful. The breakfast had a wide variety of food and was restocked throughout the 3 hour period from 7:30am - 10:30am when it was served. The view from the breakfast room was wonderful and a lovely relaxing way to start the day before venturing out to the sights of Istanbul. The hotel is very central to the main sights including Topkapi, Hasan Sophie, the Blue mosque and the old city. In addition, it is only a 5 - 10 minute walk to the metro stop, Sultanahmet. Overall, a wonderful stay and if we are ever in Istanbul again we would not hesitate to book in at the Tashkonak.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: woorob
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Tashkonak for almost a week in March 2008. The staff is excellent, really great. The rooms are a bit small and spartan, and the hotel is located in an older (but quite safe) area that is slowly being redeveloped. The location is terrific, close to the Blue Mosque, the old city and public transportation. Some of the best staff anywhere. Great breakfast. I'd definitely stay here again (and Turkey is wonderful to visit!).

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Huzun
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights at the Tash Konak, starting 28 March 2008, in a good-sized family room at the front of the hotel with a big bay window. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a big choice of tasty things to eat at breakfast in the roof-top terrace, and spectacular views over the Sea of Marmara. The location was very handy for the Blue Mosque, Ayasofia, Topkapi and the surrounding sights. The staff arranged airport transfers at 20 euros per journey for the 4 of us. Both worked very well and took about 30 minutes. They also let us use their computer to check in online.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: AnnWorcester
Reviews.Content: My son and I have just returned from a trip to Istanbul and spent four nights at the Tashkonak. We would both recommend the hotel - the staff were friendly and helpful, it is in a very convenient position and the breakfasts were great - what a view from the breakfast room! Special thanks to the young man who gave us the practical demonstration on how to make turkish coffee! We want to come back to see more of this amazing city and will certainly stay at the Tashkonak again

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tashkonak”
Reviews.Author: Blitz007
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a trip to Istanbul and really enjoyed the experience. One of the major plus points was the Tashkonak Hotel. On arrival we found the staff very polite and helpfull. If you stay for more than 3 days there is a free pick up at the airport upon arrival, this is most usefu, as any ardent traveller will confirm arriving in any city can be overwhelming. Hotel about 20 mins from airport in the old part of Istanbul. In close proximity to all parts of the major attractions. The rooms are clean and comfortable and good value. There is a good breakfast bar on the roof top with magical views of the Sea of Marmara and the Asian side of the Bosphorus. Breakfast caters for all tastes and is a nice way to start the day. So if your looking for a moderately priced hotel in the old quarter of Istanbul that is warm and friendly I suggest you give this a try.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended place to stay”
Reviews.Author: imran_baloch
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 days during December 2007 and I enjoyed every bit of it (good rooms and great staff)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and cosy”
Reviews.Author: M_AS-Aarhus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Istanbul, stayed in Tashkonak Hotel. Felt like staying among friends and family. Very nice and calm feeling. The hotel was very cosy and warm, even if it was cold and snowy weather. Breakfast buffet original in the positive way. Excellent view from breakfast restaurant. You are in Istanbul but at the same time as at the seaside further south. Tashkonak is not a luxury hotel, thanks for that. A real and unspoiled experience of the hospitality of Istanbul and Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lydia046
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Istanbul. Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. Hotel of character, with comfortable warm rooms. An essential for this time of year. The hotel is ideally situated, in a peaceful area of the city, but close to all main sights, being within 10 minutes walk of Blue Mosque. Do ensure you have a good map though, as the streets are like a rabbit warren in this district. Very easy to get lost finding way back to hotel at first. Would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MilosBrain
Reviews.Content: This is a very friendly, clean hotel in a very good location in Istanbul. The free pickup from the airport was fantastic. Although there is a mini bar/fridge in the room, it does not stock alcohol, however there is a nice small shop around the corner which sells excellent cold beer, which the hotel owners happily showed me. Nice breakfast. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Choose the Tashkonak”
Reviews.Author: chusogarcia
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to stay in Istambul. Clean, well located and provided with a fantastic crew. Again, will be my choice for the next trip to Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “the cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Staraite
Reviews.Content: I have wonderful memories about Istanbul. I was there with my partner in Nov 2007. We both enjoyed staying at this very nice and cozy hotel. They have got a fantastic view from the top floor terrace. The hotel has a great location. It is easy to get to the most famous places of Istanbul. A surrounding of the hotel is quiet, friendly and relaxing. Also the staff of the hotel is absolutely brilliant. Perfect service!

Reviews.Title: “Almost the perfect stay during your trip in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Atheneus
Reviews.Content: It was our second visit in Istanbul and the third one will follow very soon. The Tashkonak Hotel will be again our next choice for sure! The location of the Hotel is optimum, just behind the blue mosque (Sultanahmet camii) in a very quiet side street of the old part of the town. From there on it is 5-10 minutes walk to the next tramway station and you can use the tramway to reach almost every sights in Istanbul. In the one direction to the big bazaar and the old university area, in the other direction to St. Sophia (Ayasofya), Topkapi palace, Sirkeci railway station (orient express) and to the ferries at Eminonu, as well as to the Dolmabahce Palace near the end station. From Eminonu on you can simply change to the ferries and have very nice boat rides to the anatolian part of Istanbul, to the Prince islands or even a longer trip along the Bosporus. As of the hotel itself, it is one of the old wooden houses in Istanbul, of course renovated and redecorated, very clean and offering all you need for a comfortable stay. Of course if you expect a swimming pool, a disco bar or a gourmet restaurant you should rather look for some 5-stars hotel. The rooms are rather small but not uncomfortable and have good sanitary facilities. They have good heaters for the cold months and air conditioning for the summer. You can place drinks or food in a small refrigerator in your room and you can also watch TV if you can understand the turkish language :-) The rooms are cleaned and the towels changed every day. A big cold buffet is offered in the breakfast room at the top of the hotel every morning. You can have coffee, tea, chocolate, milk and juices, as well as different sorts of cheese, sausages, jams, fresh fruits, butter or margarine, and bread or croissants. Indeed a great variety! But the best in this breakfast room is the great view overlooking the Bosporus (see attached photos)! For the hot months there is also a possibility to have breakfast in a cosy and shady garden. Let us close this report by special mentioning of the very nice and helpful staff of the hotel. They highly contributed to our enjoyable stay in Istanbul and we have to thank all them for it from this place on!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great deal”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldTravelot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tashkonak for 5 days. The rooms were warm (not a given in Dec) and spotless. The showers were hot and the bathrooms immaculate. We loved the incredible responsiveness of Tashkonak's staff. The small hotel (@30 rooms) has visitors from Turkey and around the world. We felt like we were staying in a relative's home. When we needed a rental car, a young man arrived and delivered a new car in minutes (at a far better price than I had found during my pre-arrival research). When we needed travel advice another friend of the hotel appeared in moments, gave us maps advice and zero pressure only information! The breakfasts were delicious and the view from the rooftop dining room are magical. Our flight out left at 2am. The staff woke us with a call and then called again to check that we had gotten up! They helped us with our bags and stood outside in the cold night until our taxi pulled out of sight. At 2am!!!! We can't recommend this place enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Lovely City”
Reviews.Author: JagsM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a week and will have very positive memories. Recommend the hotel very highly. What I Liked : Free pick-up from the airport, great breakfast spread and very clean rooms. Decent minibar. 5 mins walk from Sultanahmet Mosque and the Hippodrome. Free Wi-Fi (though the connection in my room tended to be a little variable - sometimes strong, other times frustratingly weak). What distinguishes the hotel from others is the staff - amazingly friendly, very helpful, extremely kind and go the extra mile to guide and help - they give the impression of not being in it for the money (give guidance on what they think are best economical deals) which was refreshing. Even the muezzin from the next door mosque calling was not disturbing (if you're worried about it, get real as in the old city you're going to get this wherever you stay as lots of mosques around). Only Suggestion for Improvement : in my room, the mattresses had become soft and weak. Recommend a change.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer4860
Reviews.Content: What you see depends on what you expect. My wife and I stayed at this marvelous little hotel for three nights. The location is perfect. You can walk to all the sights in the old city area. The rooms are "European" in that you can find yourself tripping over the bed on your way to or from anywhere in the room. Though small, they are very clean and cute. The breakfast is OK. The people at the desk (there are three that share the duty) are very helpful and between them speak many languages. If you want to experience Istanbul at a reasonable price this is a good place to start. If you want luxury and a view, this is not your kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: acgtrini
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience life in Turkey then this hotel is perfect.It's like staying in a Turkish home.The location is perfect for seeing the main sites.Walking distance from the Blue mosque,Aya Sofia,Tram station,Grand Bazaar,Basilica Cistern and many more sites.The breakfast was very good,boiled eggs,different cheeses,cold meats,olives,fruit preserves,delicious yougurt,fresh breads,tea, coffee,etc.The rooms are small,so if you have a lot of luggage it would be a challange for storage,but they are clean and the bathrooms are clean!!It was my husband and I and we were very comfortable.The staff was very friendly and very helpful.I would definitely stay in this hotel again. Couple from USA.

Reviews.Title: “TASHKONAK - a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pixiesadie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Hotel Tashkonak as a base while in Istanbul as we wanted to be able to explore on foot. The Tashkonak proved to be perfect for this as it is minutes away from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace. It is about five minutes walk to the tram allowing one to explore further afield such as the Great Bazaar, the Spice Market, Sulaiman and New Mosque, the big public baths, Rustempasa Mosque (a tiny gem), the bridge across to the Galata tower, and the ferry for trips up the Bosphorus. The room we had was smallish but attractive and more than adequate with twin beds (one of which was not very comfortable, but was changed the same day I mentioned it at the desk). Both the room and the bathroom (with shower not tub) were very clean. Our room looked out onto a small terraced garden, built against the back wall of the Blue Mosque. It was very quiet except for loud neighbours the first night. The staff were charming and helpful, and on duty 24/7. The breakfast was a buffet with meats, cheeses, eggs, yogourt, fresh fruit salads, buns, breads and many spreads. It was possible to have breakfast and only need a snack lunch. Perhaps the best thing about breakfast was the rooftop terrace restaurant in which it was served. There was a wonderful view over the city and Marmara sea, and the beginning of the Bosphorus. We enjoyed this both at breakfast, and in the evening when we looked over the lights of the city and the dozens of ships at anchor. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel to any of my friends. If, however, you are only happy in a Hilton or Holiday Inn clone just like "at home" then I suggest that you stay at one of them and leave the Hotel Tashkonak to those of us who travel to experience and enjoy another culture and people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: BB-HD
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tashkonak is a great hotel in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. Inan and his co-workers were extremely helpful. They were very willing to assist us with directions, transporation to/from airport and reservations for other activities around the city. Rooms were clean and breakfast was very good. The breakfast room is on the top floor of the hotel...great views of the city and sea. Hotel is in walking distance of most major attractions...The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Yerebeta cistern, etc. Would definitley stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “We liked Tashkonak very much”
Reviews.Author: dubrovnikMarko
Reviews.Content: My wife and me have stayed 7 nights in Tashkonak from November 2nd to November 9th 2007. We found the description offered by online-reservation correct and true. Tashkonak has first-class location. In a few minutes we were at Aya Sofya Meydani getting aboard tramway or buses. We liked the melodious call for prayer at 5.10 in the morning!!! and we were able to sleep afterwards for a while. The rooms are not large - we have moved two single beds to make one double, but they are are very clean. The breakfast terrace offers attractive Bosporus and Marmara view. The breakfast was satisfactory and the good breakfast food was Turkish (the jams were simply too sweet for me). The staff was very friendly and helpful (example: running in the heavy rain to catch the taxi for the guests). Free e-mail check and short look into our local online-news at the hotel's Internet corner was another way to make our life easier. In the hotel and at nearby news' stand we were able to get two Turkish dailies in English language: Zaman English and Turkish Daily. Restaurants' experiences: Azinade (close to Chora Church- recommended by Lonely Planet) -exciting and perfectnot cheap; Doran in Kumkapi (in the south of Kumkapi beach section) - fair seafood and rates accompanied by the good Istanbul live music; Kervansaray Evening Show - good dinner, good belly dancers, perfect animation, bad folk dances. In 8 days we did not make one negative experience in the grill-bars and restaurants. Only once in 8 days we have had the feeling to be tricked by taxi-driver (no disastrous ammount). Sometimes we were annoyed by the lack of specified meals&drinks bill in any language then Turkish - even if we did not suspect any overpricing. Istanbul is not cheap town as some other cities in the country. The ambush behaviour of the restaurants animateurs in the streets was sometimes at the edge of the tolerant mode; we would probably get used to it if spending more time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: amanah
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our long weekend in Istanbul & can't praise the hotel enough. Upon arrival in the evening, the view from our room of the Blue Mosque was spectacular & when we went for breakfast the next morning the view from the roof terrace was great. If you want to see all the main sights then this is the place to stay, right on the doorstep of the mosque & Aya Sofia with the palace not too far away. The only thing that wasn't good for us was the weather, maybe next time we will go a little earlier in the year, although the warmth of the room each night was very welcoming. Only thing missing was tea/coffee making facilities in the room, however the hotel was happy to oblige with a refreshing cup of coffee after a long day sightseeing. Great hotel, lovely breakfast & very friendly helpful staff. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I read about this little GEM is True!”
Reviews.Author: TravelSport
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this little gem of a hotel located in a beautiful local neighbourhood with minutes access to most of the oft seen attractions. The Blue Mosque is practically in it's backyard, in fact, it's minarets can be seen from the terrace restaurant while you partake of the decent breakfast offering. I enjoyed my morning coffee from here looking out at the little fishing boats and the large tankers etc, on the marmara sea and the Bhosporous. The staff were super! Especially Ergin & Savash. They made us feel at home and helped us with their polite & friendly service in every which way they could, advising & making reservations for shows etc. The room was cosy and clean (lots of stairs to climb though). They have serene back patio for quiet reflection and company. We were truly delighted with the location, service and staff. There were several good and inexpensive restaurants within walking distance including the Arasta Bazaar (worth visiting). Istanbul ... a must visit and stay here to get the real feel! I have pictures but for some reason could not include it. Check back later. JK, Toronto, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: yyromi
Reviews.Content: we just came back from Turkey. i stayed the tashkonak hotel for 6days with my mother. there are major sight seeing place near the hotel in the walk distance. the room is little bit small but it is very clean. all staff are very kind and excellent! they helped us so mush. we really recommend this hotel. if we have time to come back to Istanbul, definitely we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: jadcia101
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the hotel staff was amazing. They were so accommodating. We even showed up after having checked out of the hotel 3 days prior looking for a place to stay again. They didn't have room, but called around and walked us to another nearby hotel that did have room. The hotel staffer waited while we checked out the room to make sure it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Near the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: jbaustralia
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in Sultanamet, Hotel Tashkonak was within walking distance to everything a first time visitor to Istanbul would wish to see. The best rooms overlook the garden and double rooms have either double or twin beds, so it is best to be specific if you wish a double bed. The staff were wonderful; so very friendly and helpful. The view from the roof-top breakfast room was superb as too was the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: golisw
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Its very cute and cozy. Its in an old wooden building with old decorations. The breakfast was great, on the roof top. You have options of indoor or outdoor dining, all with great views. The rooms are small, but thats the way they are in most areas. Our room even had a balcony that overlooked the pretty courtyard. The service was great. Since its on a side street, pay attention to getting back. We would definitely recommend this hotel over and over again. We are quite disappointed that we stayed in a different hotel our last night in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: david_rushe
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights and the hotel complimented a great Istanbul experience. It is very conveniently located near the Blue Mosque, Ayia Sofya and all the major sights can be easily reached, yet it was very quiet at night apart from the call to prayer at 5am. Our room, a double room, was small but not at all cramped and it was kept clean throughout our stay. Breakfast,served over a beautiful view of the Sea of Marmara was simple and tasty. The staff were excellent and very attentive, providing assitance to any travel queries we had. Our flight was 40 mins late and the airport pick-up waited for us and we were at the hotel within 30 mins. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to travel to Istanbul for any length of stay

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay in September”
Reviews.Author: irisMiskolc
Reviews.Content: Situated in the historic heart of Istanbul, the Tashkonak hotel offers you easy access to the main sights. Delicious breakfast, cleanliness and the competent, freindly and helpful staff contributed to our very pleasant stay there. September,2007 Mr.& Mrs. PethÅ‘ (from Hungary)

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Dorito50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tash Konak twice within a three-week period while in and out of Istanbul in May. Although the location was extremely convenient and the facilities charming, the real strength of this boutique hotel is its staff, which went an extra two miles to be helpful and friendly. They made it feel as if we were staying with friends. The breakfast was one of the better Turkish breakfasts we had during a month in Turkey, which means it was as good as vegetables, bread and Nescafe get. We had two different rooms during our stay, both of which were adequate in size though not roomy. However, for the price, the entire package was an extremely good value and especially recommended for the value traveler who prefers properties with character and intimacy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RaymondEmile
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, central location near Blue Mosque. Breakfast room on the terrace roof overlooking Marmara Sea. Friendly staff. Wifi in the lobby only, no access in the bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Friendly and Perfect Llocation”
Reviews.Author: Victorianglasses
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tashkonak for 3 days in mid April, 2007. Our second room floor was spacious, clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast of juices, meats, cheeses, breads, fresh fruit, eggs, cereals, teas and coffee, and more, on the indoor/outdoor roof terrace with a view on one side of the Blue Mosque and on the other of the Sea of Marmara and the entrance to the Bosphorous, was a perfect way to start the day. The friendly and good humoured staff, most of whom spoke English, were always ready to be helpful on any matter, big or small, and generally made us feel as if we were members of their extended family. Located on a quiet street, around the corner from the Blue Mosque, and within a short walk of the Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace, and about a 15 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, the Tashkonak is a perfect base for exploring the Sultanahmet District, which was the heart of the Ottoman and Byzantine Empires.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it seems”
Reviews.Author: undercoverelephant
Reviews.Content: When I saw the reviews on trip advisor, I was looking forward to staying at this hotel. Reading the reviews, it must be, in my opinion, a hotel in a different dimension, because there is nothing boutique about this hotel whatsoever. In fact it is more like a upmarket backpackers hostel than hotel. The transport from the airport is a dirty minibus, and will save you 8 euro's over a taxi. (so take the taxi). There are plenty of proper boutique hotels away from the old town. In fact there are plenty of good hotels for the same price, if you can be bothered to do some research Yes, the staff are charming, but so is Aberdeen, when the sun comes out. if you do not mind cheap and cheerful, and (or) you are as poor as three church mice, or you are a backpacker stay here, but otherwise pick up lonely planet or something in that vein and choose elsewhere. Trust me, you will be grateful.

HotelInfo.Name: Tashkonak Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kucukayasofya cad. Tomurcuk sok. no. 5 Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
